l;ex
Approaching the Camp
  To the northeast, the snow-shrouded bulk of the long dormant volcano
dominates the horizon.  Even at this distance, the fearsome winds of the
upper slopes are made visible through the wisps of snow streaming from the
peak.  There are two constants in this frozen wasteland - the terrible cold,
so intense it easily penetrates clothing, flesh, sinew and bone, and the
wintry landscape, a pallid white as far as the eye can see.  Here and there
a skeletal tree, branches encased in ice, provides some small respite from
the dreary continuity.  A wide swath of snow has been tramped down by the
passing of dozens of booted feet.  It leads off to the east where a camp of
some sort can be seen, a trickle of rising smoke giving evidence of
habitation.  

[ Exits: east west ]

Poppa gossips 'it's what we are you thugtician:P'

help scry
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Scry.
Help Category : Detection.
Related Helps : Wish.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-27 23:37:31.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast scry <target>
Spell Number: 236

Using this ancient art, a high-powered spellcaster can magically spy upon
others from afar.  The target will only sense a presence, but will never know
who exactly it was.  However, some characters have been able to wish for the
ability to see who is scrying them, and the caster will never be quite sure
who has been granted this wish.

Primary Stats: Int, Wis, Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

840/984 HP  983/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Cradlebrook Market (NESW)
>>   

A tepid, strong wind blows from the east.
A storm begins to form.

TrEz gossips 'im a warlord'

w
A Small Road in Cradlebrook
  Beneath you is a small cobblestone road worn smooth and thin by years of use
by the villagers.  A simple stone house is west, the cobblestones leading to
its front door.  There seem to be fewer people here, the road worn but less
used than the one across the river.  A wooden footbridge leads east across
the river.  The cobblestones extend to the north and south.

[ Exits: north east south (west) ]
A surly looking youth passes you by.
A villager stands here.

>>   The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

In Black Cat Tower (G)
  The very air seems to resonate with an electrical intensity inside the
Mages' Guild.  Groups of novices move throughout the tower, making their way
to this or that class, while experienced Spellcasters take advantage of the
libraries or perhaps use the common room as a place to catch up on some
reading.  Familiars are also in evidence-- many of them the sort of onyx
felines that gave the tower its nickname-- running, flying, slithering, or in
some cases oozing in pursuit of some errand given them by their masters. 
The upper levels of the tower are accessed by a series of levitation tubes
that gently pull entering sorcerers up to the next level of the tower.  The
Tower of Sorcery is a place of exotic enchantments and curious cantrips
where wizards of all stripes can find something to learn if pride will let
them be taught.  

[ Exits: north up ]

Character autosaved at Sun Jul 30 11:40:24 2023.

n
The Grand Plaza
  The air in the southeast corner of the plaza seems constantly charged
with magic.  The Tower of the Mind to the east houses the Guild of
Psionicists, its stones supposedly individually laid using only psychic
will.  To the south is the Tower of Sorcery, colloquially referred to as
Black Cat Tower, which houses the Mages' Guild.  This tower's appearance is
by far the most extreme of all, with several of its higher spires completely
detached from the main structure and floating in the air.  Powerful
sorcerers levitate out from the central edifice at impossible heights in
order to reach the magically-suspended satellite towers where only the most
exalted of the Guild are allowed to congregate.  Like the other guild towers,
these are guarded against outsiders.  Here and there herbalists shout the
lists of exotic spell ingredients they have for sale, while mentalists offer
up a panoply of concentration aids.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

903/984 HP  398/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   
n
The Grand Plaza
  In contrast to the somber reputation of the arch marking the western
entrance to the plaza, the Sunrise Arch is a place to celebrate new life. 
When the New Year's procession winds through the streets, it is tradition
for the celebrants to write their worries of the old year on scrolls and
toss them into a fire built under the arch.  The stone has been stained
black with the soot of a million fears, and each sunrise is a pyre to
consume them again.  At night, the arch is a favored meeting place of
conspirators.  All varieties of hooded figures skulk here by night, before
wandering off to conduct their business.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

903/984 HP  398/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   
e
Fairdeal Alley
  You stand in Fairdeal Alley just east of Meridian Square.  The light has
dimmed as you stand in the shadows of the spires that tower over the city. 
Looking around at the people occupying the alley, you notice that the people
seem friendly.  Perhaps a little too friendly.  While there is no reason to
be suspicious, a nagging feeling gnaws at the pit of your stomach.  

[ Exits: east west ]

903/984 HP  398/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Fairdeal Alley (EW)
>>   
e
Fairdeal Alley
  Looking down at the roadway that makes up Fairdeal Alley, you notice that
it is slightly bumpy and jagged.  A pleasant and interesting design, it
appears as though the road is paved with coins.  Gold coins of various
denominations have been etched into the ground, making it look as though you
are walking on money.  You feel the desire to bend down and touch the coins
to make sure they are not real, but the amount of people around you deters
your actions.  You wouldn't want to look foolish now, would you?  

[ Exits: east south west ]

Fairdeal Alley (G)
  Fairdeal Alley is comprised of a number of 'stands' which are nothing
more than simple tables or crates with odds and ends scattered about them. 
Other 'dealers' are searching for artifacts rare in nature.  Some people eye
you with suspicion, others with the delight of another chance to peddle
their wares.  The alley continues north and south, where it turns to head
towards Meridian Square.

Fairdeal Alley (G)
  The dimly lit Fairdeal Alley continues north and south.  The alley is

itself as that size.  To the west, the spires of Meridian Square tower

n
Fairdeal Alley (G)
  You enter into a dim alley.  The alley is not dark or dingy, nor is it
cluttered or messy.  It is just an alley, and the road is paved to look like
it is covered in gold coins of various denominations.  You get the feeling,
though, that even though the alley is not dark or messy or dingy, it is the
sort of place, given its occupants, that very well should be.  To the north,
the slightly more secure Starlight Way runs east and west through the city.
To the south, Fairdeal Alley takes you to a point that is less readily
escapable.  

[ Exits: north south ]

Starlight Way - East (G)
  The sounds of the armor and weapon shops continue from the north, and the
sweet scents of flowers and pastries permeate the air.  To the south lies
the narrower path of Fairdeal Alley, appropriately named as it stretches
from the east and west wares districts of Aylor.  The Starlight Way
continues east and west with its haunting midnight glow.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>   
Bookworm's Haven
  This is the only store that is on the ground level.  In each direction
(except to the south) marble ramps rise up to other platforms with more
goods for adventurers to buy.  This particular marble slab holds a small
bookstore with many racks of books and guides which apparently sell like
hotcakes, since many of the slots are now empty and vacant.  You begin to
think the store is unmanned until you notice a transparent shadow behind the
desk.  

On the wall you notice a PLAQUE showing the Aardwolf Trivia Hall of Fame.

Starlight Way - East (G)
  Starlight Way continues to the east and west through the grand City of
Aylor.  To the north, you can smell the fresh baked goods of the bakery and
hear the distinct metal-on-metal sound of weapons being tested before
purchase.  The sounds of the armorer announcing his goods also hail from
the north.  This district of town is full of young adventurers haggling for
the best prices on well crafted materials.  In the distance, the solemn
echoes of church bells provide a deep harmony.

w
>>   Starlight Way - East
  There is something enchanting about walking along the night sky in the middle
of the day, as you continue down the starry path. To the east, you hear the 
bustling activities of adventurers doing their business, purchasing wares, 
and selling off the gains of their toils. Above the clatter you hear someone 
say in a prominent voice, "What?? I don't get it!". The rich smells of breads
and pies fill the air. In the distance, you hear the faint sound of drunken 
dwarves singing.

  Closely examining the onyx-black road of Starlight Way, you perceive tiny

could, quite literally, become lost in the soothing abyss of the faux night
road.

>>   Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,

stands high above the city.

941/984 HP  19/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
s
>>   
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) Lorric the Crafter.
(Player) (Linkdead) Higat the Bandit.
(Player) (Linkdead) Geril is here.
(Player) Poppa don't preach.. I've been losing sleep!.
(Player) (Linkdead) (OPK) Icaerus looks for rare mobs..
(Player) (Hidden) (Translucent) (Linkdead) Ratel loves aardwolf.
(Player) (OPK) Forma not formatted.

>>   
Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

[ Exits: north south down ]

968/984 HP  44/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)

>>   
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

968/984 HP  44/1378 MP  1262/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>   
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

968/984 HP  44/1378 MP  1261/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Recreation Room (ESW)
w
>>   Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

968/984 HP  44/1378 MP  1260/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>   Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve 10 is resting here.
(Player) Morgawr the Barbarian.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

>>   
Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.

984/984 HP  1228/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>   
help scry
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Scry.
Help Category : Detection.
Related Helps : Wish.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-27 23:37:31.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast scry <target>
Spell Number: 236

Using this ancient art, a high-powered spellcaster can magically spy upon
others from afar.  The target will only sense a presence, but will never know
who exactly it was.  However, some characters have been able to wish for the
ability to see who is scrying them, and the caster will never be quite sure
who has been granted this wish.

Primary Stats: Int, Wis, Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

984/984 HP  1228/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Medical lounge (E[D])

Rotting Field

the ones that remain bear small and sour fruit.  Several trees are blown
over, leaving rotting logs which fill the air with the sour stench of
fungus.  A dark grove, surrounding a tower, lies to the southeast.

e
Rotting Field
  Sparse fruit trees straggle from the ground.  Many are dead or dying, and
the ones that remain bear small and sour fruit.  Several trees are blown
over, leaving rotting logs which fill the air with the sour stench of
fungus.  A dark grove, surrounding a tower, lies to the northeast.  A long
road stretches north and south beside the fields.  As you watch, something
is heaved from a top window of the tower, and clatters into the grove with a
metallic thud.

Rotting Field
  Sparse fruit trees straggle from the ground.  Many are dead or dying, and
the ones that remain bear small and sour fruit.  Several trees are blown
over, leaving rotting logs which fill the air with the sour stench of
fungus.  A dark grove, surrounding a tower, lies to the southeast.

Geysirjokull (1157)

You feel yourself slow down.
Approaching the Camp
  To the northeast, the snow-shrouded bulk of the long dormant volcano
dominates the horizon.  Even at this distance, the fearsome winds of the
upper slopes are made visible through the wisps of snow streaming from the
peak.  There are two constants in this frozen wasteland - the terrible cold,
so intense it easily penetrates clothing, flesh, sinew and bone, and the
wintry landscape, a pallid white as far as the eye can see.  Here and there
a skeletal tree, branches encased in ice, provides some small respite from
the dreary continuity.  A wide swath of snow has been tramped down by the
passing of dozens of booted feet.  It leads off to the east where a camp of
some sort can be seen, a trickle of rising smoke giving evidence of
habitation.  

[ Exits: east west ]

984/984 HP  1122/1378 MP  1156/1263 mv  860tnl

n
The Human Refugee Camp
  The human occupants of this ramshackle refugee camp consist almost
entirely of children and the elderly.  Those few that are outdoors, braving
the bitter cold, huddle about a small cook fire, arms extended, palms near
the flames.  To the east and south stand the two largest shelters found in
the camp.  With walls of lashed-together sticks and roofs of straw, these
meager structures are little more than hastily constructed huts.  Numerous
bootprints mark the snow, entering the camp from east and continuing on, in
much smaller numbers, to the north.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     An iron cookpot simmers, suspended over the flames.
A wrinkled old man slowly stirs the pot.

An elderly man moans, his bones aching from the cold.

>>   At the Foot of the Volcano
  Here at the foot of the looming volcano, no wind blows, no animal calls
out and an eerie quiet abides.  Scraggly bushes, half buried in the deep
snow, provide shelter for the snowshoe rabbits which frequent this area.  A
small snare rests nearby, presently empty and unsprung.  A trail of boot
prints enters from the camp to the south and then turns east toward the
volcano's slopes.  

[ Exits: east south ]
The human hunter traps small game to feed his people.

>>   On a Snowbound Trail
  The entire Tbir Mountain is covered in snow.  The trail is buried
somewhere underneath several feet of snow, making travel up the side of the
mountain very treacherous.  Large trees can be seen in the distance, each
tree covered in icicles and the branches sag from the weight of the snow and
ice.  The freezing winds blow snow around on the ground leaving any
footprints covered.  Few people are willing to take the trek up the
mountain, as many who have, have never returned.

On a Bleak Trail
  The mountain looms drearily over the campgrounds.  The desolate state of
the humans leaves little hope for them.  The snow seems to be never-ending
as it lightly falls yet again on the mountain.  The skies above are overcast
with dull grey clouds; it seems the sun never shines.  The mountain begins
to slope upwards here, a slight slope at first, but ahead it can be
discerned that the slope becomes greater.

On a Treacherous Trail
  The snow covered rocks of the mountain make walking nearly impossible. 
The rocks shift and move with each footstep, leaving little room for
mistakes in climbing the large mountain.  The trek up the side of the
mountain seems endless as the wind begins to blow a bit harder.  Snow falls
lightly upon the ground, burying the pathway even further under all the snow
that has fallen already.  Footprints do not stay visible long, as the
falling snow and windy conditions seem to quickly cover them.

On a Rugged Trail
  The rocks of the mountain seem to taper off here, although ahead more can
be seen.  The path isn't clear of rocks, but walking is a bit easier at this
point.  In the distance, a snowshoe rabbit can be seen in search for food. 
Although the rabbit blends in very well with the snow, it can be spotted due
to the dark color on the tip of the ears.  Even for the animals that live on
the mountain, food is very scarce.  The humans hunt the rabbits for food,
but due to the quickness of the rabbit, actually killing one for food is
rare.  

[ Exits: east west ]

984/984 HP  1197/1378 MP  1238/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | On a Rugged Trail (EW)
>>   On a Rocky Trail
  The rocks are bigger here than they are lower down the mountainside,
making it harder to navigate.  The rocks are big enough that the only way
across some of them is to climb over them.  The snow on the rocks makes it
very hard to get a good footing on them, thus making it very easy to slip. 
One wrong move could prove to be deadly, sending an adventurer tumbling to
their death on the jagged rocks below.  The climb up the mountain is
dangerous, although many humans have attempted the trek for the legendary
Fire Gem in hopes of bringing warmth back to the outside world.

[ Exits: east up ]

u
On a Deadly Trail
  Partially covered in bloodstained snow is a half eaten human corpse.  It
is unclear if the human died from the freezing cold of the snow and wind,
and was then eaten, or if some savage animal attacked it and killed it for
food.  Either way, the remains are now frozen in time from the elements of
the severe snow storm.  The body couldn't have been here too awfully long,
as it would be completely covered in snow, or perhaps it has been dug up for
yet another meal before the body completely froze.  

[ Exits: east down ]

The Rim of the Crater
  The end of the difficult climb is marked with the rim of a giant crater. 
A tepid breeze blows up from within the volcano, while darkness swirls
around the adventurers who have dared to breach the isolation of the
volcano.  The inner wall of the crater is marked with niches for people to
attempt to climb down.

Within the Crater
  The bottom of the crater is marred by small rocks, large rocks - all
kinds of stones have been scattered around the dusty floor, with some rocks
as large as a small house.  The dust is disturbed by footprints of the
humans who have struggled past, going east and south through the few viable
paths in the rocks.  Creatures laugh at the hapless adventurers from their
safe perch at the rim of the crater, for they know, of those who have gone
down, few have returned intact.

Within the Crater
  A meandering path is faintly scored on the dusty floor, winding through
the larger rocks.  The west is obscured by the self-same rocks which prevent
easy passage, and an eerie whistling emits from the south, where an outline
of a massive gate can be seen.  A distant light softens the hard rocks and
illuminates a kind of path for the weary to tread, accompanied by voices
from none know where, inanely pleading and begging for a salvation no one
can give.

s
>>   Before the Massive Gates
  Huge black gates loom over the scrawny adventurers, seeking the heat that
the volcano hides.  The slightly augmented temperature is the sole thing
that guides these poor half-frozen souls up here.  The gate is forbidding,
almost mocking in its severity and austerity.  Its sole purpose is to keep
those in need out.  To that end, two burly guards, wielding spears, stand
here and jeer at the pathetic sight the humans portray, occasionally jabbing
at them with their weapons.

984/984 HP  1197/1378 MP  1222/1263 mv  860tnl  
Lv 47  G 161274 | Before the Massive Gates (NEW)
>>   Entryway to the City
  Carved deep into the side of the crater, this cavernous chamber is a
testament to the skill of dwarven excavators, engineers and artisans. 
Torches mounted in iron brackets illuminate the elaborately etched basalt
walls.  Depicted are what appear to be scenes of battle from throughout the
Swordbreaker clan's history.  In one tableau, Tbir Swordbreaker himself is
shown standing atop a mountain of corpses, holding high a gleaming gemstone.
An enormous flight of stone steps, stretching from one side of the chamber
to the next, descends into the volcano's depths.  To the west stand the
massive black gates, leading back to the crater and the brutal cold.  

[ Exits: west down ]

At Street's Beginning
  The street begins here, at the foot of the great stairs, and then slopes
gently downward to the north.  Cobbled with precisely fitted granite blocks,
it is a work of masterful masonry.  Warmth emanates from deeper within the
city along with the sounds and smells of a bustling dwarven metropolis.

A Spotless Street Corner

At a Grand Intersection
  The street continues at a minor downward incline, east to west.  On the
southern side, partly fashioned out of colossal granite blocks and partly

a garrison through the bark of officers shouting orders and the clatter of

A Striking Street Corner
  The street enters from the east, turns a corner and then continues on to
the south.  On the western side, recessed into the tunnel wall, is yet
another dwarven residence.  Built with the same dark volcanic rock used
extensively throughout the city, the stone used in this structure bears one
striking difference from that seen elsewhere - each brick is veined with
quartz and the entire structure is assembled in such a way that those veins
are aligned from one brick to the next.  This has the rather spectacular
effect of suggesting a giant spider's web, spun in pearlescent white across
the entire face of the building.  

[ Exits: east south (west) ]
A dwarven artisan, her belt brimming with tools, hurries along the street.
Eyes downcast, this plainly attired dwarf sweeps the street.
No one would dare discipline this misbehaving dwarven child.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (632)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

where a huge tree climbs high into the sky. The tree is so large it casts a 
shadow over you, blocking the warmth of the sun.

984/984 HP  914/1378 MP  1263/1263 mv  601tnl  
Lv 47  G 162825 | Snowy plains (ES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
help meditate
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : MEDITATION MEDITATE.
Help Category : Survival.
Related Helps : Vitality, Fast healing.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-31 22:28:29.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

This is an automatic skill.

Through training the mind, certain characters are able to use focus and
concentration when resting in order to increase their mana recovery
rate. Meditation skill is checked every tick, and if successful, you
will recover more mana.

Primary stat: Intelligence.
Affected by : Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

984/984 HP  1007/1378 MP  1251/1263 mv  601tnl  
Lv 47  G 162825 | A damp tundra (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The twin pines
  You are standing before a tall pine tree. Legend has it that this tree was 
planted with its twin to celebrate the life and love of Rythemus and Lantana.
They died tragically in this spot. Upon their death the land grew cold and 
barren. Their friend, Thylinimus, planted these two trees as a memorial, and 
the trees immediately began to grow. These two trees still survive as a 
symbol of their love and devotion to each other - one of the signs of hope on
this desolate tundra.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

This pine tree grows healthy and vibrant, a sign of hope.

At the Town Gates of Dharivian
  The huge gates are wide open, and the guard posted there gives you a warm
and friendly greeting.  It strikes you as out-of-place, though, as you
meander through the streets.  The crowds open before you like a parting sea-
the citizens of Dharivian act as though they're afraid you'll pass the
plague onto them.  Not that this is a place ripe for brewing disease - the
wooden buildings to either side of the street are freshly painted, and yards
neatly kept.  Even the dirt roads are free of debris, and when a child
carelessly tosses an apple core to the ground, her mother screams in fear
and gives her a swat.  Apparently littering isn't too popular here.  

[ Exits: east west ]
One of the Queen's scurrying subjects avoids your gaze.
One of the Queen's scurrying subjects avoids your gaze.

758/984 HP  738/1378 MP  1219/1263 mv  601tnl  
Lv 47  G 163070 | At the Town Gates of Dharivian (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
On the Streets of Dharivian (G)
  The deeper you penetrate this large town, the more you get the feeling
that something is terribly wrong here.  Even in the thickest crowds, not a
single pickpocket has made an attempt at your gold, and you haven't even
seen any beggars.  The towers of the royal palace loom larger as you draw
near to it, casting shadows so deep that odd glass balls filled with glowing
insects have been set on poles to provide illumination.  It's when you reach
the gates of the palace itself that you spot a sign that might explain the
paranoid behavior of the populace.  

[ Exits: north west ]
One of the Queen's scurrying subjects avoids your gaze.
One of the Queen's scurrying subjects avoids your gaze.

758/984 HP  738/1378 MP  1218/1263 mv  601tnl  
Lv 47  G 163070 | On the Streets of Dharivian (NW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Palace of Queen Jula (G)
  The Dharivian palace is truly a marvel to behold.  No doubt, the
tyrannies of Queen Jula must have included severe taxes to pay for the
furnishings here.  The walls are plated in pure gold, with trimmings of
glistening silver, and precious jewels were used to form murals on the
walls.  These pictures, of course, portray the Queen at her most beauteous,
as a conquering hero and gracious ruler.  You find the Queen herself holding
court in the main hall, mounted on a throne carved from emerald, high above
everybody else on her dais.  Oh, well.  Better luck next life.  

[ Exits: south ]
Queen Jula receives the adoration of her evil court.
A fawning courtier points at you and LAUGHS!
A fawning courtier points at you and LAUGHS!
A fawning courtier points at you and LAUGHS!
A fawning courtier points at you and LAUGHS!
The bored Queen spots you, and her eyes light up. "The entertainment has arrived!"
With a nasty cackle, she points at you, and black light takes you far, far away...
The Entrance(?) to the Labyrinth
  The deathberry hedges of Dharivian are famed throughout the world.  Not
only do they bear heavy clusters of fruit in the form of luscious, poisonous
berries, but they can easily be shaped into all sorts of forms.  In this
case, the magic of Queen Jula has forced the shrubbery into long, enclosed
corridors.  The branches lace together overhead, forming a roof a hundred
feet high, and the passages are wide enough that several giants could walk
abreast.  You can see nothing but green and the occasional splash of scarlet
berry in every direction.  

[ Exits: north south ]
     (Magic) A plaque floats in the air, bright red words glowing on it.
(Hidden) A grimlock's body bristles with popping muscles.
A monstrous centipede scurries along on dozens of feet.

A Lupine Corridor in the Labyrinth
  The labyrinth continues.  Here the neat grass present in the rest of the
maze has been worn away by the passage of many creatures.  This makes it a
lot easier to spot the yellowed bones of animals scattered down the length
of this corridor and avoid tripping over them.  Grizzled grey tufts of
coarse fur have been captured by the deathberry thorns, and large pawprints
have been embedded in the bare earth.  From here, you can head east or
south.  

[ Exits: east south ]

fl
A Nauseating Corridor in the Labyrinth
  The labyrinth continues.  No sunlight or moonlight penetrates the curved,
thorny ceiling high above, leaving the passageways of the maze in darkness
similar to that of the day's dying rays.  It's not easy to see here without
straining one's eyes.  Those bright scarlet deathberries shine though, their
venomous fruit glowing with an inner, magic light.  They look mighty
tempting, attested to by the various bird carcasses laying near the hedge
walls.  Needless to say, the odor in the air here is nauseating.  Want to
get away from it?  Head north, east, or west.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A hobgoblin warrior lovingly fingers his weapons.
(Invis) A cat-shaped demon grins, seeking the next best opportunity to do evil.
A hobgoblin warrior lovingly fingers his weapons.
A skum desperately searches for enough water to live in.
A sneaky little gnome tries to amass gold even here.
You flee from combat!
You lose 10 exp for your cowardice.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)

this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.

this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Before the East Entrance (G)
  You stand just at the east entrance to the Underdark.  Before you looms a
huge cavern, or so you think, since you can't tell with your eyes.  Darkness
is everywhere, there is a layer of light that has been formed by a series of
floating orbs that rest above your head.  Above this layer of light, darkness
lies.  It is because of this that you think you stand in a huge cavern.  The
air smells of thousands living in a confined space with little fresh air.  The
air itself is moist and warm.  Sounds assault your ears, not just the buzzing
of people, but also agonized screams.  The shadows seem to speak of
death.  Welcome to the Underdark. 
 
The north and south is Sunrise, to the east is the entrance and to the west is
the Slaver's Route and farther down, the market area.

Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]

>>   
n
n
The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A stout dwarf, Wesnir, walks slowly, admiring the views of Aylor.

984/984 HP  1378/1378 MP  946/1263 mv  611tnl  
Lv 47  G 205901 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
n
>>   Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure water.

984/984 HP  1378/1378 MP  946/1263 mv  611tnl  
Lv 47  G 205901 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
n
>>   The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

984/984 HP  1378/1378 MP  946/1263 mv  611tnl  
Lv 47  G 205901 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
>>   North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
An elven child walks by, hoping to find someone to play with.
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

help chat
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Channels.
Help Category : Communication.
Related Helps : Channel Rules, Class Channels, Colorset, Say.
Last Updated  : 2021-01-30 15:35:48.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Basic Syntax: Type 'Channels' to see a list.
              Type [channel name] to toggle on / off.
              Use '[channel] *off [minutes]' to turn off temporarily.
              Use 'channels curse' to see a list of curse allowed channels.
              Use '[channel] -h' or '[channel] -h <# lines / text>' to see 
              channel history.

Further details and other usage options are in the wall of text below.

There are many means of communication on Aardwolf and channels are one of
the most important.  Channels on Aardwolf can change dynamically based on
topics relevant at the time.  To see a list of channels, type 'channels'.
To toggle a channel on or off, type its name.

Each class also has its own private channel which only members of that
class can see. These are covered in 'help class channels'.  Information on
each channel's particular rules and guidelines can be found in 'help 
<channel name>', e.g., 'help racetalk'.

Most channels have a history feature.  To see the history on a channel, use
the syntax '<channelname> -h'.  For example, 'gossip -h 10' will show the
last 10 lines on gossip, while 'answer -h' will show all available lines of
history on the question/answer channel.  You can also use the -h feature to
search for text on a channel; for example, 'gossip -h ivar' will search for
all gossip history containing 'ivar'.  Ignored players (see 'help ignore')
will still show up in channel history.  Note that you can either search or
specify a number of lines, but not both.

To search for a number without the MUD interpreting it as a number of
lines, use the syntax "gossip -h '20'" (this shows all gossip history
containing the number 20).

There are some special commands that can be used on channels to do emotes, 
socials and other actions. Using gossip as an example:

   Use a social on a channel       : gossip *smile
                                     gossip *smile ivar
   Use an emote on a channel       : gossip :emotes something
   Use emote to think on a channel : gossip *think this is cool
   Use emote to say on a channel   : gossip *say say is cool too :)
   Use dice on a channel           : gossip *dice 10 5

The following is a list of channels approved for profane language:

   Clantalk*   Curse       Ftalk       Gclan     Gtell       
   Helper      Immtalk     Mchat       Music     Pokerinfo   
   Spouse      Sports      Debate

* Though the channel is flagged for curse socials, clans may have their own
policies regarding profane language.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1045/984 HP  1254/1378 MP  1000/1263 mv  548tnl

w
Ancient Room
  You are standing in a large stone room.  Feels like a crypt.  Ancient
murals of Hell and punishment cover the walls.  In the middle of the room
are stairs that lead down in to the darkness.  From the stairway you can

Hall of the Damned (1198)

Hall of the Damned
  This hallway is a monument to the millions of damned souls in hell.  The
walls are made up of various body parts and other unidentifiable things. 
Many of the faces that make up the wall scream out to you for help.  Their
arms desperately grasp at your clothing as you pass.

sounds of torture and pain.  Screams pierce the air and rattle your nerves.

gate towers over you to the east.

Corn Fields (1187)

Mons Brevia (1186)

Mons Brevia (1185)

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1184/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Approaching a small mining camp (SU)
>>   
s
Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north (south) ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1181/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Just outside Sargasso (N[S])
>>   
op s
s
You open the wooden gate.

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1181/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Just outside Sargasso (NS)
>>   Inside Sargasso's gate
  Still a bit groggy from your difficult journey (and because you've just
recovered from passing out) you feel extremely disoriented, and in fact
almost feel like you have to pass out again.  Harnessing all your strength
and all your will, you manage to fight off the urge.  Who knows WHERE you
might end up if you were to fall unconscious again!  After the dizzy
spell passes, you notice that you are inside a small mining settlement that
has mysteriously sprung up by the mountain.  The ground beneath your feet is
composed of a dark brown substance that is similar to dirt, but feels a bit
more squishy beneath your feet.  What strikes you most of all, however, is
the fact that no one seems to be happy.  They are too concerned with making
money, many having presumably left behind their wives and children in hopes
of making a quick gold coin.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1178/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Inside Sargasso's gate (NESW)

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1178/1263 mv  444tnl

where 1.Reverend Jeremiah
Reverend Jeremiah              Revival Tent

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1178/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Inside Sargasso's gate (NESW)
>>   
w
Wandering along a dirt path
  As a grizzled prospector shuffles past you, you notice that he is not in
good health.  In fact, everyone seems to be physically exhausted and
mentally anguished.  All the non-stop mining is what hurts them so much. 
Ripped tents dot the settlement in a very erratic pattern: three are clustered
to the north, then there is a large gap between those and the next tent 300
meters away.  You get the impression that people just don't care anymore! 
As you walk on a little bit further, you see a note attached to one of the
tents to your south.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
One of Sargasso's guards is here slacking off.
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
A sargasso miner shuffles along lazily here.

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1177/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (NEW)
w
>>   
Wandering along a dirt path
  You continue along the dirt path in western Sargasso, and the random
arrangement of tents continues all around you.  The settlement wall (if you
can call it that) lies a little ways to the north, but there are so many
rocks in the way that proceeding farther in that direction would be
impossible.  The wind picks up again and you choke and gag as you inhale
some of the horrid dust-stuff.  Muttering something about stupid mining
settlements, you decide to put up with the wind and simply press onwards. 
The large tent to the west looks rather safe compared with the hot wind and
dust you have to deal with outside.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
One of Sargasso's guards is here slacking off.

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1176/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (ESW)
>>   
s
Wandering along a dirt path
  The dirt path ends rather abruptly, giving way to a wooden structure to
the south.  A large sign rests in front of the iron door, and a tiny
tumbleweed floats across your vision.  You grin nervously as you remember
that if the DIRT of this settlement is weird, then maybe this tumbleweed is
too.  The city wall lies beyond the building to your south, while part of
Sargasso's principal mine shaft is to your east - too bad you can only enter
by going south from the center of town.  A large tent is to your west, while
another, uninhabited one lies south; you get the feeling that the latter
plays a huge role in the safety of the camp.  

[ Exits: north south west ]

984/984 HP  997/1378 MP  1175/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (NSW)
>>   
w
Inside a large tent
  Compared with the rest of Sargasso, this fairly large tent is organized
and clean, although by no means would it ever win any awards for odor.  It
smells like rotten meat inside, and a careful inspection reveals a dead rat
carcass in one of the corners of the tent.  How utterly sick!  Perhaps this
tent isn't so clean after all.  Shaking your head, you decide to leave the
citizens of Sargasso to their own devices.  Let them wallow in their own
filth.

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1221/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (NSW)
s
>>   Inside the sheriff's office
  The iron door behind you slowly creaks shut, making a horrible grating
sound as the metal scrapes the oak floor.  A pile of very important looking
documents rests below a stone gargoyle-like paperweight.  A birchwood file
cabinet lies in the northeast corner of the room, accumulating dust. 
Evidently, it has not been used in a very long while.  You grimace as you
realize how chaotic the scene is - like everyone else in the town, the
sheriff doesn't seem to care about anyone except himself.  You advance
carefully towards the sheriff's desk, making sure that there are no loose
planks in the floor - if you were to fall through it would be a MASSIVE case
of "I've fallen and I can't get up."  I don't think anyone wants to relive
THAT nightmare again.  

[ Exits: north ]
One of Sargasso's guards is here slacking off.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
A sargasso miner shuffles along lazily here.

A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
(White Aura) Jack the Sheriff sits at the desk looking very tired.
Jack the Sheriff says, "Welcome to Sargasso. Strange things have been
 discovered in the mine shaft at the town's center."
Jack the Sheriff sighs.
Jack the Sheriff says, "If you could find anything out, the citizens would
 be grateful."

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1217/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Inside Sargasso's gate (NESW)
e
>>   
Wandering along a dirt path
  You hear a very soft hissing noise at your feet as you begin to enter the
heart of Sargasso village, a true heart of darkness.  Startled, you quickly
look at your feet and discover the hugest rattlesnake you have ever seen! 
You jump up - not out of fright, of course - and with a quick thrust, bring
your boot down upon the creature with a sickening *squish* sound.  Yuck. 
Icky black blood splatters all over the place, including on your pants and
armor.  Maybe you'll send everything to be dry cleaned this week.  

[ Exits: (north) east west ]

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1216/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path ([N]EW)
e
>>   
Wandering along a dirt path
  You begin to choke and gag as you walk about this part of Sargasso. 
Repugnant black smoke fills the whole entire area to your north, and you
know that if you were to go any further that your life would be in great
peril.  As the smog extends its tendrils towards you, almost grasping at your
throat, you back away nervously.  As you do so, the smoke seems to sense
that it cannot take hold of you and thus it backs off.  That was a close
call, perhaps closer than you realize.  The dirt path continues to the south
and a very large, well constructed tent is to your east.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
One of Sargasso's guards is here slacking off.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1215/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (ESW)
e
>>   
Inside a large tent
  This tent doesn't seem to be as bad as the others you've seen.  It's
fairly clean, in good repair, and lacks bugs and rat carcasses.  In fact,
from the way the furniture is arranged and the bed is made, you realize that
the owner of the dwelling is a pretty conscientious individual.  A heap of
tarp is lying on the floor; it is presumably used for patching up the holes
that so frequently occur in a tent in an environment like that of Sargasso. 
Admiring the work that goes into maintaining such an unstable dwelling, you
can't help but smile to yourself because finally, you see a hint of goodness
in Sargasso.  

[ Exits: west ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.
A Sargasso guard walks around here, defending the prospectors.

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1214/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (ESW)
e
>>   Wandering along a dirt path
  The dirt path ends in somewhat of a cul-de-sac here, with a large tent to
the east and a very strange tent to the south.  A very soft green light
eminates from that tent, likely the result of some mystical force.  You
wonder what kind of force could create such a calm, serene aura about this
town of angst and strife.  Your body feels very light and airy as you step
closer and closer to the tent; it is almost as if your destiny is unfolding
right before your eyes.  Other than entering one of these two tents, your
only other option is to head back to the north.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1213/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (NESW)
>>   Inside a large tent
  Whomever owns this poor excuse for a home is either completely oblivious
to its state of disrepair or simply doesn't care.  Whatever the reason may
be, the fact still remains that there are huge holes in the tent's top. 
While this does afford a decent view of the night sky, you cleverly deduce
that it must be a tremendous pain to sleep here during times of inclement
weather.  The dirt floor is crawling with numerous species of vermin:
cockroaches, lizards, and scorpions.  How anyone can live in these kinds of
conditions is a mystery to a civilized person like you.  You make a
disgusted face even as you stand in the midst of some very angry bugs.  

[ Exits: west ]
One of Sargasso's guards is here slacking off.

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1212/1263 mv  444tnl

[ Exits: north east south west ]

984/984 HP  1039/1378 MP  1212/1263 mv  444tnl  
Lv 47  G 205967 | Wandering along a dirt path (NESW)
>>   Inside a fortune teller's tent
  As you brush away the faded yellow tent flap, you enter a world of mystery 
that you never thought Sargasso could offer. A string of wooden beads colored
with fluorescent pinks, greens, and yellows graces the top of the tent, 
draped like holiday lights on a log cabin. Covering the fortune teller's 
circular table in the center of the abode is a sky blue handwoven cloth 
dotted with pastel purple flowers. In the middle of this piece of furniture 
is a shiny crystal ball. Its grasp on you is hypnotic, almost as if it were 
drawing you somewhere else. A gold-laced sack lies in the far corner of the 
dwelling; you presume that the seer's mystical devices reside within.
Indeed, the tent is quite awe inspiring. The dirty path lies to the north.

[ Exits: north ]
Katherine the fortune teller sits at the table, ready to read your fortune.
Katherine glances nervously to the north.
Katherine the fortune teller says 'Welcome to my tent, KumoGami. I am sorry for seeming preoccupied,
but the black haze to the north disturbs me.'

n
Wandering along a dirt path
  The dirt path ends in somewhat of a cul-de-sac here, with a large tent to
the east and a very strange tent to the south.  A very soft green light
eminates from that tent, likely the result of some mystical force.  You
wonder what kind of force could create such a calm, serene aura about this
town of angst and strife.  Your body feels very light and airy as you step
closer and closer to the tent; it is almost as if your destiny is unfolding
right before your eyes.  Other than entering one of these two tents, your
only other option is to head back to the north.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

>>   Revival Tent
  This tent is about 30 feet x 30 feet. It is made of the same canvas as all 
the other tents. It is clean, without any sign of rodents. What makes it 
different is that in the back of the tent is a raised dais made out of a 
strong, but dark kind of wood that elevates it about 3 feet above the ground.
In the center of the dais is a polished wood podium made for holding 
documents. Crude chairs are organized in rows for those that are willing to 
sit and listen to what preacher says, and there are a few people sitting here
listening to him.

Oreh Cookhouse

The twin pines
  You are standing before a tall pine tree. Legend has it that this tree was 
planted with its twin to celebrate the life and love of Rythemus and Lantana.
They died tragically in this spot. Upon their death the land grew cold and 
barren. Their friend, Thylinimus, planted these two trees as a memorial, and 
the trees immediately began to grow. These two trees still survive as a 
symbol of their love and devotion to each other - one of the signs of hope on
this desolate tundra.

On the Ocean Floor
  Resting your feet against the ocean floor, you stop and realize that you
do not feel the intense pressure you thought you might at this depth.  You
can move about with relative ease, almost as if on surface.  While relaxing
to strained muscles after the long swim, it is also a curious sensation. 
Looking around in an attempt to survey the vista before you, a dark shadow
of movement above causes you to grasp your weapon just a little more
tightly.  What strange new world have you entered, and are you welcome?

The Temple of Mysharak
  As you enter this large building, you are in awe of the multitude of
colors which are displayed in the coral walls and ceiling, it is as if the
coral magically grew in certain directions making for a spiralling pattern
on the walls.  You can see strange drawings on the far wall, depicting what
appears to be a great battle between sharks and man.  All around you there
are sharkonians at prayer.  There is a large statue of the god Mysharak
towering over you, its large teeth grinning at you, as if to think you would
make a good offering.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

fill the corners and clutter the shelves against the walls.  All of these
objects, having been donated for the use of others, are free to anybody who
wants them.  If you find anything you like, help yourself!  This
donation room brought to you by Ivar Enterprises!

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

21/918 HP  291/1312 MP  1219/1220 mv  910tnl  
Lv 48  G 207049 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
>>   
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

21/918 HP  291/1312 MP  1217/1220 mv  910tnl  
Lv 48  G 207049 | darkness (EWD)
>>   Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

w
>>   Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.

Under the Waves
  The light enters the water, breaking into a prism of colors dancing on
the current.  You feel yourself being carried in the rythmic swells, rising
and falling with the nearby tides.  Looking down into the darkness below,
you wonder what sort of creature dares to exist in the murky depths at the
bottom on the ocean.

Swimming Down into the Deep
  The light fades as you begin to swim toward the depths below.  As you
begin your descent, you feel the pressure of the ocean swallowing you.  Your
curiosity becomes tinged with fear, yet you must know what you might find. 
Are the rumors true?  

[ Exits: up down ]

900/918 HP  925/1312 MP  1165/1220 mv  908tnl  
Lv 48  G 207049 | Swimming Down into the Deep (UD)
>>   
d
On the Ocean Floor
  Resting your feet against the ocean floor, you stop and realize that you
do not feel the intense pressure you thought you might at this depth.  You
can move about with relative ease, almost as if on surface.  While relaxing
to strained muscles after the long swim, it is also a curious sensation. 
Looking around in an attempt to survey the vista before you, a dark shadow
of movement above causes you to grasp your weapon just a little more
tightly.  What strange new world have you entered, and are you welcome?  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]

Before the Great Coral Tower
  The Great Coral Tower rises from the sands in a gigantic pinnacle. 
Sharkonian guards protect the entranceway.  Other Sharkonians go in and out
of the building.  Even though there are no markings or ornaments to denote
rank, the reactions of the guards show that the beings entering and leaving
this Tower are the most powerful in this realm.

>>   Inside the Coral Tower of Sharkatan
  This is the seat of power and authority here in Sharkatan.  Even though
the structure is made of coral, it is awe-inspiring and impressive.  The
walls of the structure are highly tended, with workers constantly upkeeping
the structure.  The tower reaches far above the ocean floor, its presence
not only seen, but felt throughout the entire Coral Kingdom.

Task 1  : Sober up Harold, Sheriff Jack's deputy. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "Before I go any farther, can you go find my worthless
deputy Harold? He is usually drunk at the saloon, and I have had to throw a 
bucket of water on Harold to sober him up enough to do anything. When you 
have done that, then return to me and say that Harold is sober, and then I 
will tell you more about what has been happening around here. The horses 
around here sometimes have buckets, and you will have to find the water on 
your own." 

Task 2  : Tell Jack that Harold is sober. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "When you have done that, return to me and say that 
Harold is sober."

place to start."

can get more information from them."

Mons Brevia (1266)

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"

962/1001 HP  787/1406 MP  1265/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Approaching a small mining camp (SU)
>>   
s
Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north (south) ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

962/1001 HP  787/1406 MP  1262/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Just outside Sargasso (NS)
>>   Inside Sargasso's gate
  Still a bit groggy from your difficult journey (and because you've just
recovered from passing out) you feel extremely disoriented, and in fact
almost feel like you have to pass out again.  Harnessing all your strength
and all your will, you manage to fight off the urge.  Who knows WHERE you
might end up if you were to fall unconscious again!  After the dizzy
spell passes, you notice that you are inside a small mining settlement that
has mysteriously sprung up by the mountain.  The ground beneath your feet is
composed of a dark brown substance that is similar to dirt, but feels a bit
more squishy beneath your feet.  What strikes you most of all, however, is
the fact that no one seems to be happy.  They are too concerned with making
money, many having presumably left behind their wives and children in hopes
of making a quick gold coin.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
