962/1001 HP  762/1406 MP  1259/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Inside Sargasso's gate (NESW)
>>   
s
Approaching a small mine shaft
  After having spent some time in the dirty, run down settlement of
Sargasso, you realize that the only thing the prospectors have is mining. 
They left their families and decided to dedicate themselves to one single
task.  The wind starts to pick up a little and the weird dirt-stuff flies
around for a little bit, but the gusts are not nearly as horrible as when
you were walking upon the mountain.  Still, the smell of charred flesh,
which was absent to the north, lingers on here.  What could these miners be
doing to paint such a horrid picture of the town?  You shrug off the
question, thinking it could not possibly be on purpose.  To the west you see
a beautifully colored hut and wonder why something so vibrant would be in a
place of such death and misery.  

[ Exits: north south west ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A sargasso miner shuffles along lazily here.

962/1001 HP  762/1406 MP  1258/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Approaching a small mine shaft (NSW)
>>   
s
Inside a small mine shaft
  Rotting oak posts support the ceiling of this very old looking mine
shaft.  You find this to be very strange, because all the other clues point
to the fact that Sargasso is a relatively new settlement.  How odd.  Maybe
there's something more to the mineshaft ...  something beautiful, yet
forgotten for countless ages.  The upper level of the mine shaft continues
south of here, or you can explore the depths of the mine below.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

962/1001 HP  762/1406 MP  1257/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Inside a small mine shaft (NSD)
>>   
d
Exploring underground
  This mine shaft is certainly much bigger than you thought it would be! 
It appears that the Sargasso miners certainly found a bit more than ore when
they dug deep inside the ground.  The underground caverns seem almost
endless, and you can't help but notice that they seem to be very ancient,
unlike the relatively new mine shaft.  You can climb back up the rope to the
mining settlement, but you get the feeling that it would be much nicer to
explore underground instead.  Paths spiral off in each direction, and you
really don't know which would be the best way to go.  Tiny little runes are
carved inside one of the cavern's walls in runny black ink.  Maybe coming to
Sargasso wasn't such a huge waste after all.  

[ Exits: east south west up ]
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

Lv 48  G 207220 | Exploring underground (ESWU)
>>   
s
Exploring underground
  Even though you are still relatively close to the Sargasso mineshaft, you
cannot believe how different this place is from the accursed town.  Whereas
Sargasso had almost nothing but horror and evil, the underground has a
mysterious quality.  You don't know exactly how to catergorize it: sometimes
the cavern gives off a feeling of warmth and light, other times you cringe
in fear, wondering if your own shadow has turned against you.  Bowing your
head slightly, you utter a quick prayer to your god, asking him to protect
you.  The tunnel opens up into a huge chamber here, and by the way the dust
flies around the opening you can tell that some entity passed through here
quite recently.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
(Angry) A giant bat zips about the tunnel, ready to assault you!
(Angry) A giant bat zips about the tunnel, ready to assault you!

982/1001 HP  786/1406 MP  1278/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Exploring underground (NEW)
>>   
w
Exploring underground
  Clank, clank, clank.  In the distance you hear iron weapons being
sharpened on the granite walls of the cave, and you worry that you might be
ambushed somewhere ...  But where?  You start thinking that the more you
travel in these strange lands the more questions pop into your head - but
you still have no answers.  The smell of fresh blood wafts in from the
south, and you question the wisdom of travelling in that direction.  You
wrinkle your nose at the prospect of seeing another dead body (even the most
bloodthirsty of warriors has an occasional pang of guilt when seeing a
rotting carcass).  You can also travel east or west to what you hope is a
safer part of the tunnel.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

982/1001 HP  786/1406 MP  1277/1279 mv  813tnl  
Lv 48  G 207220 | Exploring underground (ESW)
w
>>   
Exploring underground
  You find yet another dead end in this very strange yet exciting cavern. 
The granite walls are soft to the touch - they feel like a goose down pillow
feels after weeks of hard travelling.  Some massive erosion must have taken
place for the walls to get like this, but you can't help but wonder exactly
HOW.  After all, this mine shaft was constructed fairly recently, so it
would be silly to think that someone could actually be LIVING down here ...

Character autosaved at Sun Jul 30 13:06:11 2023.

tasks dsr all

       DSR : Investigate what caused the miners to disappear from within the mines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Sober up Harold, Sheriff Jack's deputy. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "Before I go any farther, can you go find my worthless
deputy Harold? He is usually drunk at the saloon, and I have had to throw a 
bucket of water on Harold to sober him up enough to do anything. When you 
have done that, then return to me and say that Harold is sober, and then I 
will tell you more about what has been happening around here. The horses 
around here sometimes have buckets, and you will have to find the water on 
your own." 

Task 2  : Tell Jack that Harold is sober. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "When you have done that, return to me and say that 
Harold is sober." 

Task 3  : Ask Katherine about the missing miners. (Completed)

Sheriff Jack says, "Asking Katherine about the missing miners might help." 

Task 4  : Ask Tomas about the missing miners. (Completed)

Sheriff Jack says, "Asking Tomas about the missing miners would be a good 
place to start." 

Task 5  : Find out what you can from the assassins in the mine.

Katherine says, "I think that you should find the assassins, and see if you 
can get more information from them." 

Task 6  : Ask Abigail about the accidents.

Tomas says, "If you want to know more about the accidents, then I would ask 
Abigail about them."

Exploring underground
  You find yet another dead end in this very strange yet exciting cavern. 
The granite walls are soft to the touch - they feel like a goose down pillow
feels after weeks of hard travelling.  Some massive erosion must have taken
place for the walls to get like this, but you can't help but wonder exactly
HOW.  After all, this mine shaft was constructed fairly recently, so it
would be silly to think that someone could actually be LIVING down here ...

e
Exploring underground
  Clank, clank, clank.  In the distance you hear iron weapons being
sharpened on the granite walls of the cave, and you worry that you might be
ambushed somewhere ...  But where?  You start thinking that the more you
travel in these strange lands the more questions pop into your head - but
you still have no answers.  The smell of fresh blood wafts in from the
south, and you question the wisdom of travelling in that direction.  You
wrinkle your nose at the prospect of seeing another dead body (even the most
bloodthirsty of warriors has an occasional pang of guilt when seeing a
rotting carcass).  You can also travel east or west to what you hope is a
safer part of the tunnel.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Exploring underground
  Even though you are still relatively close to the Sargasso mineshaft, you
cannot believe how different this place is from the accursed town.  Whereas
Sargasso had almost nothing but horror and evil, the underground has a
mysterious quality.  You don't know exactly how to catergorize it: sometimes
the cavern gives off a feeling of warmth and light, other times you cringe
in fear, wondering if your own shadow has turned against you.  Bowing your
head slightly, you utter a quick prayer to your god, asking him to protect
you.  The tunnel opens up into a huge chamber here, and by the way the dust
flies around the opening you can tell that some entity passed through here
quite recently.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Exploring underground
  This mine shaft is certainly much bigger than you thought it would be! 
It appears that the Sargasso miners certainly found a bit more than ore when
they dug deep inside the ground.  The underground caverns seem almost
endless, and you can't help but notice that they seem to be very ancient,
unlike the relatively new mine shaft.  You can climb back up the rope to the
mining settlement, but you get the feeling that it would be much nicer to
explore underground instead.  Paths spiral off in each direction, and you
really don't know which would be the best way to go.  Tiny little runes are
carved inside one of the cavern's walls in runny black ink.  Maybe coming to
Sargasso wasn't such a huge waste after all.  

[ Exits: east south west up ]
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

Inside a small mine shaft
  Rotting oak posts support the ceiling of this very old looking mine
shaft.  You find this to be very strange, because all the other clues point
to the fact that Sargasso is a relatively new settlement.  How odd.  Maybe
there's something more to the mineshaft ...  something beautiful, yet
forgotten for countless ages.  The upper level of the mine shaft continues
south of here, or you can explore the depths of the mine below.

n
Approaching a small mine shaft
  After having spent some time in the dirty, run down settlement of
Sargasso, you realize that the only thing the prospectors have is mining. 
They left their families and decided to dedicate themselves to one single
task.  The wind starts to pick up a little and the weird dirt-stuff flies
around for a little bit, but the gusts are not nearly as horrible as when
you were walking upon the mountain.  Still, the smell of charred flesh,
which was absent to the north, lingers on here.  What could these miners be
doing to paint such a horrid picture of the town?  You shrug off the
question, thinking it could not possibly be on purpose.  To the west you see
a beautifully colored hut and wonder why something so vibrant would be in a
place of such death and misery.

n
Inside Sargasso's gate
  Still a bit groggy from your difficult journey (and because you've just
recovered from passing out) you feel extremely disoriented, and in fact
almost feel like you have to pass out again.  Harnessing all your strength
and all your will, you manage to fight off the urge.  Who knows WHERE you
might end up if you were to fall unconscious again!  After the dizzy
spell passes, you notice that you are inside a small mining settlement that
has mysteriously sprung up by the mountain.  The ground beneath your feet is
composed of a dark brown substance that is similar to dirt, but feels a bit
more squishy beneath your feet.  What strikes you most of all, however, is
the fact that no one seems to be happy.  They are too concerned with making
money, many having presumably left behind their wives and children in hopes
of making a quick gold coin.

meters away.  You get the impression that people just don't care anymore!

tents to your south.

Wandering along a dirt path

dust you have to deal with outside.

The Challenge of Mars
  Stepping through the portal, you find yourself inside an illusionary
world of fire and ash.  The heat generated by this inferno is very real,
however, as is evidenced by the bands of sweat on your forehead.  You reason
that you should try to stay away from some of the bigger flames, just to be
safe.  A huge flare burts forth to the east, alerting you to the fact that
you are in more and more danger with each second that you stay.  Desperate,
you run around, dodging flames, trying to find a way out.  Suddenly, a ring
of fire encircles you, scorching your eyebrows with its tendrils of heat. 
The flames converge into one massive pillar, and a seductive temptress
dressed completely in red emerges.

enter portal
"portal"
You step into the portal of reality and arrive in...
Inside the portal room
  Sparkling glass mirrors framed with gold and platinum line the diamond
walls of the room.  The static energy you felt to the north is even more
concentrated here than it was to the north; it must be the influence of all
the portals.  You close your eyes and try to enter one of the mirrors, but
only succeed in scratching your hand pretty badly.  Ouch!  Those stupid
portals must only be one way.  You mutter to yourself and decide that it's
not a good idea to randomly enter mirrors hoping that they are portals.  At
least you'll know for next time.  Still, the high concentration of energy
suggests to you that some mystical force is at work here - you just don't
know what.  The main hallway lies far to the north.  

[ Exits: north ]
(White Aura) The portal guardian stands here, keeping the portals from being used.

bands of energy are gathering.  Your hair stands on end as you move farther
south, not because you are afraid, but rather because of all the static.

tremendous force, and you are not quite sure what the source is nor how to
stop it.  Even the magic of the diamond walls seems overpowered by this
unseen force.  The portal room is to the south, while the hallway lies to
your north.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  The diamond walls of the corridor open up into a huge ante chamber here,
and you gaze up at the almost endless ceiling.  Tiny points of light dot the
top of the large dome in the ceiling, and you get the sensation that the
energy of the stars themselves are being funneled into the castle.  Indeed,
you feel like some kind of cosmic force is protecting you from harm.  Unlike
the light of the stars, however, the light is somewhat chilly, almost as if
it has been corrupted.  The sensation increases as you head north, towards
the jail, but decreases as you go south towards the portal room.  The throne
room is far ahead of you, a long way to the east.

w
Inside Diamond Castle
  Two tapestries woven of pure silken threads grace the diamond walls of
the hallway, each depicting a turning point of not just the castle, but of
the whole city as well.  Crystalline suits of armor line the walls,
absorbing the light then dispersing it in a prismatic spiral.  The
chandelier hanging from the ceiling has no candles with which to
illuminate the corridor, yet it gives off a tranquil radiance which urges
you to release all your pent up hatreds and phobias.  Your eyelids slowly
drift downwards as you fall into a deep healing trance.  Here, above all
other places, you feel safe.  

[ Exits: east (west) ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  After opening the diamond gate and entering the castle, your senses are
overcome with amazement and wonder.  Even the inner walls of this
magnificent castle are made of diamond.  As you step across the floor, the
shock of your feet smacking the ground is absorbed, and instead of making a
cacophonous sound, you hear a soft bell chiming in the distance.  It seems
as if the destructive sound energy is converted into a harmonious melody. 
You sigh in utter bliss as you realize that nothing will hurt you here ... 
provided you treat it well.  To your north is a diamond fence which
separates the rest of the castle from the arborium, and to the south is the
castle dining room.  The castle hallway continues east.

528/1001 HP  170/1406 MP  1279/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]E[S]W)
>>   *[NOEXP]* In front of Diamond Castle
  Doric columns of pure diamond support this magnificent castle.  Beams of
light encircle the dwelling, illuminating the crystal with an holy
brilliance and a divine majesty.  You slowly raise your hand up to feel the
outer wall, and despite having been exposed to the elements, it is as soft
and tender as a baby's skin, while still having an untold of inner
resilience.  You bow your head in respect for the castle, and notice a
welcome mat on the ground.  The mat is completely lavish as well, having
been woven with intertwined strands of gold and silver.  If the exterior is
any indication, the beauty and grace to be found within will surpass any
you have seen.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Approaching Diamond Castle
  As you walk along this talcum-covered path, you see what appears to be a
large castle made entirely of glass in the distance.  Smiling to yourself,
you are almost blinded by the sunlight reflecting into your eyes.  You
shield your face with your hand, hoping that you can block out the radiance.
The light is so pure that it hurts even a powerful adventurer such as you. 
As you get a little bit closer, you see that the castle isn't made of
ordinary glass: it is pure diamond.  You whistle at the exorbitant cost, but
you realize it was worth it: the purity and beauty of the place is
unmatched.

Lv 48  G 207925 | Approaching Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside a strange city
  Closing your eyes, you jump down the hole.  After speeding towards the
ground at terminal velocity for several minutes, you suddenly screech to a
near halt and find yourself floating very gently and gracefully downwards. 
For some reason this reminds you of "Alice in Wonderland" when Alice jumps
down the rabbit's hole.  After almost an hour of floating like a feather,
you see sky below you.  SKY?!  You could have SWORN that you were just in a
cave.  Yet here you are, falling down towards a sky and a sparkling city
below.  The sun gleams off all the buildings, spiralling reds, blues,
purples, and colors you don't even have names for in all directions.  As you
touch ground for the first time in ages, you find yourself in the midst of
this strange underground city of sky and crystal.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.
A caspian guard grins wickedly here as he tortures passers-by.

528/1001 HP  170/1406 MP  1277/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside a strange city (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Outside the Aquamarine Cathedral
  The brilliant building before you is made entirely of cyan colored
crystal which you quickly recognize as being aquamarine.  A holy energy
seems to radiate from the building, filling your soul with warmth and
goodness.  The crystalline house of worship has a tear-jerking scene painted
on it: a sargasso miner discovers this strange town and proceeds to forget
all the evil in his heart.  How touching!  This place, unlike some of the
more corrupt churches you've visited, fills you with such a sense of
serenity that you know that all doubts will be removed when you enter its
walls.  

[ Exits: east (west) ]

528/1001 HP  170/1406 MP  1276/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Outside the Aquamarine Cathedral (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside the Aquamarine Cathedral
  You tiptoe through the door into the aquamarine cathedral and are struck
with reverence for the strange inhabitants of this bejeweled city.  The
architecture of this building is just incredible, combining the columns of
the classical style and the flamboyancy of the baroque with the twinkling
brilliance of aquamarine gems.  Diamond sculptures of exquisite craftsmanship
grace the hallway with tranquility.  The smell of fresh lilacs floats
throughout the air, sending you into a dream-like trance.  You never want to
leave this place of beauty and life, as you feel at one with yourself here. 
You notice some aquamarine doors to the south and north, while the lovely
cathedral continues to the west.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]
A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.

528/1001 HP  170/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside the Aquamarine Cathedral ([N]E[S]W)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Approaching the altar
  The cathedral continues on here, still as stunning and brilliant as it
was in the entryway.  A cyan statue of a yak stands to your west.  Yaks, of
course, are such noble and demure creatures that you can't help but wipe
away a tear - the statue is just so gorgeous.  Even though the floor is made
of the same jewel as the walls, your boots don't make any noise at all -
it's as if someone wanted to preserve the tranquility of the cathedral. 
That's completely fine with you, as you've felt more at peace here than
anywhere else.  The cathedral's altar lies to the west, the entry way is to
the east, and nuns' quarters lie to the north and south.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west up ]
     (Magic) Some iron ore from Sargasso's mine lies here on the ground.
A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Standing before the altar
  The altar before you is truly a sight to behold.  Made entirely of
sapphire, it is a wonderous contrast to the color of the rest of the
cathedral.  It gleams and shines with its own inner light, a testament that
there must be some true magic contained within.  As you close your weary
eyes and murmer a prayer to your god, a wave of placidity washes over you,
calming your soul and filling you with a respect for all forms of life.  As
you turn to the east to leave, you stare longingly at the altar, hoping that
sometime soon you can return and be embraced by its loving light once more.

 guards to make it to here?  It's not safe for strangers to walk around
 with some of the guards acting strangely!"

       DSR : Investigate what caused the miners to disappear from within the mines.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Sober up Harold, Sheriff Jack's deputy. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "Before I go any farther, can you go find my worthless
deputy Harold? He is usually drunk at the saloon, and I have had to throw a 
bucket of water on Harold to sober him up enough to do anything. When you 
have done that, then return to me and say that Harold is sober, and then I 
will tell you more about what has been happening around here. The horses 
around here sometimes have buckets, and you will have to find the water on 
your own." 

Task 2  : Tell Jack that Harold is sober. (Completed)

Jack the Sheriff says, "When you have done that, return to me and say that 
Harold is sober." 

Task 3  : Ask Katherine about the missing miners. (Completed)

Sheriff Jack says, "Asking Katherine about the missing miners might help." 

Task 4  : Ask Tomas about the missing miners. (Completed)

Sheriff Jack says, "Asking Tomas about the missing miners would be a good 
place to start." 

Task 5  : Find out what you can from the assassins in the mine. (Completed)

Katherine says, "I think that you should find the assassins, and see if you 
can get more information from them." 

Task 6  : Ask Abigail about the accidents.

Tomas says, "If you want to know more about the accidents, then I would ask 
Abigail about them." 

Task 7  : Ask Contessa about the guards.

The note from the Contessa reads:
"My loyal assassins, because of the way that some of the guards have been 
behaving recently, I am instructing you to delay the progress of the surface 
miners by any means necessary until the problem can be resolved. I do not 
enjoy giving this order, but they must be kept away from here for their own 
protection." 
-The Contessa 
(Talking to her about the guards sounds like a good idea.)

You say 'guards'
Contessa exclaims, "Well, since you did make it here, I don't see that it
 will do any harm to tell you about what has been happening around here. It
 started a few weeks ago when a perfectly preserved corpse of some kind of
 creature was found in our diamond mines. Our miners reported it to the
 guards, who went to investigate. Shortly after that, the guards that went
 there started acting strangely. At first, they were just keeping to
 themselves and not talking to anyone else, but it wasn't long before they
 started bullying the citizens!"
Contessa exclaims, "Now, they are building something in the upper part of
 the cathedral, and they won't let anyone in to see what they are doing.

 rank in the church!"

 they are doing!"

 have seen."

Inside a strange city
  Closing your eyes, you jump down the hole.  After speeding towards the
ground at terminal velocity for several minutes, you suddenly screech to a
near halt and find yourself floating very gently and gracefully downwards. 
For some reason this reminds you of "Alice in Wonderland" when Alice jumps
down the rabbit's hole.  After almost an hour of floating like a feather,
you see sky below you.  SKY?!  You could have SWORN that you were just in a
cave.  Yet here you are, falling down towards a sky and a sparkling city
below.  The sun gleams off all the buildings, spiralling reds, blues,

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1278/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside a strange city (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* Approaching Diamond Castle
  As you walk along this talcum-covered path, you see what appears to be a
large castle made entirely of glass in the distance.  Smiling to yourself,
you are almost blinded by the sunlight reflecting into your eyes.  You
shield your face with your hand, hoping that you can block out the radiance.
The light is so pure that it hurts even a powerful adventurer such as you. 
As you get a little bit closer, you see that the castle isn't made of
ordinary glass: it is pure diamond.  You whistle at the exorbitant cost, but
you realize it was worth it: the purity and beauty of the place is
unmatched.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A caspian guard grins wickedly here as he tortures passers-by.
A caspian guard grins wickedly here as he tortures passers-by.
A caspian guard is here keeping peace in the city.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1277/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Approaching Diamond Castle (EW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* In front of Diamond Castle
  Doric columns of pure diamond support this magnificent castle.  Beams of
light encircle the dwelling, illuminating the crystal with an holy
brilliance and a divine majesty.  You slowly raise your hand up to feel the
outer wall, and despite having been exposed to the elements, it is as soft
and tender as a baby's skin, while still having an untold of inner
resilience.  You bow your head in respect for the castle, and notice a
welcome mat on the ground.  The mat is completely lavish as well, having
been woven with intertwined strands of gold and silver.  If the exterior is
any indication, the beauty and grace to be found within will surpass any
you have seen.  

[ Exits: (east) west ]
A citizen of this strange city is here smiling at you.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1276/1279 mv  699tnl

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1276/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | In front of Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  After opening the diamond gate and entering the castle, your senses are
overcome with amazement and wonder.  Even the inner walls of this
magnificent castle are made of diamond.  As you step across the floor, the
shock of your feet smacking the ground is absorbed, and instead of making a
cacophonous sound, you hear a soft bell chiming in the distance.  It seems
as if the destructive sound energy is converted into a harmonious melody. 
You sigh in utter bliss as you realize that nothing will hurt you here ... 
provided you treat it well.  To your north is a diamond fence which
separates the rest of the castle from the arborium, and to the south is the
castle dining room.  The castle hallway continues east.  

[ Exits: (north) (east) (south) west ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]E[S]W)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  Two tapestries woven of pure silken threads grace the diamond walls of
the hallway, each depicting a turning point of not just the castle, but of
the whole city as well.  Crystalline suits of armor line the walls,
absorbing the light then dispersing it in a prismatic spiral.  The
chandelier hanging from the ceiling has no candles with which to
illuminate the corridor, yet it gives off a tranquil radiance which urges
you to release all your pent up hatreds and phobias.  Your eyelids slowly
drift downwards as you fall into a deep healing trance.  Here, above all
other places, you feel safe.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Inside Diamond Castle
  The diamond walls of the corridor open up into a huge ante chamber here,
and you gaze up at the almost endless ceiling.  Tiny points of light dot the
top of the large dome in the ceiling, and you get the sensation that the
energy of the stars themselves are being funneled into the castle.  Indeed,
you feel like some kind of cosmic force is protecting you from harm.  Unlike
the light of the stars, however, the light is somewhat chilly, almost as if
it has been corrupted.  The sensation increases as you head north, towards
the jail, but decreases as you go south towards the portal room.  The throne
room is far ahead of you, a long way to the east.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.

>>   *[NOEXP]*

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]ESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Approaching the portal room
  You feel a strange static force pulsating in the air here, almost as if
bands of energy are gathering.  Your hair stands on end as you move farther
south, not because you are afraid, but rather because of all the static. 
You become quite tense as you realize that something must be creating the
tremendous force, and you are not quite sure what the source is nor how to
stop it.  Even the magic of the diamond walls seems overpowered by this
unseen force.  The portal room is to the south, while the hallway lies to
your north.  

[ Exits: north south ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Approaching the portal room (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Inside the portal room
  Sparkling glass mirrors framed with gold and platinum line the diamond
walls of the room.  The static energy you felt to the north is even more
concentrated here than it was to the north; it must be the influence of all
the portals.  You close your eyes and try to enter one of the mirrors, but
only succeed in scratching your hand pretty badly.  Ouch!  Those stupid
portals must only be one way.  You mutter to yourself and decide that it's
not a good idea to randomly enter mirrors hoping that they are portals.  At
least you'll know for next time.  Still, the high concentration of energy
suggests to you that some mystical force is at work here - you just don't
know what.  The main hallway lies far to the north.  

[ Exits: north ]
(White Aura) The portal guardian stands here, keeping the portals from being used.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]ESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Inside Diamond Castle
  Pictures of all the kings and queens of this recently discovered kingdom
line the crystalline walls in this section of the hallway.  From the gilded
plates beneath each, you are able to trace the lineage of the monarchs from
Queen Angelina, the present ruler, back 12 generations to Queen Rosita and
King James.  What amazes you most of all about these paintings is that each
of the leaders has a genuine smile on his or her face - in many portraits
the subject smiles almost cynically, but you see none of that in the faces
of the monarchs.  On the western wall is a silver plaque listing the members
of the current royal family as well as their birthdates.  The sense of
history and pride in one's family that the royalty displays is incredible
and quite refreshing: too many people forget who they are and pay attention
instead to where they are going.  The hallway continues east and west.  

[ Exits: east west up ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle (EWU)
u
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Defective Diamonds
  This entire part of the castle is composed of solid sheets of polished 
diamonds, which would be impossible without the use of powerful magic. The 
way that light reflects off of the smooth multifaceted surfaces gives them an
almost-ethereal appearance, as though the walls weren't solid and you could 
reach through them. The near-perfect impression of the walls is only at the 
surface, because if you look closely, a few minute cracks that are filled 
with a sickly green color in the otherwise flawless surfaces can be seen.

[ Exits: north down ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Defective Diamonds (ND)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
d
Inside Diamond Castle
  Pictures of all the kings and queens of this recently discovered kingdom
line the crystalline walls in this section of the hallway.  From the gilded
plates beneath each, you are able to trace the lineage of the monarchs from
Queen Angelina, the present ruler, back 12 generations to Queen Rosita and
King James.  What amazes you most of all about these paintings is that each
of the leaders has a genuine smile on his or her face - in many portraits
the subject smiles almost cynically, but you see none of that in the faces
of the monarchs.  On the western wall is a silver plaque listing the members
of the current royal family as well as their birthdates.  The sense of
history and pride in one's family that the royalty displays is incredible
and quite refreshing: too many people forget who they are and pay attention
instead to where they are going.  The hallway continues east and west.  

[ Exits: east west up ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle (EWU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
w
Inside Diamond Castle
  The diamond walls of the corridor open up into a huge ante chamber here,
and you gaze up at the almost endless ceiling.  Tiny points of light dot the
top of the large dome in the ceiling, and you get the sensation that the
energy of the stars themselves are being funneled into the castle.  Indeed,
you feel like some kind of cosmic force is protecting you from harm.  Unlike
the light of the stars, however, the light is somewhat chilly, almost as if
it has been corrupted.  The sensation increases as you head north, towards
the jail, but decreases as you go south towards the portal room.  The throne
room is far ahead of you, a long way to the east.  

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]ESW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  Two tapestries woven of pure silken threads grace the diamond walls of
the hallway, each depicting a turning point of not just the castle, but of
the whole city as well.  Crystalline suits of armor line the walls,
absorbing the light then dispersing it in a prismatic spiral.  The
chandelier hanging from the ceiling has no candles with which to
illuminate the corridor, yet it gives off a tranquil radiance which urges
you to release all your pent up hatreds and phobias.  Your eyelids slowly
drift downwards as you fall into a deep healing trance.  Here, above all
other places, you feel safe.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A jeweller is here boggling at the splendor of the castle.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle (EW)
op w
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Diamond Castle
  After opening the diamond gate and entering the castle, your senses are
overcome with amazement and wonder.  Even the inner walls of this
magnificent castle are made of diamond.  As you step across the floor, the
shock of your feet smacking the ground is absorbed, and instead of making a
cacophonous sound, you hear a soft bell chiming in the distance.  It seems
as if the destructive sound energy is converted into a harmonious melody. 
You sigh in utter bliss as you realize that nothing will hurt you here ... 
provided you treat it well.  To your north is a diamond fence which
separates the rest of the castle from the arborium, and to the south is the
castle dining room.  The castle hallway continues east.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]E[S]W)

w
>>   *[NOEXP]* The door is already open.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside Diamond Castle ([N]E[S]W)
>>   *[NOEXP]* In front of Diamond Castle
  Doric columns of pure diamond support this magnificent castle.  Beams of
light encircle the dwelling, illuminating the crystal with an holy
brilliance and a divine majesty.  You slowly raise your hand up to feel the
outer wall, and despite having been exposed to the elements, it is as soft
and tender as a baby's skin, while still having an untold of inner
resilience.  You bow your head in respect for the castle, and notice a
welcome mat on the ground.  The mat is completely lavish as well, having
been woven with intertwined strands of gold and silver.  If the exterior is
any indication, the beauty and grace to be found within will surpass any
you have seen.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A citizen of this strange city is here smiling at you.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | In front of Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* There is no door to the west of here.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1275/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | In front of Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Approaching Diamond Castle
  As you walk along this talcum-covered path, you see what appears to be a
large castle made entirely of glass in the distance.  Smiling to yourself,
you are almost blinded by the sunlight reflecting into your eyes.  You
shield your face with your hand, hoping that you can block out the radiance.
The light is so pure that it hurts even a powerful adventurer such as you. 
As you get a little bit closer, you see that the castle isn't made of
ordinary glass: it is pure diamond.  You whistle at the exorbitant cost, but
you realize it was worth it: the purity and beauty of the place is
unmatched.  

[ Exits: east west ]

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1272/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Approaching Diamond Castle (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Inside a strange city
  Closing your eyes, you jump down the hole.  After speeding towards the
ground at terminal velocity for several minutes, you suddenly screech to a
near halt and find yourself floating very gently and gracefully downwards. 
For some reason this reminds you of "Alice in Wonderland" when Alice jumps
down the rabbit's hole.  After almost an hour of floating like a feather,
you see sky below you.  SKY?!  You could have SWORN that you were just in a
cave.  Yet here you are, falling down towards a sky and a sparkling city
below.  The sun gleams off all the buildings, spiralling reds, blues,
purples, and colors you don't even have names for in all directions.  As you
touch ground for the first time in ages, you find yourself in the midst of
this strange underground city of sky and crystal.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A tiny sign is posted on a diamond post here.
A caspian guard grins wickedly here as he tortures passers-by.

627/1001 HP  285/1406 MP  1271/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside a strange city (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w


Outside the Aquamarine Cathedral
  The brilliant building before you is made entirely of cyan colored
crystal which you quickly recognize as being aquamarine.  A holy energy
seems to radiate from the building, filling your soul with warmth and
goodness.  The crystalline house of worship has a tear-jerking scene painted
on it: a sargasso miner discovers this strange town and proceeds to forget
all the evil in his heart.  How touching!  This place, unlike some of the
more corrupt churches you've visited, fills you with such a sense of
serenity that you know that all doubts will be removed when you enter its
walls.  

[ Exits: east (west) ]
A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.
A citizen of this strange city walks around lazily here.
A citizen of this strange city is here smiling at you.

648/1001 HP  312/1406 MP  1278/1279 mv  699tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Outside the Aquamarine Cathedral (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside the Aquamarine Cathedral
  You tiptoe through the door into the aquamarine cathedral and are struck
with reverence for the strange inhabitants of this bejeweled city.  The
architecture of this building is just incredible, combining the columns of
the classical style and the flamboyancy of the baroque with the twinkling
brilliance of aquamarine gems.  Diamond sculptures of exquisite craftsmanship
grace the hallway with tranquility.  The smell of fresh lilacs floats
throughout the air, sending you into a dream-like trance.  You never want to
leave this place of beauty and life, as you feel at one with yourself here. 
You notice some aquamarine doors to the south and north, while the lovely
cathedral continues to the west.  

[ Exits: (north) east (south) west ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside a nun's quarters (G)

keep a room clean.  Habits are EVERYWHERE: on the bed, crumpled on the

says "bacon" on it - it appears as if one of the nuns here has a craving for
meat, as the package is ripped open as if the nun's life depended on it. 
You wrinkle your nose as you suddenly realize that there is a faint odor of
something that you can't place your finger on.  Whatever it is, you first
feel nauseous, as if you are about to pass out, but the feeling passes and
you start feeling rather giddy and loosened up.  Yeah, man, you really dig
these penguin chicks.

Approaching the altar

was in the entryway.  A cyan statue of a yak stands to your west.  Yaks, of

away a tear - the statue is just so gorgeous.  Even though the floor is made
of the same jewel as the walls, your boots don't make any noise at all -
it's as if someone wanted to preserve the tranquility of the cathedral. 
That's completely fine with you, as you've felt more at peace here than
anywhere else.  The cathedral's altar lies to the west, the entry way is to

enter neptune
"neptune"
The Challenge of Neptune
  You find yourself completely submerged in a bright blue liquid.  It
certainly appears to be water, but it is so dense that trying to move around
is quite an effort; it is like swimming a sea of blue honey.  Strangely
enough, you don't feel the need to go to the surface for air; this is a
good thing, because the ocean seems to continue for many leagues both above
and below you.  After several hours of swimming without seeing any
lifeforms, you come across a hole in the water - it appears as if someone
ripped the very fabric of the liquid apart.  Entering this tear, you find
yourself face to face with an apparition.  

[ Exits: none ]
     (Magic) (Glow) A deluxe heal tablet from Yomy lies here on the ground!
     (Magic) A portal back to the real world lies here.
(Hidden) (White Aura) Kaiohsei swims about here, causing tidal waves.

149/1001 HP  159/1406 MP  1277/1279 mv  709tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | The Challenge of Neptune (none)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
enter portal
"portal"
You step into the portal of reality and arrive in...
Inside the portal room
  Sparkling glass mirrors framed with gold and platinum line the diamond
walls of the room.  The static energy you felt to the north is even more
concentrated here than it was to the north; it must be the influence of all
the portals.  You close your eyes and try to enter one of the mirrors, but
only succeed in scratching your hand pretty badly.  Ouch!  Those stupid
portals must only be one way.  You mutter to yourself and decide that it's
not a good idea to randomly enter mirrors hoping that they are portals.  At
least you'll know for next time.  Still, the high concentration of energy
suggests to you that some mystical force is at work here - you just don't
know what.  The main hallway lies far to the north.  

[ Exits: north ]
(White Aura) The portal guardian stands here, keeping the portals from being used.

n
Approaching the portal room
  You feel a strange static force pulsating in the air here, almost as if
bands of energy are gathering.  Your hair stands on end as you move farther
south, not because you are afraid, but rather because of all the static. 
You become quite tense as you realize that something must be creating the
tremendous force, and you are not quite sure what the source is nor how to
stop it.  Even the magic of the diamond walls seems overpowered by this
unseen force.  The portal room is to the south, while the hallway lies to
your north.

in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"

s
Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north (south) ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

169/1001 HP  197/1406 MP  1276/1279 mv  709tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Just outside Sargasso (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Sargasso's gate
  Still a bit groggy from your difficult journey (and because you've just
recovered from passing out) you feel extremely disoriented, and in fact
almost feel like you have to pass out again.  Harnessing all your strength
and all your will, you manage to fight off the urge.  Who knows WHERE you
might end up if you were to fall unconscious again!  After the dizzy
spell passes, you notice that you are inside a small mining settlement that
has mysteriously sprung up by the mountain.  The ground beneath your feet is
composed of a dark brown substance that is similar to dirt, but feels a bit
more squishy beneath your feet.  What strikes you most of all, however, is
the fact that no one seems to be happy.  They are too concerned with making
money, many having presumably left behind their wives and children in hopes
of making a quick gold coin.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

Exploring underground
  You find yet another dead end in this very strange yet exciting cavern. 
The granite walls are soft to the touch - they feel like a goose down pillow
feels after weeks of hard travelling.  Some massive erosion must have taken
place for the walls to get like this, but you can't help but wonder exactly
HOW.  After all, this mine shaft was constructed fairly recently, so it
would be silly to think that someone could actually be LIVING down here ... 

[ Exits: east ]

Exploring underground
  Clank, clank, clank.  In the distance you hear iron weapons being
sharpened on the granite walls of the cave, and you worry that you might be
ambushed somewhere ...  But where?  You start thinking that the more you
travel in these strange lands the more questions pop into your head - but
you still have no answers.  The smell of fresh blood wafts in from the
south, and you question the wisdom of travelling in that direction.  You
wrinkle your nose at the prospect of seeing another dead body (even the most
bloodthirsty of warriors has an occasional pang of guilt when seeing a
rotting carcass).  You can also travel east or west to what you hope is a
safer part of the tunnel.

An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

Global Quest: Global Quest # 7846 has been won by Myth - 10787th win.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Linkdead) Klaukodile the Knight.

n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Translucent) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is whispering
incantations.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (White Aura) (OPK) Spublofe is always half AFK.
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve 10 is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,

an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

e
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Mons Brevia (1198)

Approaching a small mining camp
  A raging dust storm swirls about the base of the mountain, piercing your
weathered eyes with its ungodly strength.  You grit your teeth against the
pain and struggle onward, hoping the storm will soon cease.  The side of the
mountain to your east is as black as charred flesh and there are no green
plants to lend color or life to the scene.  The wind does not let up, and
you hasten to find some kind of shelter.  May this forsaken place be forever
damned.  

[ Exits: south up ]
     A fresh oak sign protrudes from the charred ground.
Beatrice the adventurer walks about here, scaling the mountain.
Beatrice sits down on a large rock, takes a sandwich out of her backpack, and begins to chew
silently. After a minute or two she spots you.
Beatrice asks, "Hi, I'm Beatrice. Who are you?"
You tell Beatrice that your name is KumoGami.
Beatrice asks, "Nice to meet you, KumoGami. Perhaps you would like to know
 more about Sargasso?"

run s;o s;run 3s
Just outside Sargasso
  The dark granite encompasses the area as far as your eye can see.  You
begin to feel cold, scared, and claustrophobic as its proverbial weight
crushes your chest, leaving you with no room to breathe.  You gasp for air
and your pulse begins racing ...  Harder and harder you reach out, trying to
grasp at the heavy air that you know is there but that you just can't touch.
You race forward, panicked, and suddenly pass out ...  

When you come to, you are at the wooden gate of some strange mining
settlement.  Very few people are around, but for some reason that does not
strike you as being very strange.  Looking to the north, you notice that the
mountain has closed behind you, leaving behind no trace of the dust storm
or of the smell of burnt flesh.  You have no choice but to continue onward.

[ Exits: north south ]
A beast of burden is here hauling some iron ore.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here chatting with his friends and wasting time.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.
A gateguard is here protecting Sargasso.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside Sargasso's gate (1191)

Approaching a small mine shaft (1190)

Inside a small mine shaft
  Rotting oak posts support the ceiling of this very old looking mine
shaft.  You find this to be very strange, because all the other clues point
to the fact that Sargasso is a relatively new settlement.  How odd.  Maybe
there's something more to the mineshaft ...  something beautiful, yet
forgotten for countless ages.  The upper level of the mine shaft continues
south of here, or you can explore the depths of the mine below.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

918/918 HP  1065/1312 MP  1189/1220 mv  859tnl  
Lv 48  G 207925 | Inside a small mine shaft (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
d
Exploring underground
  This mine shaft is certainly much bigger than you thought it would be! 
It appears that the Sargasso miners certainly found a bit more than ore when
they dug deep inside the ground.  The underground caverns seem almost
endless, and you can't help but notice that they seem to be very ancient,
unlike the relatively new mine shaft.  You can climb back up the rope to the
mining settlement, but you get the feeling that it would be much nicer to
explore underground instead.  Paths spiral off in each direction, and you
really don't know which would be the best way to go.  Tiny little runes are
carved inside one of the cavern's walls in runny black ink.  Maybe coming to
Sargasso wasn't such a huge waste after all.  

[ Exits: east south west up ]
A man from sargasso is here exploring the tunnel.
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

Lv 48  G 207925 | Exploring underground (ESWU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Exploring underground
  Even though you are still relatively close to the Sargasso mineshaft, you
cannot believe how different this place is from the accursed town.  Whereas
Sargasso had almost nothing but horror and evil, the underground has a
mysterious quality.  You don't know exactly how to catergorize it: sometimes
the cavern gives off a feeling of warmth and light, other times you cringe
in fear, wondering if your own shadow has turned against you.  Bowing your
head slightly, you utter a quick prayer to your god, asking him to protect
you.  The tunnel opens up into a huge chamber here, and by the way the dust
flies around the opening you can tell that some entity passed through here
quite recently.

An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.
A man from sargasso is here exploring the tunnel.

w
Exploring underground
  Clank, clank, clank.  In the distance you hear iron weapons being
sharpened on the granite walls of the cave, and you worry that you might be
ambushed somewhere ...  But where?  You start thinking that the more you
travel in these strange lands the more questions pop into your head - but
you still have no answers.  The smell of fresh blood wafts in from the
south, and you question the wisdom of travelling in that direction.  You
wrinkle your nose at the prospect of seeing another dead body (even the most
bloodthirsty of warriors has an occasional pang of guilt when seeing a
rotting carcass).  You can also travel east or west to what you hope is a
safer part of the tunnel.

Exploring underground
  The twists and turns of the cavern having completely aggravated you, you
decide to take it easy for a while.  Sitting down on the cold granite floor,
you doze off for a tiny bit, thinking that a little bit of rest is what you
need to clear your mind in the hopes that you can find some way out of this
truly irksome place ...
 You wake up with a jolt as you feel a sharp pain in your left leg.  Your
eyes pierce the darkness and you see two semi-humanoid creatures, each about
1 meter tall.  They unsheath what appears to be a wavy serrated sword and
point it at your throat, demanding all your money.  You sit there,
dumbfounded, and ponder your next move.

Exploring underground
  Clank, clank, clank.  In the distance you hear iron weapons being
sharpened on the granite walls of the cave, and you worry that you might be
ambushed somewhere ...  But where?  You start thinking that the more you
travel in these strange lands the more questions pop into your head - but
you still have no answers.  The smell of fresh blood wafts in from the
south, and you question the wisdom of travelling in that direction.  You
wrinkle your nose at the prospect of seeing another dead body (even the most
bloodthirsty of warriors has an occasional pang of guilt when seeing a
rotting carcass).  You can also travel east or west to what you hope is a
safer part of the tunnel.

fl
Exploring underground
  Even though you are still relatively close to the Sargasso mineshaft, you
cannot believe how different this place is from the accursed town.  Whereas
Sargasso had almost nothing but horror and evil, the underground has a
mysterious quality.  You don't know exactly how to catergorize it: sometimes
the cavern gives off a feeling of warmth and light, other times you cringe
in fear, wondering if your own shadow has turned against you.  Bowing your
head slightly, you utter a quick prayer to your god, asking him to protect
you.  The tunnel opens up into a huge chamber here, and by the way the dust
flies around the opening you can tell that some entity passed through here
quite recently.

Lv 48  G 207925 | Exploring underground (NEW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 

Yerald gossips 'and flying to close to the sun?'

n
Exploring underground
  This mine shaft is certainly much bigger than you thought it would be! 
It appears that the Sargasso miners certainly found a bit more than ore when
they dug deep inside the ground.  The underground caverns seem almost
endless, and you can't help but notice that they seem to be very ancient,
unlike the relatively new mine shaft.  You can climb back up the rope to the
mining settlement, but you get the feeling that it would be much nicer to
explore underground instead.  Paths spiral off in each direction, and you
really don't know which would be the best way to go.  Tiny little runes are
carved inside one of the cavern's walls in runny black ink.  Maybe coming to
Sargasso wasn't such a huge waste after all.  

[ Exits: east south west up ]
A man from sargasso is here exploring the tunnel.
An earth elemental lumbers slowly across the ground here.

u
Inside a small mine shaft
  Rotting oak posts support the ceiling of this very old looking mine
shaft.  You find this to be very strange, because all the other clues point
to the fact that Sargasso is a relatively new settlement.  How odd.  Maybe
there's something more to the mineshaft ...  something beautiful, yet
forgotten for countless ages.  The upper level of the mine shaft continues
south of here, or you can explore the depths of the mine below.

                     Goal information for: Discover what happened to the miners.

too. You need to find the cause of the disappearances, and prevent any more 
disappearances from happening.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Starlight Way - East
  There is something enchanting about walking along the night sky in the middle
of the day, as you continue down the starry path. To the east, you hear the 
bustling activities of adventurers doing their business, purchasing wares, 
and selling off the gains of their toils. Above the clatter you hear someone 
say in a prominent voice, "What?? I don't get it!". The rich smells of breads
and pies fill the air. In the distance, you hear the faint sound of drunken

777/1001 HP  1406/1406 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


help invsort
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Invsort.
Help Category : Information.
Related Helps : Inventory, Equipment, Ifilter, Compare.
Last Updated  : 2016-09-25 17:28:41.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: invsort [sortby] ([container])
        sortby options - type, name, level, wear, weight

The 'invsort' command allows you to view your main inventory, or items 
inside a container, in a sorted format. The sort can be by level, by item 
name, by wear location, or by item type.

When items are sorted by type or wear location, the secondary sort is by
item level.  When items are sorted by level, the item levels are shown even
if the 'noobjlevel' config option is on.

To see the sorted list without the line break, add the 'nolines' option.

Note: 
The invsort command is not complete. Planned additions are sorting by item
points, the ability to actually re-order inventory based on the output and
the ability to view only a single wear location or type.
        
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

803/1001 HP  1406/1406 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
help wear
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Wear Wearable.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : Hold, Remove, Wield.
Last Updated  : 2010-06-10 21:58:26.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Syntax: wear <object> (location) : Wears a particular object.
        wear all                 : Attempts to wear all items in inventory.
        wearable                 : Lists wear locations.

To gain the benefits of an item, you must 'wear' it.  You may not be able
to wear an item if it is too heavy, you are too inexperienced, or it is an
opposing alignment.

'wear all' will attempt to wear all items in inventory.  The first item
from your inventory which fills an empty wear slot, will go in that slot.

Many wearable items offer resistances and/or stats.  Some also offer item
affects- see 'help nofail' for more information.

Some wear-locations are duplicated (for example, wearing two items on the
neck or something on each hand) and may (eventually) vary from player to
player.  You can see the different wear locations available to you with the
'wearable' command.  Items may be worn to a particular slot by using 'wear
<item> <wear-keyword>' (e.g., 'wear chain neck2').

Some commands use wear flags for sorting options; this is visible in the
last column of 'wearable'.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

help cm-eq-Weaponextra
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : CM-EQ-Weaponextra.
Help Category : Clan Equipment.
Related Helps : EQ-Index, EQ-Types, EQ-Weapons.
Last Updated  : 2016-03-02 19:07:25.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Clan Equipment: Weapons - Extra Information

Current:  EQ-Index -> EQ-Types -> EQ-Weapons -> EQ-WeaponExtra

[v0] Weapon Class: The weapon class may be exotic, sword, dagger,
                       mace, flail, whip, polearm, spear, or axe.
 
[v3] Damage Type: The damtype may be one of the following:
Acidic Bite, Air, Beating, Bite, Blast, Charge, Chill, Chop, Chomp, Claw, 
Cleave, Crush, Decaying Touch, Digestion, Divine Power, Drain, Earth, Flame
Flaming bite, Freezing bite, Friction, Grep, Magic, Mental energy, Mind Force,
Peck Bash, Peck Pierce, Pierce, Pound, Punch, Scratch, Shock, Shocking bite, 
Slap, Slash, Slice, Slime, Smash, Stab, Sting, Suction, Thrust, Thwack, Whip, 
Wrath.    
 
[v4] Special Type:
The specials types and costs are:

Flaming, Frost, Vampiric, Sharp, Shocking = 3mil.
Vorpal, Changing = 5mil. 
None = No extra cost.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)

help vampiric flag
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : 'Vampiric Flag'.
Help Category : Equipment.
Related Helps : WFlags.
Last Updated  : 2009-09-20 23:07:33.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Harkening back to the powers of Vlad the Impaler, a weapon with the vampiric
flag has the ability to remove hit points from the target and bestow them 
upon the wielder.  This regenerative ability is powered by particularly dark
forces, and this darkness will slowly corrupt those who prosper from it.

This ability is very similar to the mage spell 'vampiric touch'.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya.

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

You stop holding a Disk of Destruction.

1016/1015 HP  1421/1419 MP  1279/1277 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* WHOOOOOOOOOOOOSH!
Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

[ Exits: north south down ]
