1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (OPK) Icaerus looks for rare mobs..
(Player) (OPK) Forma not formatted.
(Player) Shravani the Sorcerer.
(Player) (Linkdead) Klaukodile the Knight.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
s
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.
(White Aura) An old man leans on a weathered cane.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Phoenix Square (NESWU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
s
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza
  In contrast to the somber reputation of the arch marking the western
entrance to the plaza, the Sunrise Arch is a place to celebrate new life. 
When the New Year's procession winds through the streets, it is tradition
for the celebrants to write their worries of the old year on scrolls and
toss them into a fire built under the arch.  The stone has been stained
black with the soot of a million fears, and each sunrise is a pyre to
consume them again.  At night, the arch is a favored meeting place of
conspirators.  All varieties of hooded figures skulk here by night, before
wandering off to conduct their business.  


[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Fairdeal Alley
  You stand in Fairdeal Alley just east of Meridian Square.  The light has
dimmed as you stand in the shadows of the spires that tower over the city. 
Looking around at the people occupying the alley, you notice that the people
seem friendly.  Perhaps a little too friendly.  While there is no reason to
be suspicious, a nagging feeling gnaws at the pit of your stomach.  

[ Exits: east west ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Starlight Way - East (G)
  Closely examining the onyx-black road of Starlight Way, you perceive tiny
flecks of sparkling light randomly emanating from the stone.  It is truly a
beautiful sight!  The longer you stare, the more entrancing it becomes.  One
could, quite literally, become lost in the soothing abyss of the faux night
road.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A woman makes her way through the crowd, her face covered by a hood.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (EW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Starlight Way - East
  There is something enchanting about walking along the night sky in the middle
of the day, as you continue down the starry path. To the east, you hear the 
bustling activities of adventurers doing their business, purchasing wares, 
and selling off the gains of their toils. Above the clatter you hear someone 
say in a prominent voice, "What?? I don't get it!". The rich smells of breads
and pies fill the air. In the distance, you hear the faint sound of drunken 
dwarves singing.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Bofrob the newbie is begging for gold ..... again.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (EWD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Starlight Way - East (G)
  Starlight Way continues to the east and west through the grand City of
Aylor.  To the north, you can smell the fresh baked goods of the bakery and
hear the distinct metal-on-metal sound of weapons being tested before
purchase.  The sounds of the armorer announcing his goods also hail from
the north.  This district of town is full of young adventurers haggling for
the best prices on well crafted materials.  In the distance, the solemn
echoes of church bells provide a deep harmony.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Aylorian Eatery
  You have traveled up a marble ramp to a platform with a small cafe and
bakery.  A glass case, hosting various samples of the foods one can
purchase, stands before an incredibly large beer keg with a spigot just
below eye level.  A large ratling busily works behind the counter, taking
orders and filling glasses.  There are three ramps leaving this platform. 
The northern ramp leads up.  The eastern and southern ramps lead down.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(White Aura) A relatively clean ratling in an apron prepares food behind the counter.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Eatery (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Necromn's Gourmet Delivery
  This platform has been transformed into a small delicatessen. 
Unfortunately, the smell of good food is overpowered by the smell of decay. 
There is no mystery where the smell of decay comes from.  A long line of
zombies quietly stand shoulder to shoulder up against the wall.  Almost
every one is missing body parts in one form or another.  Apparently, despite
this conflict of interest, Necromn's service is world renowned for his
delicious deliveries.  For more information, read the SIGN.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(White Aura) Necromn, a thin pale vampire, is here preparing orders.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Bookworm's Haven
  This is the only store that is on the ground level.  In each direction
(except to the south) marble ramps rise up to other platforms with more
goods for adventurers to buy.  This particular marble slab holds a small
bookstore with many racks of books and guides which apparently sell like
hotcakes, since many of the slots are now empty and vacant.  You begin to
think the store is unmanned until you notice a transparent shadow behind the
desk.  

On the wall you notice a PLAQUE showing the Aardwolf Trivia Hall of Fame.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Bookworm's Haven (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Grizrol's Grocery
  A small marble ramp takes you to a raised platform that houses numerous
shelves with goods and supplies typical for beginning adventurers.  A large,
ugly creature stands behind a counter.  He is watching you, but he carefully
avoids looking directly at you.  To the north, the marble floor raises again
to lead you to another platform.  To the west, the ramp heads down to the
base floor of the multi-tiered market area.  

[ Exits: north south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl

n
Hyntrie's Herbal Offerings
  The marble floor here is dusted with dirt in most areas and is muddy in
others.  A Large Sign sits in the corner of the room next to a small
table and cashbox.  The room is filled with flowers and is enveloped in a
potpourri of millbloom, yellow toe-snapper, and winterlace native to this
region.  Some of the plants, cordoned off from the customers, snap and hiss
to get your attention.

Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (NEW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Starlight Way - East
  There is something enchanting about walking along the night sky in the middle
of the day, as you continue down the starry path. To the east, you hear the 
bustling activities of adventurers doing their business, purchasing wares, 
and selling off the gains of their toils. Above the clatter you hear someone 
say in a prominent voice, "What?? I don't get it!". The rich smells of breads
and pies fill the air. In the distance, you hear the faint sound of drunken 
dwarves singing.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Bofrob the newbie is begging for gold ..... again.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Starlight Way - East (G)
  Closely examining the onyx-black road of Starlight Way, you perceive tiny
flecks of sparkling light randomly emanating from the stone.  It is truly a
beautiful sight!  The longer you stare, the more entrancing it becomes.  One
could, quite literally, become lost in the soothing abyss of the faux night
road.

To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.

w
Ivar's Item Remodeling
  The square marble slab floor of this shopette is perfectly clean.  Not a
single thing touches the ground, with the exception of the feet of the
people standing on it.  However, there is still quite a lot here.  Test
tubes and tomes all float in mid-air as though they are resting on invisible
stands and shelves.  One woman sits in mid-air in the middle of the room. 
Her eyes are closed, but you get the feeling that she is completely aware of
her surroundings and of the fact that you are standing before her.  There
are 3 ramps leading north, west, and east to higher-level platforms. 

Perhaps you should read the SIGN.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

w
Xena's Weapon Parlor (G)
  Xena, Andolor's most famous weaponsmith, stands next to a large forge. 
She is speaking with a troll who is testing the feel of a blade in his hand.
Many daggers, swords, flails, and maces sit in racks all neatly organized
for customer access.  A trellis covers this platform, supported by beams
based at each of the four corners.  Various staves and polearms are
suspended from the trellis by large hooks.  A ramp to the north will take
you to a higher platform, while the eastern ramp takes you to a lower one.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Xena's Weapon Parlor (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Aylorian Elemental Designs
  An old brain teaser asks, "What weighs more, a ton of feathers or a ton
of lead?"  At Aylorian Elemental Designs the answer is, "Which can you
afford to make weigh more?"  These powerful elemental mages have been
disregarding the physics of mass times acceleration for generations!  This
section of the shopette platform is lined with a collection of odd items,
and the elementalists shout for the edification of the crowd: "Come!  See
the feather that weighs as much as a boulder!  See the anvil that is lighter
than a handful of grass clippings!"  The elementalists have prepared a SIGN
for those interested in their services.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(White Aura) A strange old elementalist is standing here.

s
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
(Player) Hild the Soldier.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

Whitewind Avenue (G)

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

w
Adventurer's Travel Company
  "You can't fight the beast if you can't make the journey!"
 
As you scan the area, you are alarmed to discover that the booming loud
advertisement came from a tiny fae in a bright purple gown.  The only thing
more questionable than how something so small could be so loud is how
this tiny creature manages to handle such large merchandise.
 
Perhaps, some things are better left unknown.

(White Aura) Niteglo, pixie merchant extraordinaire, is pitching the newest mode of water travel.

w
Grandmarket Boulevard
  People, creatures, specters, animals.  The streets are overloaded with
everything capable of motion.  Handheld carts and men on horses push blindly
through the crowd with little sympathy for those in their way.  What could
possibly be found here worth all this hassle?  Do you dare give up looking
before you find out?  

[ Exits: north east west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Grandmarket Boulevard (NEW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Mayvor's Mystic Mastery
  This small, tidy tent houses numerous racks of magical paraphernalia. 
Hundreds of mystical reagents are perfectly organized by their mystical
properties.  A separate rack houses a number of quills, sorted by feather
type, size, thickness, and color.  A variety of parchments and wands are
sorted in a similarly obsessive fashion.  Mayvor is a strong believer in "a
place for everything, and everything in its place."  

[ Exits: north east west ]
A small gnome walks past hurriedly, deep in his thoughts.

Grandmarket Boulevard
  As you push your way through the hordes, you notice in the not-so-distant

from the boulevard.  Above your head, a wayward harpy screeches foul words

smell is atrocious!

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Grandmarket Boulevard (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Big Scale
  This small shoppette is out in the open air and houses a diverse supply
of dragonscale armor.  It is managed by a hulking ogre missing four
fingers, one ear, and half her foot.  Pieces are haphazardly placed. 
Helmets are tossed into a pile in the corner, boots are randomly shoved
into a large barrel (Good luck finding a matching pair!), and leggings
are carelessly strewn on a table top.  You can't really expect more; ogres
are hardly concerned with inventory management.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
A large werewolf by the name of Lord Lupris, heads to visit Yvan.
(White Aura) An ogre with long hair and biceps the size of snuckles shapes a large dragon scale.

that grows brighter as you approach it.  A yelp sounds from the room as
someone haphazardly touches the barrier, and everyone flinches except for the
centaur shopkeeper who is quite used to the random cries.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Grandmarket Boulevard (NEW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (G)
  Many rumors surround the Bank of Ivar.  Older adventurers remember the
primitive bank location and large vault where money was stored.  This bank
consists of a single eldar standing behind a large wooden desk.  He wears
only a simple brown robe and a pair of gloves that provide coverage up to
his shoulders.  The desk houses a single large hole that leads to places
unknown.  Many people have ventured to guess the location of where it leads,
but no one knows for sure.

You watch as the eldar reaches into the hole to pull out pouch after
pouch of perfectly counted gold coins.  The only greater mystery here is how
the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Aylorian Pets and Companions
  Cages, crates, boxes, and pens clutter the space.  The area is a ruckus
of animal calls, scratching, and yelps.  A large, black spectral caw stands
perched at the entrance, repeatedly crying out, "Pets may bite, watch your
fingers!" as people enter the area.  A bright yellow sign displays
further information regarding purchases.

[ Exits: east south west ]

(White Aura) Rwaul, the pet shop boy, mindlessly scratches at his collar.

Grandmarket Boulevard
  People, creatures, specters, animals.  The streets are overloaded with
everything capable of motion.  Handheld carts and men on horses push blindly
through the crowd with little sympathy for those in their way.  What could
possibly be found here worth all this hassle?  Do you dare give up looking
before you find out?

reds, blues, magentas, and greens.  Many signs sit everywhere, saying,
"Do not touch!",  "Leave it alone!",  and "Hands to Yourself!".
A small, old gnome stands on a step stool, busily pouring a bubbling gel
into a small flask.

goes awry.

e
Grandmarket Boulevard
  As you push your way through the hordes, you notice in the not-so-distant
south that the crowds cease and a small road clears off, leading its way
away from the boulevard.  Underfoot, a small wooble begs your pardon as you
nearly kick it down the paved street.  Boy, you thought you had it bad!  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A citizen walks around with his nose in the air.
A decaying zombie looks for a replacement for his left arm.
A wealthy elven citizen glances at you as she slowly walks past.

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* One-Eyed Lester's Platemail Armory
  A large, grey tent stands here on the boulevard.  It is filthy and
stained, and it stinks unattractively.  A cyclops by the name of Lester
stands here with a pair of oversized awl and mallet working with a large,
thick sheet of metal.  There are many headless torsos around the room,
sporting dingy but deftly crafted chest pieces.  Stone busts don helmets of
various styles; gloves and boots sit upon tables.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

A BIG man with a single large eye surveys the room.

Lv 48  G 207865 | Grandmarket Boulevard (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Aardwolf Lottery Headquarters
  A brightly colored sign magically flashes on and off, proclaiming BIG
BUCKS!  BIG BUCKS!   and casting a dingy yellow haze through the
smoke-filled room.  Looking about, you see citizens from throughout the
realm tightly clutching small scraps of precious paper.  Or so they hope. 
Glancing around the room, you see discarded losing lottery tickets covering
the floor and tossed haphazardly on tabletops. 
 
Suddenly a *shriek* of pleasure fills the air as yet another winner matches 
numbers and strikes it rich!  You wonder how you can take part in this!  
From out of nowhere, a gentle voice whispers, "Read 'Help Lottery'." 

[ Exits: north west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Grandmarket Boulevard (NEW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (G)
  Many rumors surround the Bank of Ivar.  Older adventurers remember the
primitive bank location and large vault where money was stored.  This bank
consists of a single eldar standing behind a large wooden desk.  He wears
only a simple brown robe and a pair of gloves that provide coverage up to
his shoulders.  The desk houses a single large hole that leads to places
unknown.  Many people have ventured to guess the location of where it leads,
but no one knows for sure.

You watch as the eldar reaches into the hole to pull out pouch after
pouch of perfectly counted gold coins.  The only greater mystery here is how
the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of Grandmarket Boulevard. 
Farther south, Whitewind meets up with Darksoil Path in a soft merging of
roadways.  The road here on Whitewind is as white as snow.  You cannot
imagine the thousands of footsteps that the road has endured, but it seems
no worse for wear.  In fact, the road is a pristine snow white and quite
beautiful.  

[ Exits: north south ]
(Hidden) Baron Vankoliche, tall and pale, takes a stroll and looks over the neighborhood.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Intersection of Whitewind and Darksoil (G)
  The loud bustle of Grandmarket Boulevard fills the intersection of
Whitewind Avenue and Darksoil Path.  Whitewind Avenue heads north and south
through the center of the city.  Darksoil Path leads east and west. 
Following Darksoil Path to the west leads you toward oddly shaped houses.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Intersection of Whitewind and Darksoil (NESWD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Whitewind Avenue
  Walking along this section of Whitewind Avenue, strollers can experience
a pleasant aroma of earth and flowers carried on the breeze.  People say
that the smell in the air is an enchantment, part of the mysticism of Aylor
that occurs even in the worst of storms.  The avenue is a pristine white,
which, with its scent, can't help but refresh even the most weary of
adventurers.  

[ Exits: north south ]
This noble is walking quite quickly, probably to avoid you!
A goblin carries a large money sack that reads 'Tax'.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue
  The pure white avenue beneath your feet trademarks the road from which
its name originates.  The road travels north and south, this portion of it
laying between Darksoil Path and Faeriefog Lane.  To the south and west, you
see a large residential part that hosts a large attraction that the local
residents are very proud.  Beyond the houses to the east, you can hear the
laughter of children and the splashing of water in the distance.  Residents
and adventurers make their way past, some exploring, others searching for
their future legacies.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
(Player) Hild the Soldier.
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Ilbrost lives free in the Woods of Aardwolf.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

On a busy walkway (1269)

On a busy walkway
  This walkway is made of dark red brick.  It is very wide, with people of
every description traveling along its length.  Doors open off of this
walkway to both the east and the west.  To the east is the reptile habitat
and to the west is the children's petting zoo.  Flower beds and privet
hedges line the walkway, adding beauty as well as defining the path and
fencing off the grass.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A stunning blue peacock displays his tail while he struts along.
A young man carefully combs his blond hair.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Entrance to the Petting Zoo
  This is the entrance to the children's petting zoo.  Inside are many soft
and gentle animals.  They are all patient and used to children.  It has two
doors to keep the animals in while the people come and go.  Please be sure
to shut one door before opening the other so that the animals don't get out.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1264/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1263/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Kiko Monocle Wearing Gentleman [MWG].
(Translucent) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is whispering
incantations.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
In the Back of the Aylorian Temple (G)
  Standing in the back of the Temple of Aylor, one can truly appreciate
its unique structure and design.  The white marble walls and floor blend
together, accented by black pews, altar, and pulpit.  The blood-red candles
around the room seem calming but almost foreboding.  The windows, accented
in gold, are brightly painted to portray handsome yet intimidating scenes.
A large, white and gold statue of a man monuments the front of the room. 
The statue stands taller than 20 feet in the temple's vaulted ceiling.

The temple's altar stands to the north, with the exit into Aylor to the south. 
A small black doorway stands in the distance to the west.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | In the Back of the Aylorian Temple (NESWD)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
An Intersection in the Temple (G)
  You are walking up the center aisle between rows of pews.  Travelling
farther north takes you up to the pulpit, the raised platform from which the
divine leaders give their sermons.  The lectern holds a large book, which
appears to have a black leather cover.  Heading east or west at this point
takes you into the black marble pews.  The temple's exit is south.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(Translucent) (White Aura) Mother Mystra, head mother of the Ivarian Order dons soft golden robes.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Upon the Pulpit (G)
  You stand behind a lectern made of black marble to match the pews of the
temple.  By approaching it, you trigger a magical spell that encompasses the
podium and everything near it in a soft golden glow to draw and keep the
attention of onlookers.  There is a small cupboard door on the backside
of the lecturn before you.  It is trimmed with gold at its edges.  Behind
you, a shrouded door hides a small back room for private ceremonies.

s
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.

     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza
  In contrast to the somber reputation of the arch marking the western
entrance to the plaza, the Sunrise Arch is a place to celebrate new life. 
When the New Year's procession winds through the streets, it is tradition
for the celebrants to write their worries of the old year on scrolls and
toss them into a fire built under the arch.  The stone has been stained
black with the soot of a million fears, and each sunrise is a pyre to
consume them again.  At night, the arch is a favored meeting place of
conspirators.  All varieties of hooded figures skulk here by night, before
wandering off to conduct their business.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Fairdeal Alley
  You stand in Fairdeal Alley just east of Meridian Square.  The light has
dimmed as you stand in the shadows of the spires that tower over the city. 
Looking around at the people occupying the alley, you notice that the people
seem friendly.  Perhaps a little too friendly.  While there is no reason to
be suspicious, a nagging feeling gnaws at the pit of your stomach.  

[ Exits: east west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Adventurer's Travel Company
  "You can't fight the beast if you can't make the journey!"
 
As you scan the area, you are alarmed to discover that the booming loud
advertisement came from a tiny fae in a bright purple gown.  The only thing
more questionable than how something so small could be so loud is how
this tiny creature manages to handle such large merchandise.
 
Perhaps, some things are better left unknown.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(White Aura) Niteglo, pixie merchant extraordinaire, is pitching the newest mode of water travel.

1016/1016 HP  1391/1421 MP  1278/1279 mv  919tnl

>>   *[NOEXP]* Armchair Avenger Clan Hall (G) (1277)

Alas, you cannot go that way.
The Grand City of Aylor (G) (1277)

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

1016/1016 HP  1391/1421 MP  1277/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
s
Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.
(Player) Fievel is out there, somewhere....
(Player) (OPK) Icaerus looks for rare mobs..
(Player) (Invis) (White Aura) Cirrus [[moshimo inochiga egaketara]].

1016/1016 HP  1391/1421 MP  1277/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Phoenix Square (NESWU)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

1016/1016 HP  1391/1421 MP  1277/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1391/1421 MP  1277/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Character autosaved at Sun Jul 30 13:36:17 2023.

s
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Adventurer's Travel Company
  "You can't fight the beast if you can't make the journey!"
 
As you scan the area, you are alarmed to discover that the booming loud
advertisement came from a tiny fae in a bright purple gown.  The only thing
more questionable than how something so small could be so loud is how
this tiny creature manages to handle such large merchandise.
 
Perhaps, some things are better left unknown.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(White Aura) Niteglo, pixie merchant extraordinaire, is pitching the newest mode of water travel.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (G)
  Many rumors surround the Bank of Ivar.  Older adventurers remember the
primitive bank location and large vault where money was stored.  This bank
consists of a single eldar standing behind a large wooden desk.  He wears
only a simple brown robe and a pair of gloves that provide coverage up to
his shoulders.  The desk houses a single large hole that leads to places
unknown.  Many people have ventured to guess the location of where it leads,
but no one knows for sure.

You watch as the eldar reaches into the hole to pull out pouch after
pouch of perfectly counted gold coins.  The only greater mystery here is how
the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Grandmarket Boulevard
  People, creatures, specters, animals.  The streets are overloaded with
everything capable of motion.  Handheld carts and men on horses push blindly
through the crowd with little sympathy for those in their way.  What could
possibly be found here worth all this hassle?  Do you dare give up looking
before you find out?

[ Exits: north east west ]
A tiny red imp runs around collecting litter.

n
Aylorian Pets and Companions
  Cages, crates, boxes, and pens clutter the space.  The area is a ruckus
of animal calls, scratching, and yelps.  A large, black spectral caw stands
perched at the entrance, repeatedly crying out, "Pets may bite, watch your
fingers!" as people enter the area.  A bright yellow sign displays
further information regarding purchases.

[ Exits: east south west ]
A sad-looking silver-haired gnome walks slowly past you.
(White Aura) Rwaul, the pet shop boy, mindlessly scratches at his collar.

Aeleron's Alchemy Supplies (G)
  This small stand is surrounded by an average sized fence, which has
only three openings to let customers into the shop.  The small fence
contains a vast number of cauldrons boiling and bubbling with liquids of
reds, blues, magentas, and greens.  Many signs sit everywhere, saying,
"Do not touch!",  "Leave it alone!",  and "Hands to Yourself!".
A small, old gnome stands on a step stool, busily pouring a bubbling gel
into a small flask.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Grand Plaza
  In contrast to the somber reputation of the arch marking the western
entrance to the plaza, the Sunrise Arch is a place to celebrate new life. 
When the New Year's procession winds through the streets, it is tradition
for the celebrants to write their worries of the old year on scrolls and
toss them into a fire built under the arch.  The stone has been stained
black with the soot of a million fears, and each sunrise is a pyre to
consume them again.  At night, the arch is a favored meeting place of
conspirators.  All varieties of hooded figures skulk here by night, before
wandering off to conduct their business.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Fairdeal Alley
  You stand in Fairdeal Alley just east of Meridian Square.  The light has
dimmed as you stand in the shadows of the spires that tower over the city. 
Looking around at the people occupying the alley, you notice that the people
seem friendly.  Perhaps a little too friendly.  While there is no reason to
be suspicious, a nagging feeling gnaws at the pit of your stomach.  

[ Exits: east west ]

Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.
(Player) Fievel is out there, somewhere....
(Player) (OPK) Icaerus looks for rare mobs..

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Phoenix Square (NESWU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
e
Starlight Way - East (G)
  Closely examining the onyx-black road of Starlight Way, you perceive tiny
flecks of sparkling light randomly emanating from the stone.  It is truly a
beautiful sight!  The longer you stare, the more entrancing it becomes.  One
could, quite literally, become lost in the soothing abyss of the faux night
road.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A woman makes her way through the crowd, her face covered by a hood.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Starlight Way - East
  There is something enchanting about walking along the night sky in the middle
of the day, as you continue down the starry path. To the east, you hear the 
bustling activities of adventurers doing their business, purchasing wares, 
and selling off the gains of their toils. Above the clatter you hear someone 
say in a prominent voice, "What?? I don't get it!". The rich smells of breads
and pies fill the air. In the distance, you hear the faint sound of drunken 
dwarves singing.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Bofrob the newbie is begging for gold ..... again.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (EWD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* Starlight Way - East (G)
  Starlight Way continues to the east and west through the grand City of
Aylor.  To the north, you can smell the fresh baked goods of the bakery and
hear the distinct metal-on-metal sound of weapons being tested before
purchase.  The sounds of the armorer announcing his goods also hail from
the north.  This district of town is full of young adventurers haggling for
the best prices on well crafted materials.  In the distance, the solemn
echoes of church bells provide a deep harmony.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (NEW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
n
Starlight Way - East (G)
  The sounds of the armor and weapon shops continue from the north, and the
sweet scents of flowers and pastries permeate the air.  To the south lies
the narrower path of Fairdeal Alley, appropriately named as it stretches
from the east and west wares districts of Aylor.  The Starlight Way
continues east and west with its haunting midnight glow.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Starlight Way - East (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Bookworm's Haven
  This is the only store that is on the ground level.  In each direction
(except to the south) marble ramps rise up to other platforms with more
goods for adventurers to buy.  This particular marble slab holds a small
bookstore with many racks of books and guides which apparently sell like
hotcakes, since many of the slots are now empty and vacant.  You begin to
think the store is unmanned until you notice a transparent shadow behind the
desk.  

On the wall you notice a PLAQUE showing the Aardwolf Trivia Hall of Fame.

The Aylorian Eatery
  You have traveled up a marble ramp to a platform with a small cafe and
bakery.  A glass case, hosting various samples of the foods one can
purchase, stands before an incredibly large beer keg with a spigot just
below eye level.  A large ratling busily works behind the counter, taking
orders and filling glasses.  There are three ramps leaving this platform. 
The northern ramp leads up.  The eastern and southern ramps lead down.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Starlight Way - West (G)
  The starry path continues to the east and west through the city.  As you
pass its inhabitants, you notice that many of the district's occupants have
a rough and tough demeanor.  Many of the travellers are scarred or missing
appendages.  Many of the elders are wise and have an enchanting nature to
them.  Little inspires you to greet these people, for you fear they may be
looking for a fight.

emitted from the local armor shop to the north, and the ringing of hammers
on metal sounds throughout the city as new blades are forged by
weaponsmiths.  The haunting black path of Starlight Way travels east and
west through the city.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Ivar's Item Remodeling
  The square marble slab floor of this shopette is perfectly clean.  Not a
single thing touches the ground, with the exception of the feet of the
people standing on it.  However, there is still quite a lot here.  Test
tubes and tomes all float in mid-air as though they are resting on invisible
stands and shelves.  One woman sits in mid-air in the middle of the room. 
Her eyes are closed, but you get the feeling that she is completely aware of
her surroundings and of the fact that you are standing before her.  There
are 3 ramps leading north, west, and east to higher-level platforms. 

Perhaps you should read the SIGN.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) A strange looking psionicist hovers in a sitting position in the middle of the room.

w
Xena's Weapon Parlor (G)
  Xena, Andolor's most famous weaponsmith, stands next to a large forge. 
She is speaking with a troll who is testing the feel of a blade in his hand.
Many daggers, swords, flails, and maces sit in racks all neatly organized
for customer access.  A trellis covers this platform, supported by beams
based at each of the four corners.  Various staves and polearms are
suspended from the trellis by large hooks.  A ramp to the north will take
you to a higher platform, while the eastern ramp takes you to a lower one.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
(White Aura) Xena, the master weaponsmith, stands before you, trying to sell you a blade.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Xena's Weapon Parlor (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Aylorian Elemental Designs
  An old brain teaser asks, "What weighs more, a ton of feathers or a ton
of lead?"  At Aylorian Elemental Designs the answer is, "Which can you
afford to make weigh more?"  These powerful elemental mages have been
disregarding the physics of mass times acceleration for generations!  This
section of the shopette platform is lined with a collection of odd items,
and the elementalists shout for the edification of the crowd: "Come!  See
the feather that weighs as much as a boulder!  See the anvil that is lighter
than a handful of grass clippings!"  The elementalists have prepared a SIGN
for those interested in their services.  

[ Exits: east south ]
(White Aura) A strange old elementalist is standing here.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207865 | Aylorian Elemental Designs (ES)

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Aylorian Forge
  A large forge takes up the middle of the platform, with only the
outskirts of the platform allotted for visitors' passage.  A hot breeze
blows its way across the forge, radiating heat in all directions.  Ramps
extend from the platform's edges, and a spiral staircase leads to another
level up above.  
 
Perhaps you should read the SIGN.

[ Exits: north east south west up ]

Ivar's Weapon Forge

that is likely enchanted to withstand the magical fire.  A single ramp leads
south from this platform to a lower one.

Starlight Way - East (G)
  Starlight Way continues to the east and west through the grand City of
Aylor.  To the north, you can smell the fresh baked goods of the bakery and
hear the distinct metal-on-metal sound of weapons being tested before
purchase.  The sounds of the armorer announcing his goods also hail from
the north.  This district of town is full of young adventurers haggling for
the best prices on well crafted materials.  In the distance, the solemn
echoes of church bells provide a deep harmony.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Aylorian Eatery
  You have traveled up a marble ramp to a platform with a small cafe and
bakery.  A glass case, hosting various samples of the foods one can
purchase, stands before an incredibly large beer keg with a spigot just
below eye level.  A large ratling busily works behind the counter, taking
orders and filling glasses.  There are three ramps leaving this platform. 
The northern ramp leads up.  The eastern and southern ramps lead down.

n
Necromn's Gourmet Delivery
  This platform has been transformed into a small delicatessen. 
Unfortunately, the smell of good food is overpowered by the smell of decay. 
There is no mystery where the smell of decay comes from.  A long line of
zombies quietly stand shoulder to shoulder up against the wall.  Almost
every one is missing body parts in one form or another.  Apparently, despite
this conflict of interest, Necromn's service is world renowned for his
delicious deliveries.  For more information, read the SIGN.

s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Fairdeal Alley (G)
  You enter into a dim alley.  The alley is not dark or dingy, nor is it
cluttered or messy.  It is just an alley, and the road is paved to look like
it is covered in gold coins of various denominations.  You get the feeling,
though, that even though the alley is not dark or messy or dingy, it is the
sort of place, given its occupants, that very well should be.  To the north,
the slightly more secure Starlight Way runs east and west through the city.
To the south, Fairdeal Alley takes you to a point that is less readily
escapable.  

[ Exits: north south ]

itself as that size.  To the west, the spires of Meridian Square tower
overhead, blocking the sun as if standing guard over the city.

Fairdeal Alley (G)

you with suspicion, others with the delight of another chance to peddle
their wares.  The alley continues north and south, where it turns to head
towards Meridian Square.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Finishing Blow
  You've entered a small, quaint bar, with beat-up tables and little

three of which have customers.  The bar itself has one man seated alone. 
This is likely the dirtiest place you've visited in Aylor.  It's no wonder
there is little patronage.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl

>>   *[NOEXP]* Barside at the Finishing Blow (G)
  The long bar has only a single customer.  He does not look like someone
you could easily sit next to and strike up a conversation.  There is a foggy
glass mirror behind the bar, customarily covered by a series of large kegs
that support the typical dwarven specialties and elven wines.  The Finishing
Blow...  It seemed like a silly name for a bar, but in reality, it seems as
though this place has seen its fair share of brawls.
