1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza
  The air in the southeast corner of the plaza seems constantly charged
with magic.  The Tower of the Mind to the east houses the Guild of
Psionicists, its stones supposedly individually laid using only psychic
will.  To the south is the Tower of Sorcery, colloquially referred to as
Black Cat Tower, which houses the Mages' Guild.  This tower's appearance is
by far the most extreme of all, with several of its higher spires completely
detached from the main structure and floating in the air.  Powerful
sorcerers levitate out from the central edifice at impossible heights in
order to reach the magically-suspended satellite towers where only the most
exalted of the Guild are allowed to congregate.  Like the other guild towers,
these are guarded against outsiders.  Here and there herbalists shout the
lists of exotic spell ingredients they have for sale, while mentalists offer
up a panoply of concentration aids.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) Mistress Marna, a lamian adventurer, polishes her armor.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
In Black Cat Tower (G)
  The very air seems to resonate with an electrical intensity inside the
Mages' Guild.  Groups of novices move throughout the tower, making their way
to this or that class, while experienced Spellcasters take advantage of the
libraries or perhaps use the common room as a place to catch up on some
reading.  Familiars are also in evidence-- many of them the sort of onyx
felines that gave the tower its nickname-- running, flying, slithering, or in
some cases oozing in pursuit of some errand given them by their masters. 
The upper levels of the tower are accessed by a series of levitation tubes
that gently pull entering sorcerers up to the next level of the tower.  The
Tower of Sorcery is a place of exotic enchantments and curious cantrips
where wizards of all stripes can find something to learn if pride will let
them be taught.  

[ Exits: north up ]
( 2) (Hum) Fin cut off a Card shark.
     (Glow) (Hum) A small ring lies here.
( 2) A carrion crawler water skin has been discarded.
     A gnarled pine staff lies here, gathering dust. [2/2]
     (Invis) (Hum) This spiked ring looks like it would be uncomfortable to actually wear.
     The crumpled black robes of Ishta sit in a pile here.
     A pair of spotty pyjamas.
     (Glow) A battered old handbook lays here. [2/4]
     (Glow) (Hum) A practice mask lies here.
     A card shark has lost its teeth here.
The Master of Novices is here to train you in the Arts.

with magic.  The Tower of the Mind to the east houses the Guild of

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.  

[ Exits: north south ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A sad-looking silver-haired gnome walks slowly past you.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (G)
  Many rumors surround the Bank of Ivar.  Older adventurers remember the
primitive bank location and large vault where money was stored.  This bank
consists of a single eldar standing behind a large wooden desk.  He wears
only a simple brown robe and a pair of gloves that provide coverage up to
his shoulders.  The desk houses a single large hole that leads to places
unknown.  Many people have ventured to guess the location of where it leads,
but no one knows for sure.

You watch as the eldar reaches into the hole to pull out pouch after
pouch of perfectly counted gold coins.  The only greater mystery here is how
the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]*

was the same. Thank you!'

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of Grandmarket Boulevard. 
Farther south, Whitewind meets up with Darksoil Path in a soft merging of
roadways.  The road here on Whitewind is as white as snow.  You cannot
imagine the thousands of footsteps that the road has endured, but it seems
no worse for wear.  In fact, the road is a pristine snow white and quite
beautiful.  

[ Exits: north south ]

the eldar is able to manipulate the hole, since any hand that reaches into
the hole pulls back nothing but a bloody stub.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
(White Aura) The local banker, Phreshnar, sits behind a table with a hole in the center.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Aylorian Bank of Ivar (NESW)
n
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel)

  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
(Player) (White Aura) Wonder Wandering around..
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
n
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
Fievel just sent you a tell.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure water.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1279/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207865 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
n
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1146/1421 MP  1251/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel)

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?  

[ Exits: north south ]

1016/1016 HP  1221/1421 MP  1230/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207874 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya.

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

1016/1016 HP  1421/1421 MP  1276/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207937 | A magical warehouse (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.

Task 4  : Bring a Cinekon fly potion to the mayor.

Kilrya says, "I need you to bring me one of the flying potions from the
 warehouse."
Kilrya says, "I want to make sure they are still making quality
 products."

You should not leave the city for this task.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

The windhouse
  This is a roofless building, so the breeze flows through here quite heavily.
You can now see the two devices above are creating an air flow. While most 
wind mills collect wind to make energy, it appears as if these are being used
to make wind to keep air flowing in the correct direction through the city.
What a neat idea! The exit of this building is to the west, and the factory 
continues north and east.

is undone. The rest of the building continues south and west.

Lv 48  G 207937 | The windhouse (ES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 

Icaerus gossips 'Lasher on gossip earlier, now imms making it rain with a restore.  Sounds like Wolf
clan meeting today.'

tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.

Task 4  : Bring a Cinekon fly potion to the mayor.

Kilrya says, "I need you to bring me one of the flying potions from the
 warehouse."
Kilrya says, "I want to make sure they are still making quality
 products."

You should not leave the city for this task.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

like this? Is there a pot of gold at the end of both?! Probably not.

here gazing at the sights. The rainbows continue north, east and south.

[ Exits: north east south ]
     A market directional sign is sticking out of the rainbow.

1016/1016 HP  1420/1421 MP  1264/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207937 | Colliding rainbows (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Northern end of the rainbow
  Finally! You've managed to find the end of a rainbow. Unfortunately, there is
no magical pot of lucky gold here. You knew that was just folklore! A couple 
merchants are selling their wares to the east and west. The large drop off 
from this rainbow prevents travel north, and it extends further to the south.

[ Exits: east south west ]
A wealthy shopper carries around bags of purchased goods.
A butterfly likes hanging around the rainbows.

1016/1016 HP  1420/1421 MP  1263/1279 mv  919tnl (Reply: Fievel) 
Lv 48  G 207937 | Northern end of the rainbow (ESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
A floating weaponry
  The clouds here seem to be a bit thinner, so you must assume the only thing 
holding up all this heavy weapon making equipment must be magic. Not to 
mention the shoppers coming and going. They act as if this is daily life, so 
it must have been for years in the past. Many weapon cases on the cloud and 
floating in the air display the latest makings for sale, only available here 
in the city. To the west lies the rainbow.

list

Welcome to Aardwolf. May your adventures be mystical, challenging and rewarding.
Octavian Road
  This is the rich part of town here in Reme. Tall columns line the street and 
marble drinking troughs sit by the side of the road for the horses that pull 
the gilded chariots. Even the servants in this section wear clothes that 
would cost you a year's looting to be able to afford. Octavian road continues
to your north and to the south you can see the South gate of Reme.

[ Exits: north south ]

Octavian Road
  The houses around you have steadily grown taller and more elegant in the
last few blocks.  One giant in particular stands to the west, a massive
construction of mortar and marble towering into the sky, with servants
running in and out of it carrying every imaginable load.  To your north and

Lv 48  G 207937 | Octavian Road (NS)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Octavian Road
  The roadway, always gleaming white, now seems to glow with pure white
light.  The houses around you are growing steadily larger, and servants and
nobility buzz around in the street like bees in a hive.  Clearly you are
entering the wealthy area of the city.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A sailor is visiting Reme.

1016/1016 HP  1257/1421 MP  1277/1279 mv  919tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Octavian Road (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Octavian Square
  This white square is composed of thousands of slabs of the purest marble,
laid cunningly end to end.  In the centre, a pedestal rises from the marbled
ground, with carvings of palm leaves and olive branches decorating the
sides.  From this pedestal a tall white statue rises, of a man in his
middle years with a regal bearing.  His cold stare tells that well the
sculptor his passions read, as he stares beyond the walls of Reme.  A small
plaque at the statue's feet reads simply 'Emperor Octavian.'  Roadways lead
from here in all directions.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A white marble statue of the Emperor Octavian is here.

Octavian Road
  This road is made of a white marble, and is kept scrupulously clean.

Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Player) (OPK) Forma not formatted.

Outside the Aylorian Academy (G)
  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

s
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

3/918 HP  1114/1312 MP  1219/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

918/918 HP  1312/1312 MP  1216/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Boot Clan Public Hall (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Military Surplus Store (G)
  You have entered a warehouse filled with military gear. Heaps of battered 
helmets and other miscellanea lay scattered randomly around the warehouse.
Dust covers much of it, tickling your nostrils, and making you want to 
sneeze. As you make your way down the ragtag aisles you finally stumble upon
the front desk. An old man with one eye stares at you. Better make it quick 
he doesn't seem to have much patience. Type list to view its wares. 

[ Exits: south west ]

918/918 HP  1312/1312 MP  1215/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Military Surplus Store (SW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
n
Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave

chance.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
A Long and Dusty Paved Road
  The cracked sun bleached paving stones of this ancient road have
given way to a more level and repaired stretch of footbeaten rock.  The
sands blowing across the roadway have not yet erased the faint signs of work
done to maintain and repair this desolate strand of path, this desert road
that twists and turns among the uncaring sands.  You press on, into the
glare of the mid afternoon sun.

[ Exits: east west ]
A sailor is visiting Reme.

918/918 HP  1010/1312 MP  1217/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | A Long and Dusty Paved Road (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
A Carefully Maintained Road
  The road here is as well maintained as it is abandoned to your west. 
The sands are held at bay with a cunning wall of stone, which gives the rock
of the road the appearance of a great causeway rising above the harsh and
merciless sands of the desert.  To your east you can barely make out through
the blinding sun some sort of intersection defying the soft curves that the
desert would seem to prefer. 

[ Exits: east west ]

918/918 HP  1010/1312 MP  1214/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | A Carefully Maintained Road (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
A Carefully Maintained Road
  The road is wider here as it approaches the intersection before you. 
You can see more clearly now that what you took for mountains in the
distance, seen hazily through the slow moving desert air, is in fact the
spires and towers of a great city rising before you.  To your west the
desert slowly drinks in the concrete river of the road you travel on.  To
your east it meets another road in a great intersection. 

[ Exits: east west ]
(White Aura) A retired soldier strolls along.
(White Aura) A tall elf bard recites poetry.

918/918 HP  1010/1312 MP  1211/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | A Carefully Maintained Road (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Well Travelled Crossroads
  The road you have been following through the desert has arrived at a
great intersection, carved from the rock and the sands that seem to make up
most of this place.  A rusting iron cage hangs forlornly from a graying
wooden pole, squeaking in the harsh acid wind that blows across the sandy
wastes about you.  A few sullen vultures sit upon the pole, regarding you
strangely as you peer into the rusting iron of the cage and notice bleached
bones and rags that tell of past meals for these scavengers of the sky. 
Sand blasted expanses of road lead off in all directions, and along the one
to your east you can see the hazy spires of a mighty city thrusting upwards
from its sandy base. 

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) (Hum) A tall iron cage is here, filled with bones and refuse.
A tall reman citizen wanders here.

918/918 HP  1010/1312 MP  1208/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Well Travelled Crossroads (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
A Road Leading Towards a Fortress
  This road has been laid with an almost fanatical precision.  The stone
blocks are lined evenly, and completely flat despite the gentle curve of the
hill.  To your south a rising wall set with crenelations and towers marks
the entrance to a small fortress that seemingly guards the wastes outside
Reme.  To your north a crossroads marks the desert sands.

918/918 HP  1010/1312 MP  1202/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Well Travelled Crossroads (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Outside the Imperial Gates
  Stately pleasure domes in chased silver, marbled spires that threaten
the very heavens, and a wall vast enough to hold at bay the gods themselves.
The city rises from the dead sands like a ghost from the grave, too
fabulous, too exotic to exist in this world, save as the magical apparition
it is.  The great bronze gates shine blindingly in the hot noon sun, casting
light across the pale pavement of the desert road you trod on.  This then,
is fabled Reme.

A reman noble peers down his nose at you.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The perforated corpse of KumoGami is lying here.

A reman official strides by.
A surly bronze armored guard stares at you rudely.

Octavian Road
  This road is made of a white marble, and is kept scrupulously clean.

lay at the feet of each one.  Clearly then this road has been named for

918/918 HP  1050/1312 MP  1216/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Octavian Road (NS)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Octavian Square
  This white square is composed of thousands of slabs of the purest marble,
laid cunningly end to end.  In the centre, a pedestal rises from the marbled
ground, with carvings of palm leaves and olive branches decorating the
sides.  From this pedestal a tall white statue rises, of a man in his
middle years with a regal bearing.  His cold stare tells that well the
sculptor his passions read, as he stares beyond the walls of Reme.  A small
plaque at the statue's feet reads simply 'Emperor Octavian.'  Roadways lead
from here in all directions.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) A white marble statue of the Emperor Octavian is here.
A sailor is visiting Reme.
A pigeon sits on the statue here.
A pigeon sits on the statue here.

Octavian Road

light.  The houses around you are growing steadily larger, and servants and
nobility buzz around in the street like bees in a hive.  Clearly you are
entering the wealthy area of the city.

construction of mortar and marble towering into the sky, with servants
running in and out of it carrying every imaginable load.  To your north and

Octavian Road
  This is the rich part of town here in Reme. Tall columns line the street and 
marble drinking troughs sit by the side of the road for the horses that pull 
the gilded chariots. Even the servants in this section wear clothes that 
would cost you a year's looting to be able to afford. Octavian road continues
to your north and to the south you can see the South gate of Reme.

[ Exits: north south ]
A merchant gawks at mighty Reme.

918/918 HP  1050/1312 MP  1208/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Octavian Road (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Octavian Square
  This white square is composed of thousands of slabs of the purest marble,
laid cunningly end to end.  In the centre, a pedestal rises from the marbled
ground, with carvings of palm leaves and olive branches decorating the
sides.  From this pedestal a tall white statue rises, of a man in his
middle years with a regal bearing.  His cold stare tells that well the
sculptor his passions read, as he stares beyond the walls of Reme.  A small
plaque at the statue's feet reads simply 'Emperor Octavian.'  Roadways lead
from here in all directions.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
Palace Road in front of Palace
  Like a madman's fairytale, crazed white marbled towers jut out of a grey
granite base.  Pleasure domes break the composure of gingerbread minarets,
and stately towers are mocked by balcony-studded masses of rare stones and
metals.  Only one place could be so mad and extravagant, only one place
ruled by generations of men with power, and not necessarily taste or good
judgement.  This demented keep, this mad hatter's castle, must be the great
imperial palace of Reme.  

[ Exits: north south west ]

w
Outside the Colosseum
  This grey toothless granite skull mocks you with its pillar-teeth,
glares at you through glassy eyes, and stinks well of the odor of death. 
Streams of toga clad torturers mix with the desperate yells of the doomed
gladiators within, sickening cries that tell of a war between steel and
flesh, with flesh the loser.  Merchants, nobles, warriors alike throng
through the grim visage of this ageless building, serving the gods of war
with their daily meal.  The entrance to this cursed place of deadly games
lays to your south.

918/918 HP  1118/1312 MP  1214/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Octavian Road (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     The perforated corpse of KumoGami is lying here.
A reman official strides by.
An elderly man walks past you.
A reman official strides by.
A surly bronze armored guard stares at you rudely.
A guard with reman insignia is here.

918/918 HP  1118/1312 MP  1213/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)
w
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Outside the Imperial Gates
  Stately pleasure domes in chased silver, marbled spires that threaten
the very heavens, and a wall vast enough to hold at bay the gods themselves.
The city rises from the dead sands like a ghost from the grave, too
fabulous, too exotic to exist in this world, save as the magical apparition
it is.  The great bronze gates shine blindingly in the hot noon sun, casting
light across the pale pavement of the desert road you trod on.  This then,
is fabled Reme. 

[ Exits: east west ]
A seagull pecks at a dead fish.

918/918 HP  1118/1312 MP  1213/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Outside the Imperial Gates (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Well Travelled Crossroads
  The road you have been following through the desert has arrived at a
great intersection, carved from the rock and the sands that seem to make up
most of this place.  A rusting iron cage hangs forlornly from a graying
wooden pole, squeaking in the harsh acid wind that blows across the sandy
wastes about you.  A few sullen vultures sit upon the pole, regarding you
strangely as you peer into the rusting iron of the cage and notice bleached
bones and rags that tell of past meals for these scavengers of the sky. 
Sand blasted expanses of road lead off in all directions, and along the one
to your east you can see the hazy spires of a mighty city thrusting upwards
from its sandy base. 

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     (Magic) (Hum) A tall iron cage is here, filled with bones and refuse.
A reman noble peers down his nose at you.
A tall reman citizen wanders here.

918/918 HP  1118/1312 MP  1210/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Well Travelled Crossroads (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
A Carefully Maintained Road
  The road is wider here as it approaches the intersection before you. 
You can see more clearly now that what you took for mountains in the
distance, seen hazily through the slow moving desert air, is in fact the
spires and towers of a great city rising before you.  To your west the
desert slowly drinks in the concrete river of the road you travel on.  To
your east it meets another road in a great intersection. 

[ Exits: east west ]
(White Aura) A retired soldier strolls along.
(White Aura) A tall elf bard recites poetry.

Lv 48  G 207937 | A Carefully Maintained Road (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
A Carefully Maintained Road
  The road here is as well maintained as it is abandoned to your west. 
The sands are held at bay with a cunning wall of stone, which gives the rock
of the road the appearance of a great causeway rising above the harsh and
merciless sands of the desert.  To your east you can barely make out through
the blinding sun some sort of intersection defying the soft curves that the
desert would seem to prefer. 

[ Exits: east west ]

w
A Long and Dusty Paved Road
  The cracked sun bleached paving stones of this ancient road have
given way to a more level and repaired stretch of footbeaten rock.  The
sands blowing across the roadway have not yet erased the faint signs of work
done to maintain and repair this desolate strand of path, this desert road
that twists and turns among the uncaring sands.  You press on, into the
glare of the mid afternoon sun.

918/918 HP  1118/1312 MP  1201/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | A Long and Dusty Paved Road (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


w
A Twisted and Cracked Ancient Road
  Lone and bare, the level sands stretch and twist to the edges of
vision.  Like slow ocean breakers they crash against the rocky shores of
this desert sea.  Ancient bleached bones sit like shipwrecks high upon the
rocks that thrust through the sandy waves, beckoning like sirens of old
those weary travellers to their thirsty doom.  A cracked and ancient road
rides through the wastes like a bridge over a troubled sea, twisting on
motionless waves of sand until it disappears into the haze of the east.  
A small weather beaten and blasted marker sits half buried by the all
encompassing sands.  Its barely legible words state '20 miles to Reme.'

[ Exits: east west ]
A twisted old man in a robe cowers here.

918/918 HP  1158/1312 MP  1187/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Entrance to the Bazaar (G)
  Smells overpower you, strange incenses that burn in oddly twisted pots,
exotic fruits from lands that no human has seen dried and hung from wooden
poles.  Voices speak in a thousand tongues, harsh northern speech conflicted
with soft eastern syllables in a cascade of noise that threatens your
composure and sanity.  The crowd that gawks in every booth and at every
wonder adds its own special noises and smells to this wonderful chaos, that
is the Bazaar at Reme.  

[ Exits: east west ]

918/918 HP  1158/1312 MP  1187/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Entrance to the Bazaar (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
The Square of the Bazaar
  Your head is definitely hurting now from the noise of the massive crowd
around you.  Women, men and children barter at every tent and table for
every imaginable item in the chaos that is the great Reman Bazaar.  Stalls
line every inch of square, with brightly coloured tents taking up the space
along the edges.  Storekeepers wander by dressed in exotic silks and linens,
while nobles and commoners alike wander by in awe.  Welcome to the square of
the Bazaar.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A hero is visiting Reme.
A merchant gawks at mighty Reme.
An elderly man walks past you.
A shopper browses along the stalls.
A shopper browses along the stalls.
A shopper browses along the stalls.

The Eastern Square of the Bazaar
  This part of the bazaar seems a little quieter, with just the odd
servant or family member buying food or clothing.  Clearly this part of the
market is more of a daily staples area.  You see food stalls filled with
vegetables and meats, while tailor stalls provide the latest in toga styles.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Fahreem's Tent
  As you bend over to pass into this dark little merchant's tent along the
great Reman bazaar, you immediately are hit by the strong smell of a
strange and wonderful incense.  As you straighten and your eyes grow more
accustomed to the dim lighting, you notice that many strange and curious
goods line the walls of the linen tent, and indeed the tent seems to be lit
by their glow!  Fahreem must be a dealer in magic!  

[ Exits: south ]
A blood-crazed rebel glares at you!
A barbarian saunters past you.
Fahreem the storekeeper sits here, knitting with invisible string.

>>   *[NOEXP]* A Small and Dirty Road
  This road is far more dingy and dirty than most in mighty Reme.  Up ahead
you see the dismal shape of various slum apartments rising from the squalor
of the street below.  Clearly this leads to the poorer section of town.  

[ Exits: north south ]

918/918 HP  1189/1312 MP  1217/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | A Small and Dirty Road (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Charity Lane
  This aptly named street is the center of housing for the servants of
Reme, as well as anyone else who is of 'lesser means'.  The apartments
rising to your left and right show signs of being hastily and shabbily
constructed.  Rats forage among piles of garbage in the streets and children
play with bits of trash pulled from the nobility's garbage.  The road
continues to your north and south.  

[ Exits: north south ]

Lv 48  G 207937 | Charity Lane (NS)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Charity Lane
  You stand outside a particularly bad example of the housing used by the
lower classes of Reme.  The front door, once merely inadequate now has
reached new heights in kindling.  Children play in the dirt of a empty lot
beside the building, and the wide open door almost seems to invite entry to
the east.  

[ Exits: north east south ]
A merchant gawks at mighty Reme.

918/918 HP  1189/1312 MP  1215/1220 mv  959tnl

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Charity Lane
  The street has become quiet all of a sudden.  You notice everyone is
walking across the street from you, seemingly to avoid a small dark store
which is simply labelled as 'Curios' on a plain timeworn sign hanging from a
rusty nail upon its door.  You notice whispers and looks of fear and
scratch your head as you stare at what seems to you to just be another
business on the verge of going under.  

[ Exits: north south (west) ]
A barbarian saunters past you.

918/918 HP  1189/1312 MP  1214/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Charity Lane (NSW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Abandoned Store
  This store was once merely another marginal business in the poor section
of Reme.  Now that it has closed though, a seedier element has taken over
its bare shelves and adapted it to their own sinister purposes.  It appears
a gang of muggers has taken over this space, and you just interrupted them
in the counting of their loot.  You notice VERY malevolent glares from them,
and prepare your weapons.  

[ Exits: east ]

Charity Lane
  The street has become quiet all of a sudden.  You notice everyone is
walking across the street from you, seemingly to avoid a small dark store
which is simply labelled as 'Curios' on a plain timeworn sign hanging from a
rusty nail upon its door.  You notice whispers and looks of fear and
scratch your head as you stare at what seems to you to just be another
business on the verge of going under.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Inside the Great Gates
  You have passed through the great polished bronze gates of Reme, into a
city that is as splendid as the legends say.  Great domes crown the
buildings of white marble, and silver mouldings show scenes from legends
along the tops of walls all over the city.  It indeed must be a blinding
sight during sunrise and sunset.  You can see roads running to your north
and south, and some sort of large marketplace seems to be to your east.

918/918 HP  1227/1312 MP  1214/1220 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 207937 | Inside the Great Gates (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* Entrance to the Bazaar (G)
  Smells overpower you, strange incenses that burn in oddly twisted pots,
exotic fruits from lands that no human has seen dried and hung from wooden
poles.  Voices speak in a thousand tongues, harsh northern speech conflicted
with soft eastern syllables in a cascade of noise that threatens your
composure and sanity.  The crowd that gawks in every booth and at every
wonder adds its own special noises and smells to this wonderful chaos, that
is the Bazaar at Reme.  

[ Exits: east west ]

e
The Square of the Bazaar
  Your head is definitely hurting now from the noise of the massive crowd
around you.  Women, men and children barter at every tent and table for
every imaginable item in the chaos that is the great Reman Bazaar.  Stalls
line every inch of square, with brightly coloured tents taking up the space
along the edges.  Storekeepers wander by dressed in exotic silks and linens,
while nobles and commoners alike wander by in awe.  Welcome to the square of
the Bazaar.

>>   *[NOEXP]* Abandoned Store
  This store was once merely another marginal business in the poor section
of Reme.  Now that it has closed though, a seedier element has taken over
its bare shelves and adapted it to their own sinister purposes.  It appears
a gang of muggers has taken over this space, and you just interrupted them
in the counting of their loot.  You notice VERY malevolent glares from them,
and prepare your weapons.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

417/1016 HP  584/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | The Grand City of Aylor (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Outside the Aylorian Academy (G) (1279)

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

[ Exits: north east south west ]
A commissary shopkeeper stands here, begging you to type 'list'.

Mudpits (G) (1276)

Boot Camp Headquarters (G) (1275)

Medical lounge (G)
  You stand in a plain looking room, with bunk beds lining both sides. Green 
wool blankets line the beds with perfect hospital corners. At the end of this 
seemingly endless room are two doors leading to what you believe is some 
kind of latrine and shower area. On one wall there is a milk cooler next to a 
sign that shows a Drill Sergeant pointing to the room. Words are written 
over his head, "Milk makes for a strong soldier!". There is a Second 
Lieutenant Pixie with a red cross on her hat here.

[ Exits: east (down) ]
     (Magic) A refrigerated milk cooler stands ready to serve all.
     (Magic) Multiple beds line the wall, waiting for people to rest or be treated on them.
     (Magic) An old electric heater.
(Player) (White Aura) Zteven is resting here.
(Player) (Translucent) Talbor the Enchanter is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
(Player) (Translucent) (White Aura) Lexicon the Navigator.
(Player) (Invis) (Hidden) (Translucent) (White Aura) Drimshade the Navigator.
[AFK] (Player) Roume wasn't built in a day. is sleeping on Medical beds.
[AFK] (Player) Davem returning mudder from years ago is sleeping on Medical beds.
(Player) (White Aura) (OPK) Inix the Hunter is sleeping in a trivia sleeping bag.
[AFK] (Player) (White Aura) Adarax is just the universe observing itself.
Lieutenant Pixie smiles up at you as she gets ready to amputate your leg.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Anssett of the Hampton Cheeses.
(Player) (Invis) (Translucent) (White Aura) Ospario the Newbie Shrieker.
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve 10 is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1278/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Boot Camp Headquarters (NE[S]WUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

[ Exits: east west down ]
Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Mudpits (EWD)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
The Aylorian Temple of Ivar (G)
  As you enter the white walls of the enormous Aylorian Church, the hollow
tones of an organ fill your ears with a slow, mystifying melody that
instantly calms your senses.  The smell of incense fills the church, giving
some warmth to the coldness of the black marble pews against the white
marble floors.  The windows, traditional stained glass, portray scenes of
mortals on their knees or dying by the blade of a single man.

South leads out of the church, while north takes you farther inside.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
(Translucent) (White Aura) A young, beautiful woman in simple white robes is whispering
incantations.

s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive
statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with amazing
architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath
your feet, the road is made of a white translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  To the north, the grand Aylorian Temple
stands high above the city.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Whitewind Avenue (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.  

[ Exits: north east south west up ]
     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Phoenix Square (NESWU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Whitewind Avenue (NSD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A stout dwarf, Wesnir, walks slowly, admiring the views of Aylor.
(White Aura) Mistress Marna, a lamian adventurer, polishes her armor.
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | North of the Grand Plaza (NSW*)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand amidst a very crowded portion of Whitewind Avenue.  To the
north is a large mass of people who are waiting in line to speak with
Aylor's great and noble quest master.  To the south even more crowds
gather to find the treasures of Grandmarket Boulevard.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A goblin carries a large money sack that reads 'Tax'.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Whitewind Avenue (NS)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (G)
  All throughout Andolor, the Grand City of Aylor is known for three things.
The first is of course, the mighty, the generous, the magnificent Ivar.  The
second is its impressive architecture.  The third, but not the least
important, is its shopping.  It is said that if there's anything to be
found, somebody is already selling it on the streets of Aylor.  As you look
around the insanely hectic Grandmarket Boulevard, you don't doubt it for one
moment.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
This noble is walking quite quickly, probably to avoid you!

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Welcome to Grandmarket Boulevard! (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


e
Aylorian Pets and Companions
  Cages, crates, boxes, and pens clutter the space.  The area is a ruckus
of animal calls, scratching, and yelps.  A large, black spectral caw stands
perched at the entrance, repeatedly crying out, "Pets may bite, watch your
fingers!" as people enter the area.  A bright yellow sign displays
further information regarding purchases.

[ Exits: east south west ]
(White Aura) Rwaul, the pet shop boy, mindlessly scratches at his collar.

Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Among the Philosophes (NESU)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  The south end of the plaza is traditionally home to salesmen of a more
refined sort.  The proximity of the Mage and Psionicist Guilds to the east
and the Stoa to the south guarantee that the sellers of rare books and
antiquities that gather here always have business.  Snatches of excited
conversation about this or that rare edition float about on the air, and
occasionally a voice will be raised to accuse some dishonest peddler of
pushing forgeries.  The Plaza Guards are more numerous here to guarantee the
security of the valuable goods for sale, as well as the safety of the
well-laden coin purses that dangle from the all-too-numerous belts.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Meridian Square (G)
  The focal point of the Grand Plaza of Aylor is Meridian Square, built not
to honor the sun, but rather the city itself.  In this place, the heart of
Aylor, the city's glory is always at its zenith.  The square honors the
spirit of defiance that made the founders of Aylor build a city so great
that its brightness would rival the sun's, its mighty towers so tall as to
scrape the clouds as they pass overhead.  The foremost feature of Meridian
Square is the memorial fountain, which pumps crystal clear water into the
sky year round.  A detachment of city guards known as the Honor Guard keep
watch over the fountain day and night.  The practical reason is to prevent
any defacement, but myth-lovers claim that they protect the massive marble
bier at the center of the fountain which is said to hold a container of the
Water of Life.  

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Magic) (Glow) (Hum) A fountain dedicated to the ancient Builders of Andolor flows with pure
water.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | Meridian Square (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand Plaza (G)
  Day or night, people can be found in the Grand Plaza of Aylor. 
Merchants, both honest and otherwise, hock their wares, mercenaries offer
their services, and, once the sun sets, a bit of "company" is only an alley
away.  Plaza Guards mill through the crowd, keeping a weather eye out for
pickpockets, cutpurses, and other ne'er-do-wells.  The vast expanse of the
square is packed with all manner of booths and tables, but in the end most
eyes are drawn to the far corners of the plaza and to the Guild towers that
dominate them-each unique, and each magnificent.  The plaza is a place to
see and be seen, to buy and to sell, each according to his own agenda.

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 208612 | The Grand Plaza (NESW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
North of the Grand Plaza (G)
  The sounds of the city echo between the buildings that line the sides of
this broad street.  Standing here, the oppressive size of the city is fully
evident.  The northern sky is dominated by the elegant spires of the Grand
Aylorian Temple, while the southern horizon is punctuated by glimpses of the
Guild towers.  A queer building rises up on the eastern side of the street,
though it seems to have developed a slight list to one side.  The door to
the building is boarded over and bears a sign reading: "Out of Order!!!! 
Decapitation Hazard!!  --Tinker's Guild Safety Committee."  In its place,
a complex series of pulleys operates a bucket that carries visitors up to a
second floor window.  Ominous explosions, thuds, and various other sounds of
mass destruction escape the building at random intervals.  In an alley
beside the slanting structure, a giant, clockwork machine of some sort
occasionally belches out clouds of smoke and fire.  A series of crudely
hammered metal chutes leading down from the upper stories of the structure
rains trash down into the incinerator.  A large sign in the alley reads:
"Posted: Hard Hat Zone."  

[ Exits: north south west other ]
A stout dwarf, Wesnir, walks slowly, admiring the views of Aylor.
(White Aura) Mistress Marna, a lamian adventurer, polishes her armor.
A gnomish incinerator bot is here, belching smoke and fire.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue just south of a large intersection with a
large statue and numerous people.  The city around you is incredible, with
amazing architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork. 
Beneath your feet, the road is a white, translucent stone, likely quartz,
that sparkles in the sunlight.  Traveling south will take you to the world
famous Meridian Square.  

[ Exits: north south down ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* Phoenix Square (G)
  At this, the main intersection of the Grand City of Aylor, the road is
shiny and black as if paved with ebony.  The road extends east and west,
reaching across the entire city.  In the center of this large square stands
a black and pink alabaster statue.  Beneath the statue, many solicitors try
to grab the attention of passersby.  To the north is the white marble temple. 
To the south, you gaze upon a large plaza with eight silver spires piercing
the sky.

     A large black and pink statue sprays streams of water into the air.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

Toastimus marches in from the west.
Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1278/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 212230 | Recreation Room (ESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Courtyard (G)
  It stinks.  The smell of sweat, tears and broken spirits fills the air.
The sounds of soldiers in training have gotten much louder as you step
into the courtyard. "I don't know but I've been told, it's hard to run
with the weight of gold." You see soldiers everywhere running laps on
a beaten path around the courtyard. Some less-fortunate soldiers are lined
up doing pushups in the mud. In the center of the courtyard lay a finely 
manicured lawn and the Boot clan flag. To the north you notice the bunk 
house, to the west the General's quarters. Suddenly, an officer grabs you 
by the shoulder and shouts "What are you gawking around for, future
soldier? It's time you enlisted!" And with that he points you east to 
the enlisting office.

[ Exits: north east ]

1016/1016 HP  1376/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 212230 | Courtyard (NE)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.

Task 4  : Bring a Cinekon fly potion to the mayor.

Kilrya says, "I need you to bring me one of the flying potions from the
 warehouse."
Kilrya says, "I want to make sure they are still making quality
 products."

You should not leave the city for this task.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

  Another locked ladder leads upwards to another fan-looking device. This one

is broken at the moments? You see spare electrical parts scattered throughout
the building. This factory building continues north and west.
