1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 212230 | The mayor's house (NESWUD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 

You can no longer sense anger.

tasks Cineko all

       Cineko : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Task 1  : Assist Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko.

Kilrya, the mayor of Cineko has some tasks for you to complete. She said if 
you complete them all, she will reward you.

Task 2  : Refresh the torch backup supply. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "We need to refresh our backup supply of torches."
Kilrya says, "I believe the grocery store in that huge city down there
 sells them."
Kilrya says, "I'm not sure the name of the city, but it appears to be the
 largest on the ground."

Kilrya says, "Bring me 20 of the flickering torches."

When you're done, return to the mayor and let her know you have the torches.

Task 3  : Find a parchment for Kilrya. (Completed)

Kilrya says, "Since we will be having lots more visitors, I need to make a
 map of the city."
Kilrya says, "But first, I need a parchment to write on."
 
Kilrya says, "Please bring me a piece of parchment."
Kilrya says, "A piece from anywhere in the world should do."

Go search the world for an item with parchment as a keyword.
Give the item to the mayor when you find it.

Task 4  : Bring a Cinekon fly potion to the mayor.

Kilrya says, "I need you to bring me one of the flying potions from the
 warehouse."
Kilrya says, "I want to make sure they are still making quality
 products."

You should not leave the city for this task.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Use 'tasklist' to see a short summary of all open tasks.

  Standing before the main entrance of the Aylorian Academy, you can't help but
notice the sheer scale of the structure. Many famous adventurers have passed 
through these gates before you and many will follow. The mark you will leave 
on this realm is to be determined by your actions, by fate, by skill and by 
chance. 

Type 'North' to begin your journey...

1016/1016 HP  1172/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Outside the Aylorian Academy (NSD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

                     Goal information for: Cloud City of Gnomalin 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Times are not the greatest as one of the gnomes' idols has gone from sight.
The God of Calm has taken a leave of absence, and without him all that is 
left is turmoil and corruption.

Will you be the one to take on the challenge and find the calm in the
storm of peril?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Easy                
Recommended Level:  20
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

1016/1016 HP  1269/1401 MP  1278/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Standing before an airship (NE*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 

Viridi questions 'where is my tier pin that gives stats that i wear?'

board airship

------------------------------------------------------------
You walk up the ramp to the airship, and it takes off.  You suddenly land on a large cloud, holding
a city.
------------------------------------------------------------
Landing Bay for Visitors
  The airship docks, and gnomes scurry around preparing for disembarkment. 
As it opens its doors, the passengers spill out onto the ramp.  Having
survived the trip from the surface below, you look around this large space
created to welcome visitors to Gnomalin.  The colors are pleasant and soft
music emanates from the many speakers hidden in the walls around the room. 
Signs point the way west to the operations building.

[ Exits: west other ]
An airship passenger rushes about.
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
An airship passenger rushes about.
The flight attendant ushers passengers in and out of the airship with a smile.

1016/1016 HP  1269/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Landing Bay for Visitors (W*)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Entrance to the Operations building
  A wide open arch leads into the entrance area of the airship operations
building.  Arriving and departing visitors bump into one another as they
enter or leave the landing bay to the east.  The ramp heading down leads to
the docking bays where cargo is loaded and unloaded.  A door to the west
leads to the Operations Manager's office.  

[ Exits: north east (west) down ]

1016/1016 HP  1269/1401 MP  1276/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Entrance to the Operations building (NE[W]D)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Gnomalin Square, South End
  This length of the road is sunny and warm.  Gnomes and other races stroll
about, enjoying the pleasant surroundings.  The stately trees continue here,
and their lushness harbors all sorts of tiny creatures.  Blossoms yield a
lovely fragrance and show delightful color.  A massive building lies to the
east and the entrance to the Operations building lies to the south.

Gnomalin Square, South East End
  The road takes a turn here, leading west or north.  Before you stands a
huge edifice adorned with stone carvings, reliefs, statues and gargoyles. 
Sentinels stand at either side of the massive doors, guarding the religious
devotees and the precious things stored within.  A slight breeze rustles in
the leaves of the sturdy trees.  A fragile butterfly appears and is gone in
a blink.

1016/1016 HP  1348/1401 MP  1276/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, South East End (NEW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Entrance to the Dagas Cathedral
  As you stand at the entrance to the cathedral, you see amazing
architecture and masonry craftsmanship that emit a sense of primordial power. 
However the gnomes appear to have mixed in technology with magic to create
this cathedral.  The bell hovers in midair, supported by a contraption.  The
exterior of the chapel is made of stone.  Gears and gadgets are carved into
the walls of the cathedral as well as images of their god.  The feeling of
cold that you would normally expect from stone does not exist, but a strange
feeling of warmth radiates from the floors and walls.  Spires rise towards
the heavens and disappear in the clouds.  You feel a cool breeze blow across
your face and angelic singing echoes in your ears as you open the doors.  

[ Exits: (east) west ]
A child is here playing with some toys.
A uniformed gnome is guarding the church from evil doers.
A uniformed gnome is guarding the church from evil doers.
A uniformed gnome is guarding the church from evil doers.

  The road takes a turn here, leading north and east.  Off into the
distance to the east stands a magnificent structure.  It is covered with
carvings and statues, including gargoyles.  The line of stately trees shifts
in the gentle wind with their leaves rustling softly.  Faint noises of
children playing reach your ears, and occasionally a small urchin runs past.

[ Exits: north east ]
A beautiful blue winged creature flitters about.
A policeman walks along here, twirling his nightstick.

1016/1016 HP  1348/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, South West End (NE)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Gnomalin Square, West End
  You continue to walk around the main street.  You notice another entrance
to the Oak Plaza Park to the east, where luscious foliage is growing.  It
looks like the trees are planted in transported dirt because large masses of
earth are covered with vibrant green grass.  To the west, you see a set of
large double golden doors with fancy ornate writing on it.  The inscription
on the doors states "Gnomalin National Bank".  

[ Exits: north east south (west) ]
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
An airship passenger rushes about.
A policeman walks along here, twirling his nightstick.

Viridi answers 'HuZzZaaahhhh'

Gnomalin Square, North East End
  The paved road takes a turn here, leading west and south.  To the east
lies the entrance to the Government buildings, a complex set of structures
housing all those tedious offices required by civilization.  You see people
coming and going, some are muttering while others are smiling with relief. 
The wind blows gently through the trees lining the road, their leaves
rustling with a soft sound.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
An airship passenger rushes about.

1016/1016 HP  1348/1401 MP  1269/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, North East End (ESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Entrance to the Gnomish Government Building
  You are standing in a large, circular room with a soaring ceiling.  Light
filters down through a large skylight at the center, creating a warm glow
throughout.  The evenly spaced white marble columns around the wall gleam,
and tiny glitters dance over the surfaces as the shifting cloud causes the
light to waver.  Little gnomes, as well as members of various other races,
mill about the room talking in hushed voices.  Occasionally someone lets out
a shout of frustration, causing looks of sympathy or annoyance to be cast in
his or her (or its) direction.  A very long queue begins just beyond the
door, and flows around the wall until it passes under an archway leading to
the hall to the north.  

[ Exits: north west ]
     A table with stacks of forms on it sits near the entrance.

1016/1016 HP  1348/1401 MP  1268/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Entrance to the Gnomish Government Building (NW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Hallway to Reception
  The gnomes patiently shuffle along, moving slowly towards the reception
area to the north.  This hallway looks like most of the government
facilities you've ever seen, and is less elegant than the entrance.  Dingy
walls are adorned with only official announcements and warnings.  The
ceiling is lower here, but the cloud floor muffles most of the sound.  The
queue has become quieter here as most individuals appear to have decided on
which question to ask the receptionist.  

[ Exits: north south ]
The Director of Paperwork makes sure you have your forms filled out properly.

1016/1016 HP  1348/1401 MP  1268/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Hallway to Reception (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Reception Area (G)
  At the end of the Hallway you see the receptionist sitting behind a large 
desk. A little nameplate on this desk says "Beryl". You now see the reason 
for the very long queue - only one person is available to address the inquiry
of each person in the queue. The receptionist listens to each question or 
request, ponders carefully, and then frequently sends the individual off to 
the absolutely wrong office in the maze of buildings to the north.

[ Exits: (north) south ]
A short, dumpy little gnome, filled with a sense of self-importance, looks down at you with disdain.

An airship passenger rushes about.
A beautiful blue winged creature flitters about.

1016/1016 HP  1385/1401 MP  1256/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, North West End (ES)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Gnomalin Square, North End
  This, the northern edge of the city Loop, leads to the housing area
further north.  The paved road continues east and west with stately trees
lining the way.  You can hear the laughter of children coming from the
houses and occasional shrieks of play.  Gnomish gentlemen, ladies and
families stroll by as they go to and from their homes.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
An airship passenger rushes about.

1016/1016 HP  1385/1401 MP  1255/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, North End (NEW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


Stratus Street
  This is the residential section of Gnomalin.  The street is made of
several different precious stones fitted together in a pattern that wrenches
at the eye.  The Gnomes have also managed to make houses which look very
much like actual clouds.  The cloud houses seem to float and drift along the
street, but they never move.  

[ Exits: north (east) south (west) ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1278/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]S[W])
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Stratus Street
  Traveling down Stratus Street becomes no easier.  The eye wrenching
pattern of precious stones which make up the street glitter and flash as
they are reflected off the cloud houses.  To either side of the street are
large clouds with windows and doors.  The billowing structures help to keep
this part of the city quiet, and the soil pulled from the ground below is
home to several plants all growing just as if this city weren't floating in
the clouds.  

[ Exits: north east south (west) ]
A charming young bachelor strolls down the street.
A charming young bachelor strolls down the street.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (NES[W])
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Large Cloud House
  This structure is enormous.  It appears as if several Gnomes live in this
home.  The cloud billows as you walk and there is very little noise inside
the swirling walls of the house.  You can see a hallway with several doors
which must lead into the private rooms of the Gnomish inhabitants, and
opposite the hall is a large kitchen.  A fire burns on a hearth made of
stone, which against all physical laws, rests comfortably atop a fluffy
piece of the floor.  A set of stairs lead down into the cloud, though a
complex alarm system guarantees that no visitors such as yourself will climb
down to find out what is there.  There are faint sounds of hammering and
ringing bells coming from below, however, and you guess that it must be a
Gnome's workshop.  

[ Exits: west ]
A long-suffering wife is here with her crying baby.
A very quiet husband sits here reading his newspaper.

n
>>   *[NOEXP]* Stratus Street
  Stratus Street glitters and flashes in sharply contrasting colors, and is
made no easier by the billowing clouds which seem to reflect and refract the
light.  The cool air is fresh and clean, but not damp in the slightest.  The
houses on either side of this street are made up of fluffy clouds.  A
communal garden lies to the west.  It looks well taken care of from here,
though parts of it seem to be growing right out of a cloud.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1274/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]SW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Stratus Street
  The street comes to an end here.  A large billowing mansion rises to the
north, its spires and towers looking like fanciful creatures as they swirl. 
It is difficult to understand how all these cloudy places can exist, but
then, the jarring effect of the multicolored stones might be playing more
tricks with your mind than you first thought.  A small house sits to the
west, and an official building sits to the east.  The building is out of
place since this seems to be a housing district, but perhaps the gnomes like
to have plenty of places to gather for business.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1272/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]SW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* A small garden
  This is one of the strangest gardens that could ever exist.  Flowers of
all kinds bloom in soil which should not be floating so easily atop whispy
clouds.  The saplings and small bushes seem to spring up out of the
billowing clouds underfoot.  There is a slight breeze, but you cannot tell
where it might be coming from.  The bushes and flowers seem to sway gently
as the clouds which nurture them undulate and swirl.  The glittering street
lies back to the east.  

[ Exits: east ]
A little boy is skipping around here.

1016/1016 HP  1331/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]S[W])
>>   *[NOEXP]* The governor's mansion
  Much like the other houses you have seen, this one is made of clouds. 
However this house is much larger than the rest.  This building must be a
cloud mansion.  Spawling couches wrap around the walls of the room. 
Cushions cover the furniture and overflow onto the floors.  Paintings of the
previous governors line the walls.  A security station is setup near the
entrance.  Stacks of paper litter the desk.  Stairways on either side of you
curve upwards towards the rooms above.  

[ Exits: south up ]
The Governor of the cloud city smiles benevolently.

1016/1016 HP  1331/1401 MP  1269/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The governor's mansion (SU)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
u
The governor's room
  As you ascend the stairs, you come to a pair of double doors.  Throwing
open the doors, you enter the private chambers of the governor.  A large bed
occupies the majority of the room, and appears to be spinning.  Mirrors hang
on the ceiling above the bed.  The nightstand next to the bed holds a
strange device.  As you examine the device, you touch one of the buttons and
soothing melodies begin to play.  A fireplace dominates the western wall. 
The fireplace is lit and provides a romantic setting.  A balcony overlooking
the city is to the south.  

[ Exits: (south) down ]
The gracious lady wife of the Governor is here.

Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]SW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Small Cloud House
  Much like the other houses you have seen, this one is made up of a cloud,
or maybe it is many clouds all pressed together.  You have no idea what
holds this place together, or how it keeps from shrinking or growing, but at
least it doesn't rain or snow itself out of existance.  The furniture here
is sprawling, seeming to have many curves and is almost as billowy as the
structure itself.  Silver streaks run across the ceiling and walls, and here
and there an occasional one runs across the fluffy floor as well.

1016/1016 HP  1368/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Meeting Hall
  Somehow the walls of this cloud have been pressed back.  They are a
smooth white, and lines and swirls of dark grey and black seem more like
paint than cloud material.  A large table sits on the springy floor.  There
is a lecturn at one end of the room.  A long list of rules is held to the
front of the lecturn with what appears to be wires and hoses which disappear
through one of the cloud-walls.  The writing is crammed together and
extremely small, and reading it would probably give most people a headache
anyways.  You guess this must be where the community comes to discuss
ordinances for the neighborhood.  

[ Exits: west ]
A crying baby fusses in his mother's arms.

1016/1016 HP  1368/1401 MP  1272/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (N[E]SW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Floating Cloud Sanctuary
  What looked like cloud from the street feels even more like a cloud from
inside.  The soft, billowy floor absorbs all your footfalls, and the walls
shimmer with moisture.  Somehow the air is still not humid, yet you can
clearly see the floor and ceiling of this place swirl much like clouds do. 
An empty podium sits in the middle of the room, and a soft light radiates
from it.  The quietness of the place has a near holy quality.

tasks gnomalin all

                     Goal information for: Cloud City of Gnomalin 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Times are not the greatest as one of the gnomes' idols has gone from sight.
The God of Calm has taken a leave of absence, and without him all that is 
left is turmoil and corruption.

Will you be the one to take on the challenge and find the calm in the
storm of peril?
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Difficulty       : Easy                
Recommended Level:  20
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
You have not yet unlocked any of the tasks in this quest.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

>>   *[NOEXP]* Vacant Cloud House

footfalls.  A thin layer of dust seems to coat everything, but it doesn't
stir at your movements.  There is a definite smell of storms in this house. 
The gnomes have somehow managed to make rooms inside this cloud.

Stratus Street
  This is the residential section of Gnomalin.  The street is made of
several different precious stones fitted together in a pattern that wrenches
at the eye.  The Gnomes have also managed to make houses which look very
much like actual clouds.  The cloud houses seem to float and drift along the
street, but they never move.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Stratus Street (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Gnomalin Square, North End
  This, the northern edge of the city Loop, leads to the housing area
further north.  The paved road continues east and west with stately trees
lining the way.  You can hear the laughter of children coming from the
houses and occasional shrieks of play.  Gnomish gentlemen, ladies and
families stroll by as they go to and from their homes.  

[ Exits: north east west ]
An airship passenger rushes about.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1272/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, North End (NEW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Gnomalin Square, North East End
  The paved road takes a turn here, leading west and south.  To the east
lies the entrance to the Government buildings, a complex set of structures
housing all those tedious offices required by civilization.  You see people
coming and going, some are muttering while others are smiling with relief. 
The wind blows gently through the trees lining the road, their leaves
rustling with a soft sound.  

[ Exits: east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1271/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, North East End (ESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Entrance to the Gnomish Government Building
  You are standing in a large, circular room with a soaring ceiling.  Light
filters down through a large skylight at the center, creating a warm glow
throughout.  The evenly spaced white marble columns around the wall gleam,
and tiny glitters dance over the surfaces as the shifting cloud causes the
light to waver.  Little gnomes, as well as members of various other races,
mill about the room talking in hushed voices.  Occasionally someone lets out
a shout of frustration, causing looks of sympathy or annoyance to be cast in
his or her (or its) direction.  A very long queue begins just beyond the
door, and flows around the wall until it passes under an archway leading to
the hall to the north.  

[ Exits: north west ]
     A table with stacks of forms on it sits near the entrance.
An airship passenger rushes about.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Entrance to the Gnomish Government Building (NW)
n
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Hallway to Reception
  The gnomes patiently shuffle along, moving slowly towards the reception
area to the north.  This hallway looks like most of the government
facilities you've ever seen, and is less elegant than the entrance.  Dingy
walls are adorned with only official announcements and warnings.  The
ceiling is lower here, but the cloud floor muffles most of the sound.  The
queue has become quieter here as most individuals appear to have decided on
which question to ask the receptionist.  

[ Exits: north south ]
The Director of Paperwork makes sure you have your forms filled out properly.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Hallway to Reception (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
Reception Area (G)
  At the end of the Hallway you see the receptionist sitting behind a large 
desk. A little nameplate on this desk says "Beryl". You now see the reason 
for the very long queue - only one person is available to address the inquiry
of each person in the queue. The receptionist listens to each question or 
request, ponders carefully, and then frequently sends the individual off to 
the absolutely wrong office in the maze of buildings to the north.

[ Exits: (north) south ]
A short, dumpy little gnome, filled with a sense of self-importance, looks down at you with disdain.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Reception Area ([N]S)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
op n
n
You open the door.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Reception Area (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Middle of a Long Hall
  You are standing at the midpoint of a long hall which extends to the east
and west connecting the several buildings that house the various government
offices.  In keeping with typical government building decor, the walls are
drab and lacking decoration.  Benches are placed near each archway, offering
a place to rest and relieve one's aching feet, a welcome respite after
standing in that long line.  A sign on the wall facing you shows the
directions to the offices.  

[ Exits: east south west ]
A government gofer is here, pausing on his errand.
A poor lost applicant wanders about here.

  You continue to walk around the main street.  You notice another entrance
to the Oak Plaza Park to the east, where luscious foliage is growing.  It
looks like the trees are planted in transported dirt because large masses of
earth are covered with vibrant green grass.  To the west, you see a set of
large double golden doors with fancy ornate writing on it.  The inscription
on the doors states "Gnomalin National Bank".

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1274/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin Square, West End (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Gnomalin National Bank
  You are in the lobby of Gnomalin National Bank, the only financial
institution in the city.  The citizens of Gnomalin are extremely proud of
the bank, because wealth is one of the most important values in a gnome's
life.  This aspect is noticeable from the magnificent architecture and
extravagant building materials of the structure.  The tall double doors at
the entrance are made of gold with delicate carvings of ancient gnomes.  The
circular lobby is topped by a high arc ceiling and surrounded by silver
plated stone walls decorated with floor-to-ceiling red velvet drapes and
golden candle racks.  Thousands of candle flames burn quietly, serving as
the only light source in the room.  In the center stands a big golden
statue.  A short arch way opposite from the doors leads inside the bank. 

[ Exits: east west ]
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
A bank security guard is posted here.
The manager waits to take ... err deposit your money.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Gnomalin National Bank (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
w
Bank Counter
  You are in the main section of the bank.  The ceiling here is lower than
in the lobby, but still high enough to make it look like a palace.  The
lengthy mahogany counter extends from the far left to the far right.  There
are about fifty gnomes sitting behind the counter.  Most of them are old and
frail, but there are a few who will intimidate potential troublemakers. 

[ Exits: north east south ]
The clerk who handles new accounts sits at her desk.
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
A bank teller looks up at you and smiles.
The loan officer invites you to his office.
A bank teller gives you a long look.
A bank teller looks up at you and smiles.
A bank teller gives you a long look.
A bank teller looks up at you and smiles.
A bank teller gives you a long look.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Bank Counter (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
n
North Wing
  Compared to the other sections of the bank, this area of the building appears
deserted. One single desk is placed in the middle of the room. An old gnome 
with bottle-bottom glasses sits behind the desk, supervising his workers 
behind the counter. In his hands, he holds a pair of binoculars made out of 
bronze. Occasionally, he scans around the bank through these binoculars, 
which enhance his impaired vision by a large factor. To the west, a half-open
mahogany wooden door leads into a lounge.

[ Exits: south (west) ]
A hard-working janitor is here.
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
An old gnome with binoculars sits at his desk.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The VIP Lounge
  This section of the building is dedicated to the extremely wealthy

who does not have VIP status.  There are private booths installed along the
eastern and southern walls.  Snacks and beverages sit on top of a round
table in the center of the room.  Gorgeous mahogany doors are tightly shut
on the western wall.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1273/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The VIP Lounge (NW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Manager's Office
  You are inside a spacious luxury office.  The mahogany doors into the
office blend perfectly into the walls, which are also made of mahogany wood.
Delicate carvings of ivy spread across the upper quarter of the walls.  The
ceiling is painted with a large drawing of hilly woods, to remind the office
occupant of the happy days when Gnomalin citizens lived on the ground.  On
the northern side, a large wooden desk stands in the center.  A skinny young
gnome sits behind the desk, smoking a cigar.  Piles of paper cover his desk.
A strange-looking panel on the wall behind him attracts your attention.  

[ Exits: (north) east ]
(White Aura) Lefordom, the bank manager, sits behind a desk, smoking a cigar.

>>   *[NOEXP]* A Dark Tunnel
  You have entered a dark tunnel.  The tunnel is completely made out of

protection spells have been cast to prevent magical beings from breaking
in.  You can barely see ahead of you.  What lies at the end is unknown. 
Several steps in front of you lead downwards.

  This tunnel seems to go on forever and splits often.  Your vision is

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Bank Counter (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* North Wing
  Compared to the other sections of the bank, this area of the building appears
deserted. One single desk is placed in the middle of the room. An old gnome 
with bottle-bottom glasses sits behind the desk, supervising his workers 
behind the counter. In his hands, he holds a pair of binoculars made out of 
bronze. Occasionally, he scans around the bank through these binoculars, 
which enhance his impaired vision by a large factor. To the west, a half-open
mahogany wooden door leads into a lounge.

[ Exits: south (west) ]
The clerk who handles new accounts sits at her desk.
A hard-working janitor is here.
A bank customer waits patiently in the queue.
An old gnome with binoculars sits at his desk.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Bank Counter
  You are in the main section of the bank.  The ceiling here is lower than
in the lobby, but still high enough to make it look like a palace.  The
lengthy mahogany counter extends from the far left to the far right.  There
are about fifty gnomes sitting behind the counter.  Most of them are old and
frail, but there are a few who will intimidate potential troublemakers.

>>   *[NOEXP]* The VIP Lounge
  This section of the building is dedicated to the extremely wealthy
customers.  A security guard sits lazily at the entrance, blocking anyone
who does not have VIP status.  There are private booths installed along the
eastern and southern walls.  Snacks and beverages sit on top of a round
table in the center of the room.  Gorgeous mahogany doors are tightly shut
on the western wall.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The VIP Lounge (NW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Manager's Office
  You are inside a spacious luxury office.  The mahogany doors into the
office blend perfectly into the walls, which are also made of mahogany wood.
Delicate carvings of ivy spread across the upper quarter of the walls.  The
ceiling is painted with a large drawing of hilly woods, to remind the office
occupant of the happy days when Gnomalin citizens lived on the ground.  On
the northern side, a large wooden desk stands in the center.  A skinny young
gnome sits behind the desk, smoking a cigar.  Piles of paper cover his desk.
A strange-looking panel on the wall behind him attracts your attention.  

[ Exits: north east ]
(White Aura) Lefordom, the bank manager, sits behind a desk, smoking a cigar.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.

stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)

adventurers.

The Grand Plaza (G) (640)

Among the Philosophes (G)
  To the south of the Grand Plaza is a magnificent Stoa built entirely of
white marble.  A series of steps lead into the body proper of the building,
which is encircled by peristyle ionic columns and decorated in the ionic
style.  The greatest minds of all Andolor congregate here to debate matters
of philosophy, or just to think great thoughts in the same corridors where
thinkers past have done so.  The most sought-out magister of them all is
Questor, who dispenses worldly knowledge and experience by giving
assignments to those who ask.  Those who yearn for knowledge and
understanding flock to the Stoa, and they are never disappointed.  Any time
of day or night, conversations can be heard on subjects as lofty as the
meaning of life and the nature of death and the hereafter.  

[ Exits: north east south up ]
The world famous Master Questor of Aylor hands out quests to adventurers.

Whitewind Avenue (G)
  You stand on Whitewind Avenue before a large intersection with a massive

architecture, breathtaking horizons, and finely crafted roadwork.  Beneath

The Dark (G)
  You emerge from a dark haze and find yourself at the shrine. Before you 
stands the statue of Darkness, a shadowy figure that is difficult to focus 
on. Her form is oddly indiscernible, at once haughty and timid, cruel and 
loving. The marble feels cool to the touch, but there is a warm presence 
within that seems to give you the strength to face your enemies once again.
Get out there and get some revenge!

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  925/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The Dark (NW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Vulgar Unicorn (G)
  Taking a seat at the bar, you examine the rows of drinks behind
the counter. The bartender mixes a -Vial oF Dark DeSires-, handing
the drink to a woman in red leather. A man in splendid black orders
another Fading Darkness for himself. The fallen lady in his lap
wraps her arms around him tighter, but gives you a knowing smile.

  Beyond the counter, there seems to be a door hidden in the dark
shadows. A small wiry man sits on a stool nearby, apparently
guarding the portal. The black guard doesn't look to be very 
dangerous, however, even the Shadows on the wall can be deceiving.

  'You will never get in there,' whispers the Darkness. You realize,
too late, that Darkness follows you always.

[ Exits: (north) east south west ]
The bartender glares at you with shadowed eyes, impatient with the slow and stupid.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  924/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The Vulgar Unicorn ([N]ESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Vulgar Unicorn (G)
  Pausing at the entrance to the tavern for a moment, you wait until
your eyes adjust to the darkness. As you step inside the establishment,
two bouncers move to position at the door, blocking the way out. Perhaps
it wasn't such a good idea to seek this Guild's services after all.

  The flickering light from the torches lining the walls barely
illuminates the place. Tavern patrons seated at the wooden tables
regard you grimly before returning to their business. Weapons of death
and all manner of ghastly trophies decorate the walls. Is that fresh
blood dripping from that Bloody collection of Ears?

  A serving wench beckons you into the crowd, but you lose her in the
throng. You feel eyes on you, but attempts to discern the watchers are
unsuccessful. One man appears to be facing your way; then you realize
that a little boy is leading his blind master.

  Suddenly, the shadows shift! The space before you grows dark, and
you see too late the famed Barden's Black Razor drawing blood from your
throat under your chin. Your heart races as Darkness surrounds you.

  'What boon do you ask of The Guild?' whispers the Darkness.

[ Exits: north east south west up down ]
     (Glow) (Hum) Several body parts mix together to form a huge slimy ball.
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
You find it hard to focus on the dark figure before you.
A sexy red-headed wench offers you some Shadow Spirits.

The Vulgar Unicorn [**> PK <**] (G) [**> CMAZE <**]
  A black grand piano stands before the fireplace, a pianist playing
as a girl dances and sings for the spectators. The deft fingers of the
musician dance expertly over the keys as the Shadow Dancer performs
for the entertainment of the tavern.

  A drunkard gimps in, bawling along with the refrain, drowning out
the soft voice until a neighbor punches him in the face for disturbing
the dark beauty of the Siren's Song. No one else is drunk enough to try
the same.

  Lying on the bearskin rug by the fire is a large black wolf, with one
eye open to watch the patrons. The creature belongs to someone here or to
the Guild. You have every reason to be cautious of its Prowess if the
latter is true. The wolf seems to grin, the sharp white teeth clearly
visible.

[ Exits: north east south ]

WARNING: You have entered a combat maze room. The deaths do not count but
         other players can kill you here. See 'help cmaze' for more info.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  923/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The Vulgar Unicorn [**> PK <**] (NES)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Dark [**> PK <**] (G) [**> CMAZE <**]
  The floor is cleared for a space large enough for a real fight. The
toppled tables have been pushed aside to the walls, the food and drink
once atop them now in a mess on the floor. You can see dried blood
caked in the grooves between the wood planks in the floor, where
countless other fights have been carried out to Fatal wounds.

  Men cheer, shouting 'Kill! Kill!' as the combatants circle each
other, ready to Maim, Maul, and Murder. One draws a weapon, thinking
he would have the advantage, but others already seem to be gunning for
the blade bearer, evening out the fight in numbers. BloodThirst gleams
in the eyes of those watching, and the fighters themselves know that
at least one among them will be kissed by the Cold Death Angel tonight.
A man in black stares from across the room, the Pitch <O>Black<O> Gaze
piercing the Darkness. If Looks Could Kill... You shiver at the thought.

  You can feel the Gaze of the dark goddess as whispers of death float
through the air. Something falls to the ground - velvet petals and 
sharp thorns - a black rose.

  Then... Darkness claims you.


[ Exits: north east south ]

Pool of Screaming Shadows [**> PK <**] (G) [**> CMAZE <**]
  Darkness pervades in a land where no light enters. Those that have
departed from the mortal realm cry out their pain, their anomalous
screams unheard in silent agony. The once-breathing forever wander as
spirits, walking as Dark Shadows among the living souls. The ghastly
(Deathly Silence) is almost unbearable, but as you have discovered
late, you now belong to their number.
 
The Screaming Shadows surround you.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  923/1279 mv  959tnl

>>   *[NOEXP]* 


e
The Unicorn Corral (G)
  Familiar sounds and sights that designate a brothel fill the
anteroom. Incense burners line the walls in small alcoves, and opium
smoke hovers heavily in the air. Several young men take their pleasure
right here in the open, while others watch as the dancers perform. A
girl dressed in white twirls with grace. Beauty and Talent are a
Deadly Combination, and the femme fatales here have them both.

  Screams of Pleasure sound from down the hall, accompanied by the
swish of a whip through the air and the resounding smack. You shiver
with each Echoing Scream; the bound one should have been gagged with
screams like that.

  The candles flicker as the Mistress of the house approaches you, 
making the shadowy silhouettes dance upon the walls. She demands 
payment of you as the one called the Black Widow selects her prey 
for tonight.

[ Exits: north west ]
     A small campfire burns merrily away here.
A lady of the night wants you to spend the night in the comfort of the shadows.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
The Dark [**> PK <**] (G) [**> CMAZE <**]
  Two strong men are arm-wrestling at a table as spectators call out
their wagers. Arms locked, the two are evenly matched, the outcome
still hazy. An eternity later, the clasped hands move in a direction
and continue dropping to the table, until the loser's hand meets wood.

  As the bystanders cheer and boo and sums of gold are exchanged, a
particularily gorgeous temptress sidles into the lap of the winner,
planting wet Kisses in between his breathless Gasps. With her
encouragement, the Champion beckons the next contender close, the
bastard so sure of the success of his near future.

  The sexy smile of the seductress is enough to make you try your hand.
You can win her capricious Heart or strengthen your opponent's
privilege.

[ Exits: north east west ]
     A dull silver key can be seen in the shadows here.

The Desolate Pridelands (909)

A Dusty Seabed
  A gust of sand shoots across the desert, buffeted by the dry wind
whistling across the sandy plains.  No life is evident here, no animal walks
the arid land, and no water nourishes the thirsty ground.  The temperature
is scorching hot, and walking without proper protection could result in
serious heatstroke.  Tiny white skeletons, half-buried by the sand, litter
the ground.  Where did these skeletons come from?  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

A Dusty Seabed
  A curious star-shaped object lies on the sand here, while a once-luminescent 
shell has been carelessly discarded a distance from it. Dead pieces of 
brittle branches have been strewn across the area. The scene begins to look 
like a remnant of a disaster, rather than a desert. What has happened to 
devastate this land? Was this land, perhaps, not always a desert?

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A decayed whip has been discarded here.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  953/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Dusty Seabed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
A Dusty Seabed
  Each footfall feels like stepping into mire, each breath feels ragged and
strained.  The horizon seems to disappear into the leagues of sand and
vanish.  North, east, west, south - all look the same, with endless sand in
every direction discouraging travelers from persisting in finding out the
mystery of this desert.  The thick layer of sand on everything has obscured
the truth of what has happened to this lonely place.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

  A curious star-shaped object lies on the sand here, while a once-luminescent 
shell has been carelessly discarded a distance from it. Dead pieces of 
brittle branches have been strewn across the area. The scene begins to look 
like a remnant of a disaster, rather than a desert. What has happened to 
devastate this land? Was this land, perhaps, not always a desert?

[ Exits: north east south west ]
     A decayed whip has been discarded here.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
A dry wind sweeps the land, and bones, just as dry, rattle in the dust.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  947/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Dusty Seabed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* A Dusty Seabed
  A gust of sand shoots across the desert, buffeted by the dry wind
whistling across the sandy plains.  No life is evident here, no animal walks
the arid land, and no water nourishes the thirsty ground.  The temperature
is scorching hot, and walking without proper protection could result in
serious heatstroke.  Tiny white skeletons, half-buried by the sand, litter
the ground.  Where did these skeletons come from?  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  944/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Dusty Seabed (NESW)

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  941/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Dusty Seabed (NESW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* A Dusty Seabed
  Each footfall feels like stepping into mire, each breath feels ragged and
strained.  The horizon seems to disappear into the leagues of sand and
vanish.  North, east, west, south - all look the same, with endless sand in
every direction discouraging travelers from persisting in finding out the
mystery of this desert.  The thick layer of sand on everything has obscured
the truth of what has happened to this lonely place.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  938/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Dusty Seabed (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Nearing the Fissure
  Finally, the endless sea of sand seems to quiet down and settle on the
ground, but rebellious wisps still lick at low-lying objects, trying to suck
them down.  The scenery seems to change, if only because the surroundings
are no longer composed of the irritating sand particles that wreak havoc on
the passers-by.  Perhaps ahead there may be something different, something
worth having come here for.  

[ Exits: east west ]
A misty cloud of sand.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  935/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Nearing the Fissure (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
The Fissure
  Here, the landscape dramatically changes.  A large fissure gapes open in
the middle of the ground, seemingly out of nowhere.  The strangeness of such
an occurrence begs the question: why is it here, in the middle of this
accursed place?  Is it, perhaps the key to this desolate place?  It almost
beckons one to crawl in, as if it promises an experience not to be missed. 
But is it merely a lie, a facade, another deception? 

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
A dry wind sweeps the land, and bones, just as dry, rattle in the dust.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  980/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | The Fissure (NESWD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 

INFO: All please welcome Skeet, Aardwolf's newest Dark elf Hunter!

e
A Trail of Wooden Debris
  The ground here is littered with bits of wood, strangely enough.  Where
did this wood come from?  With jagged edges and uneven sizes, they look like
remnants of an unidentifiable object.  However, they can no longer tell
their tale - what tree they once were, what purpose were they cut down for. 
The wreckage that they have become is story enough, a vivid message that it
would be better to retreat now than to venture forth.  

[ Exits: east west ]
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  977/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | A Trail of Wooden Debris (EW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
e
Amid the Wreckage
  Picking out a path amidst the wreckage seems to be an insurmountable
hurdle, what with pieces of wood littering the ground, things that appear to
be canvas shredded and torn - all in all, crossing this mess is a dismal
prospect.  On the other side of the wreckage, a huge wooden shell looms.  It
curves away on either side and appears to be the remnants of a ship, but
what is a ship doing in the middle of the desert?  The plot proverbially
thickens with every bit of progress into the heart of this mystery.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

Lv 48  G 312313 | The Fissure (NESWD)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* Before a Ruined City
  Ramparts stand half-erect in the distance, posing a paltry defense.  The
sands mock the once-noble structure, dancing across the stones and eroding
the semblance of dignity the walls once held.  The gates gape open, no
longer holding the fort against unwanted visitors; there may have once been
a moat, but it now exists only in the depths of the swarming sand.  The
entrance yawns open, no longer a bulwark against the whims of the outside
world.  

[ Exits: north south ]
A misty cloud of sand.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  965/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Before a Ruined City (NS)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
The Fallen Tower (G)
  Another piteous sign of the trials inflicted on this place appears - a
once-proud tower lies on its side, crumbled in the face of adversity. 
Little did the builders of this fortress know that their ambitions for these
towers to last till eternity have been pulled down and destroyed like a
child's tower of blocks.  Alas, the impermanence and transience of
everything one can hold dear is once again recalled when looking at the
destruction of this tower.  

[ Exits: north ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  951/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Amid the Wreckage (NEW)
e
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
Amid the Wreckage
  A multitude of splinters litter the floor here and the blankets of sand
that rapidly bog down everything it touches probably obscure more.  Little
objects clamor to break through the surface and even though they are
indistinct and masked by the sand, it almost feels like a re-enactment of a
stormy sea swallowing up the terrified passengers of an ill-fated ship. 
Perhaps this is a clue to the cloaked depths of this place.  

[ Exits: south west ]

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  948/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312313 | Amid the Wreckage (SW)
s
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
A Shattered Mast
  The remains of the mast are proof of the immensity of the ship - one
remnant shows two spars lashed together.  A distance away, a shattered
crow's nest lies in a few parts, while tattered remains of the sails cling
desperately to the mast.  How the mighty have been brought low!  - the
crying shame of such a majestic vessel lying broken is evident in the little
shards of wood lying sorrowfully amidst the greedy sand.  

[ Exits: north ]
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
A misty cloud of sand.
A dry wind sweeps the land, and bones, just as dry, rattle in the dust.

Lv 48  G 312313 | Amid the Wreckage (NEW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* A Half-buried Ship Hull
  Strangely enough, this hull is fairly intact, apart from the ragged edges
- it appears to have smashed forcefully into something, which then caused it
to splinter and shatter, strewing bits of stray wood nearby.  Sand has
partially covered this monstrosity, licking at its hulking shape till it can
no longer be clearly seen, making as if to overcome this structure with
little grains of sand.  Although it looks horribly daunting to scale, there
is something about the remains of this great vessel that haunts the soul.  

[ Exits: south ]
     A breach in the hull gives access to the ship's murky interior.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
A Bottomless Chasm?
  Descending into the fissure may have been a grave mistake. The chasm 
stretches downward, disappearing into darkness far below, while above, 
daylight from the now distant surface world can no longer be seen. Damp 
walls, too slick to climb, and chaotic, buffeting currents of air make an 
ascent all but impossible. The only direction available to travel appears to 
be down; deeper into earth, further away from the light.

[ Exits: down other ]
     (Cursed) A stench of evil wafts through the room.

A fearsome creature, witchlike in aspect, looms before you, shrieking insanely, and maddened, lunges
towards you.

walls, too slick to climb, and chaotic, buffeting currents of air make an

be down; deeper into earth, further away from the light.

[ Exits: down other ]
     (Cursed) A stench of evil wafts through the room.

The Fissure
  Here, the landscape dramatically changes.  A large fissure gapes open in
the middle of the ground, seemingly out of nowhere.  The strangeness of such
an occurrence begs the question: why is it here, in the middle of this
accursed place?  Is it, perhaps the key to this desolate place?  It almost
beckons one to crawl in, as if it promises an experience not to be missed. 
But is it merely a lie, a facade, another deception? 

[ Exits: north east south west down ]
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.

982/1016 HP  1341/1401 MP  915/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312533 | The Fissure (NESWD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 


Dry bones chants the phrase 'rlekeok'.

s
Before a Ruined City
  Ramparts stand half-erect in the distance, posing a paltry defense.  The
sands mock the once-noble structure, dancing across the stones and eroding
the semblance of dignity the walls once held.  The gates gape open, no
longer holding the fort against unwanted visitors; there may have once been
a moat, but it now exists only in the depths of the swarming sand.  The
entrance yawns open, no longer a bulwark against the whims of the outside
world.  

[ Exits: north south ]
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
A misty cloud of sand.
Dry white bones, partially buried in the sand.
A dry wind sweeps the land, and bones, just as dry, rattle in the dust.

s
The Fallen Tower (G)
  Another piteous sign of the trials inflicted on this place appears - a
once-proud tower lies on its side, crumbled in the face of adversity. 
Little did the builders of this fortress know that their ambitions for these
towers to last till eternity have been pulled down and destroyed like a
child's tower of blocks.  Alas, the impermanence and transience of
everything one can hold dear is once again recalled when looking at the
destruction of this tower.  

[ Exits: north ]
     Rubble partially conceals an opening in the tower's side.

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
You step into an opening in the rubble and arrive in...
A Nearly Intact Room
  Miraculously, this room has survived this onslaught of fury the sands
have wreaked.  A window can be discerned, a nail on the wall where a
painting once hung. No sign of life remains, but the skeleton of the room is
intact.  One wonders whether this preservation is entirely natural, seeing
as how the sound of the sand is completely dulled in this room.  The only
thing worthy of notice in this room is the curious ring of runes in the
middle of the room, a mercurial surface glinting and reflecting some unseen
light.  

[ Exits: north ]
     Shadowy images flit across the quicksilver surface of this rune-circled pool.
An adventurer is here, contemplating the runes around the pool.

Falling Through the Clouds
  Here, among the dark, racing clouds, lightning arcs, thunder booms and
gale-force winds whip by.  In these flashes of intermittent electrical
illumination a chaotic scene is revealed far below.  Storm swept seas slowly
rotate about a massive void, the maelstrom, and then are inexorably
devoured, dragged down into its abyssal heart.  A doomed ship teeters at the
brink, its panicked crew fighting a losing battle against the current.  

[ Exits: down ]

Rough Seas
  Cresting waves propel stinging surf through the air.  Overcast skies,
drifting banks of fog and the intermittent rain combine into an eerie
twilight, severely reducing visibility.  A deep rumbling from the north,
marking the direction of the maelstrom, nearly drowns out the shouted orders
and panicked cursing coming from the north-east.  

[ Exits: north east west ]

At the Brink
  To the north, the sea begins to curve slowly downward, forming the lip of
the monstrous watery vortex that is the maelstrom.  The restless waters, and
all trapped within, are pulled slowly, inexorably inward and downward, first
rotating clockwise about the rim and then whirling down the maelstrom's
sides.  To the east, a caravel seesaws at the brink, its doomed crew
fighting futilely against the inevitable.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]
This unfortunate sailor tries desperately to keep his head above the churning waters.
This unfortunate sailor tries desperately to keep his head above the churning waters.

A current pushes you deeper into the maelstrom.

1016/1016 HP  1264/1401 MP  1030/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 312761 | Caught in the Maelstrom (D)
>>   *[NOEXP]* The Maelstrom's Heart
  Nearly vertical walls of spinning seawater gradually taper together and
finally collapse here, at the base of the maelstrom.  In a gurgling roar,
the deluge of water then pours into a wide, jagged fissure in the sea floor.
Whatever tectonic cataclysm split open the under-seabed, one thing is clear,
this chasm is the very crux of the maelstrom; its continued draining of the
sea drives that monstrous vortex.  Murk, flotsam and optical distortion
stymie any attempt to peer out through the rushing waters into the undersea
beyond.  

[ Exits: north east south west down ]

>>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

The Great Eastern Desert (971)

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

A small desert mouse scampers for its hole.

Entrance
  You stand in the shade of the temple entrance.  To the south the sun
blazes relentlessly onto the desert sand.  To the north lies the dark and
forbidding entrance to the temple.  From deep within the deserted catacombs
blows a slight breeze, as though the temple were breathing.  The air wafting
from the entrance smells of centuries of decay.  You wonder which is worse,
the hot blazing sun, or the stench of decay coming from within the
synagogue?

Spiral Stairs
  You traverse the dark stone steps leading down into the oppressive
blackness of the temple's lower levels.  Dark wraith-like forms move about,
and your mind begins to wander.  Feelings of terror and despair threaten to

little further down.

836/1016 HP  1202/1401 MP  1159/1279 mv  959tnl  
Lv 48  G 313062 | Approaching a large clinic (NESW)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
s
On the banks of the Dragon River
  The vegetation along the banks of Mesolar's most famous river consists
mostly of cat tails, reeds and rushes.  Here and there, other unidentifiable
greenery makes its presence known.  The smell of mud and fish permeates the
air, and the gurgling of the river is a soothing, pleasant sound.  From
here, the waters of the Dragon River look clean and clear, but the ground
underfoot is damp; thick greenery covers the saturated earth.  To the north
the Mesolarian grassland offers a feast for those who know where to look,
and in the distance a herd of deer make their way over the open expanse.  

[ Exits: north east south west ]

The hot desert sands
  You stand on the scorching sands of the great desert.  To the south the
endless wastes stretch out to eternity.  To the north rises a large stone
structure, made from huge blocks of dark stone.  By the wind worn gargoyles
and other gruesome decor, you assume that this is the ancient temple of some
dark cult.  You can head south into the desert, or make your way north
towards the temple.

Before the entrance to the Underdark
  You stand before a huge door.  The corridor can easily fit fifteen humans
standing side by side here.  The floor has levelled off and has been worn
smooth by the dragging feet of the slave flocks.  You stand just before the
Underdark.  The Underdark is a huge city that rivals its surface
counterpart, Aylor.  From what you have heard, anything goes in the
Underdark.  A dangerous place at best, only those who have had at least ten
levels of experience should venture into it.  On the wall to the north are a
series of markings that you can't make out at this distance.  A huge door
stands to the west, the way to the surface is up.  

[ Exits: (west) up ]
A reptilian man stands in the shadows off to the side.

Jaded Hall Before a Beautiful Door
  You are in a large spacious hall.  The north wall has been covered with
jade and every once in awhile your light dances off the wall into your eye. 
The hall has been lit, but the light that is already there is murky and your
light source seems harsh compared to the soft light that fills the hall.

The hall continues east and west, south is a beautiful door.

Vast Hall
  You stand in a large hall.  The ceiling stands about thirty feet overhead
and shimmers and sparkles.  The floor is made of onyx and is polished.

A Quiet Meadow
  Soft breezes sway the long grasses invitingly.  A slight scent of seawater
drifts from the north where you can just see a rocky outcropping.  Looking
around, you are slightly puzzled.  To the best of your recollection there
was once a quaint little village here.  A well-trodden path leads north
towards the sound of waves crashing against rocks.  
 
A wooden sign sticks up from the grass.

Overlooking a Newly Formed Sea (G)
  Gazing out, all you see is an endless expanse of water.  Far, far below
the waves crash against jagged slices of shoreline.  A thin stretch of beach
is barely visible at the base of the cliffs, and that might just be another
being standing at the water's edge.  The main path continues on right over
the cliff's edge, as if there used to be land there and a place for the path
to go.  Looking around for a possible way down, you spy a fresh trail
heading off to the east.

Halfway Down the Cliff (G)
  A shallow ledge allows you to pause to take a deep breath.  Screeching
gulls swoop overhead, cursing your intrusion of their domain.  Your
trembling fingers are torn and bleeding from scrambling for purchase on the
jagged rock.  The winds whip you mercilessly, almost sending you reeling off
of the sheer face.  Looking up, you see that to attempt to return to safer
ground is near to impossible.  Down seems to be the only option.

At the Base of the Cliff
  At last, you place your feet on solid ground.  Looking up, you can hardly
believe that you actually were able to make it down the cliff unscathed. 
The beach stretches out before you, inviting you to stroll along and
discover the local flora and fauna.  Everywhere you see rampant signs of
flourishing life.  Tide pools teem with small, scurrying creatures and
shells glisten in the sunlight.  All in all, it is a rather picturesque
place.  Further ahead you can make out with certainty the form of a little
green man gazing out over the waters.  Maybe now you can finally find out
what has happened here.  

[ Exits: north up ]

Wandering Along the Beach
  The warm sands cushion your steps as you wander closer to the shoreline. 
There seems to be an abundance of life everywhere...  The sands are patterned
with strange, wavering lines, as if something has crawled from the sea to
further up the beach.  All around you are misshapen lumps of sand, and to
the north a large lump seems to be attracting the attention of quite a few
of the gulls.

At the Shoreline
  Finally, you have reached the water's edge.  Here stands the man you saw
from atop the cliffs.  What is this that he has handed you?  His gaze turns
back out to the turbulent sea, his face sinking into an expression of deep
sadness.  Looking past him, you see a drop off in the shoreline.  There is a
faint luminescence in the water, almost as if a path has been outlined on
the sea's floor.  Perhaps a closer look is worthwhile.

Into the Depths
  Darkness surrounds you.  Only two dim pinpoints of light in the distance
give you direction.  Up above you, the sun can barely be seen in wavering
glimmers.  Down below, the glow that you saw from the shore seems to lead
you even deeper into this unknown realm.  The choice is yours: retreat, or
continue your adventure?

Along the Sea Floor (G)
  Following the light, you reach the floor of this strange water world. 
All around you the dim glow lends eerie shadows to creatures of the deep. 
Shallows and valleys create a type of pathway, leading off to the west
or north.  You sense that either direction will only take you deeper into
the mystery of this bizarre place.

Along the Sea Floor
  This area seems to be strangely devoid of the phosphorescent glow.  A
shiver runs up your spine as you realize that there is something odd about
the shape of the objects here.  Looking closely, you can see that there
seems to be something balancing precariously on a ledge above you.  Could
that possibly be what it looks like?  What in the world is a house doing on
the bottom of the sea?  And how could it have not been beaten to pieces by
whatever cataclysm brought it to these watery depths?

Along the Sea Floor
  Here all pathways meet.  You feel as if you have been wandering in
circles.  There must be some way out of this strange area.  Looking
closely, you see that the paths to the east, west and north seem to

Along the Sea Floor
  Dimly lit, this space is close and cramped.  The ceiling seems to press
down upon you.  Reaching up, you feel something odd.  It is a smooth surface,
with what might be a clasp or lock of some kind.  Peering through the murky
darkness, you realize that this is another house, again strangely intact. 
However, whatever force brought this house here hasn't left it unscathed. 
It is actually upside down, lodged between two rocks!  Perhaps you can
explore it further by opening what just might be a window over your head.

A House Under the Sea?
  Whooosh!  Your lungs fill with air.  Whatever caused this house to tumble
into the depths must have happened so quickly that the air was trapped
inside it.  Amazingly enough, everything in this house is right where you
would expect it.  In fact, it even seems as if someone might well still
reside here, as there are quite a few homey touches.  Powerful protective
magic must be afoot here, for this strange happenstance to have taken place.

Into the Depths

At the Shoreline
  Finally, you have reached the water's edge.  Here stands the man you saw
from atop the cliffs.  What is this that he has handed you?  His gaze turns
back out to the turbulent sea, his face sinking into an expression of deep
sadness.  Looking past him, you see a drop off in the shoreline.  There is a
faint luminescence in the water, almost as if a path has been outlined on
the sea's floor.  Perhaps a closer look is worthwhile.

A Coral Cavern (G)
  Here, the walls rise high overhead.  The water rushes in from behind you,
trying to push you farther along.  Grabbing onto a jutting wall, you pause
to get your bearings.  To your left you can see a small cave, virtually
undetectable without close examination.  To the north, the coral closes in
again, with barely enough room for you to pass.

A Dead End
  The darkness closes around you as you reach the end of the passageway. 
Reaching out blindly, your hand meets the closest wall.  There is barely
room to turn full circle and you can feel yourself becoming disoriented. 
Pulse pounding, you frantically scramble to feel your way out.  There, a
slight niche, just overhead.  This is not the way that you came in, but
possibly a way to escape this inky darkness.

The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.

Boot Clan Public Hall (G)
  You have wandered out of the Academy and into Boot Camps clanhall. 
Clans are a special thing on aardwolf allowing like minded people to 
come together. Read help clans for more information. Boot Camp is a 
clan designed to help new players learn more about the game and we 
enjoy doing it. Read help boot and help newbieclan to learn more. 
This area is not a part of the Academy and the first thing you should 
do on Aardwolf is complete the Academy goal. We offer newbie starter 
kits to all new players. If you would like one please send a member a 
tell. You can type who boot to see who is online. If they do not 
respond then they are most likely afk. All items in our newbie kits 
are also sold in this shop. Type list if you would like to take a look 
at them. To return to the Academy type north.

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1059/1279 mv  984tnl  
Lv 48  G 313217 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
help spells
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Skills Spells.
Help Category : Miscellaneous.
Related Helps : Allspells, Practice, Qspells, Showskill, Forgetskill.
Last Updated  : 2015-10-12 16:47:11.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: skills ((<from level> <to level>) (<filter>) | all)
        spells ((<from level> <to level>) (<filter>) | all)

The skills and spells commands are used to display your character's list of
available skills (or spells, as the case may be).  They are listed in order
of level.  The practiced percentage is listed, as well as the spell number
(see 'help cast') and casting cost for spells.

Without a level range, these commands will show all abilities from level 1
to your current level.  Specifying a range will show all skills/spells for
the given range.  Forgotten Skills or spells (see 'help forgetskill') are
not displayed unless the 'all' option is used.

You may also use any of the following filters for these commands:

    Affected   - abilities currently affecting you
    Area       - abilities that target an entire room
    Attack     - abilities that add an additional attack to combat
    Bad        - abilities that cause a bad affect on the target
    Combat     - combat-based abilities
    Curative   - abilities that remove bad affects
    Dodge      - the basic dodge abilities
    Healing    - abilities that heal, or affect healing
    Learned    - abilities that have been practiced above 1%
    Movement   - abilities that transport you or others
    Nofail     - all nofail abilities (see 'help nofail')
    Object     - abilities that are used on objects
    Other      - abilities that can be used on others
    Passive    - abilities that are used automatically
    Pets       - abilities that create or control pets
    Resist     - abilities that add resistances
    Spellup    - beneficial abilities
    <Stat>     - abilities that give a bonus to the given stat
    <Damtype>  - any damage type such as 'fire' - see 'help damtypes'
    Stats      - abilities that add any stats
    Unaffected - abilities that are currently NOT affecting you
    Weapon     - weapon skills

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1059/1279 mv  984tnl

1016/1016 HP  1401/1401 MP  1279/1279 mv  984tnl

>>   *[NOEXP]* 
help scry
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Help Keywords : Scry.
Help Category : Detection.
Related Helps : Wish.
Last Updated  : 2017-08-27 23:37:31.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Syntax: cast scry <target>
Spell Number: 236

Using this ancient art, a high-powered spellcaster can magically spy upon
others from afar.  The target will only sense a presence, but will never know
who exactly it was.  However, some characters have been able to wish for the
ability to see who is scrying them, and the caster will never be quite sure
who has been granted this wish.

Primary Stats: Int, Wis, Luck.


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Lv 48  G 313217 | Medical lounge (E[D])
>>   *[NOEXP]*

Scry whom?

e
Boot Camp Headquarters (G)
  As you enter the Boot Camp Headquarters, you immediately notice that
the large main hall is adorned with feasting tables and fire pits
allowing the green recruits to relax after a hard days training.
A large mural on the northern wall depicts the founding members of the
Boot Camp standing before The Fallen Soldier on an ancient battlefield.
The other stone walls are decorated in the green and yellow insignia of
Boot Camp and various 'Boot Needs You' posters depicting an alluring Diva
dressed in the Boot Camp colours pointing at you.
From the arches leading out of the hall drift sounds of young recruits
being put through their paces and the smells of gunpowder and mud linger
in the air.

[ Exits: north east (south) west up down ]
(Player) (White Aura) Nueve 10 is resting here.
A Grumpy Old General stands here, shouting orders at the new recruits.

Mudpits (G)
  You stand in a training field with wet and muddy grounds.
As you continue down the fields,you realize that 
this was once a battlefield of the worthy and ruthless
but it has now been swept and turned into a training
ground.
Apart from the worn paths and unpleasant pools of mud,
this field is still be used as a training center, and
an older man in a brown uniform who is as tough as
nails.

Gunney Sergeant waits here to train you to exhaustion.

1016/1016 HP  659/1401 MP  1277/1279 mv  984tnl  
Lv 48  G 313217 | Mudpits (EWD)
>>   *[NOEXP]* Recreation Room (G)
  Walking into the room, you notice there is a relaxed, friendly atmosphere and
almost everyone is in military uniform. A jukebox is playing a lively tune 
and some of the patrons are having fun dancing to the music. The sound of 
laughter coming from one end of the bar, as someone has just delivered the 
punch line of a good joke. Plush, comfortable looking, couches are scattered 
around the large room in clusters of two and three, allowing for more 
intimate gatherings and private conversations. The enlisted and the officers 
mingle together amicably and everyone is on excellent terms with the 
bartender.

[ Exits: east south west ]
An old veteran stands behind the bar, ready to serve you a cool drink.

Mesolarian Grassland (1266)

A Quiet Meadow
  Soft breezes sway the long grasses invitingly.  A slight scent of seawater
drifts from the north where you can just see a rocky outcropping.  Looking
around, you are slightly puzzled.  To the best of your recollection there
was once a quaint little village here.  A well-trodden path leads north
towards the sound of waves crashing against rocks.

Overlooking a Newly Formed Sea (G)
  Gazing out, all you see is an endless expanse of water.  Far, far below
the waves crash against jagged slices of shoreline.  A thin stretch of beach
is barely visible at the base of the cliffs, and that might just be another
being standing at the water's edge.  The main path continues on right over
the cliff's edge, as if there used to be land there and a place for the path
to go.  Looking around for a possible way down, you spy a fresh trail
heading off to the east.

Halfway Down the Cliff (G)
  A shallow ledge allows you to pause to take a deep breath.  Screeching
gulls swoop overhead, cursing your intrusion of their domain.  Your
trembling fingers are torn and bleeding from scrambling for purchase on the
jagged rock.  The winds whip you mercilessly, almost sending you reeling off
of the sheer face.  Looking up, you see that to attempt to return to safer
ground is near to impossible.  Down seems to be the only option.

d
At the Base of the Cliff
  At last, you place your feet on solid ground.  Looking up, you can hardly
believe that you actually were able to make it down the cliff unscathed. 
The beach stretches out before you, inviting you to stroll along and
discover the local flora and fauna.  Everywhere you see rampant signs of
flourishing life.  Tide pools teem with small, scurrying creatures and
shells glisten in the sunlight.  All in all, it is a rather picturesque
place.  Further ahead you can make out with certainty the form of a little
green man gazing out over the waters.  Maybe now you can finally find out
what has happened here.  

[ Exits: north up ]

1016/1016 HP  386/1401 MP  1270/1279 mv  984tnl  
Lv 48  G 313217 | A Dead End ([E]U)
>>   *[NOEXP]* A Storage Room
  Dark and dismal, this room has long since stopped being a store house
for the inhabitants.  Empty shelves line the walls; dust and a glowing
fungus are the only inventory.  The only thing that makes this room
noteworthy in any way is the fact that it is an air pocket, albeit one
filled with stale air.  

[ Exits: down ]
An emaciated Wooble sits here, mourning the feast-filled days of old.
Scraggy Wooble eyes you suspiciously.
Scraggy Wooble exclaims 'What do you want? I don't know you... Get away from me!'
Scraggy Wooble peers at you intently.
Scraggy Wooble says 'You don't have any food, do you? I'm kind of hungry.'
Scraggy Wooble says 'But I'm picky! Very picky. Could go for some rabbit right now, though.'

1016/1016 HP  386/1401 MP  1266/1279 mv  984tnl  
Lv 48  G 313217 | A Storage Room (D)
>>   *[NOEXP]* 
exam Scraggy
Painfully thin, this poor little fellow is in sore need of a good meal. 
His skin is flaky and due to its poor condition looks more grey than green. 
His hair is clumped nattily to his head, and the hat he wears seems to be
adhered with the grime that encases him.  It may take more than a dip in
the water to help this Wooble back to health.  
 
Scraggy Wooble is in perfect health.

Scraggy Wooble is using:
[ Worn on head        ]: (Magic) a Dirty White Beanie

l;ex
A Storage Room
  Dark and dismal, this room has long since stopped being a store house
for the inhabitants.  Empty shelves line the walls; dust and a glowing
fungus are the only inventory.  The only thing that makes this room
noteworthy in any way is the fact that it is an air pocket, albeit one
filled with stale air.

26% HP (you) |  Enemy: 72% HP (mob) >>   *[NOEXP]* The Grand City of Aylor (G)
  You stand on the edge of the beautiful City of Aylor.
 
A bright light shines down from the heavens, pouring over you, bathing you
in its warm glow.  Everything around you seems rich and pure in color.  An
enormous, white temple stands to the north, taking up most of your view.
 
To reach the Aylorian Academy, you must travel up the large staircase that
stands just off the side of the church.  (Type 'UP' to learn how to play the
game.)
 
Below you are large piles of armor and equipment discarded by other
adventurers.
